notes: On 12 March 2022, a police officer fatally shot an unarmed man near the bus stop at 75th Avenue and Buckeye Road in Phoenix (Arizona). The police officer responded to a call at the bus stop, and directed two men to leave the bus. The two men exited, and one got into a parked police vehicle and began to drive away. The officer approached the moving vehicle from the side, stepped onto the footboard and fired three shots through the driver's side window. The driver crashed into a tree shortly after. He died later at the hospital. The officer was treated for minor injuries. The officer involved in this shooting had yet to receive a judgement on whether or not he engaged in criminal wrongdoing during a separate incident, when he shot an killed an armed suspect on 3 April 2021, at the time of this incident. The man who was shot was known to be experiencing homelessness.

The parents were released later but the rest were still being detained.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-) Border Patrol
notes: On 19 February 2022, a US Border Patrol officer shot and killed a Mexican migrant in Skeleton Canyon, near the town of Douglas (Arizona). The migrant was traveling with at least nine other migrants - when they encountered two border patrol agents, the migrants fled. When chasing a migrant, one of the agents said the man turned and threw a punch at him, after which a struggle ensued. The agent claimed that he feared for his life, asserting that the migrant picked up a large rock during the struggle, and that he then opened fire and killed the migrant in self-defense. No one else witnessed the shooting. Other migrants traveling with the man who was killed claimed that agents appeared to move his body and tamper with evidence. They also claimed that the agent's partner advised him to say that he feared for his life and to claim that the slain man had picked up a rock, which a subsequent investigation described as a possible indication that agents attempted to cover up evidence. Multiple migrants also claimed that a border patrol agent said 'this is America motherfucker' while apprehending them - some of these migrants claimed that the border patrol agent who killed the migrant they were traveling with was the agent who said this. On 9 May 2022, the Cochise County Attorney's Office announced that it had insufficient evidence to bring charges against the border patrol agent because his description of events appeared justified under Arizona self-defense laws, though it did confirm that the Border Patrol crime scene response unit, the Critical Incident Teams, was involved in the case. This unit has since been 'disbanded after years of allegations of tampering with investigations and evidence in cases involving the deaths of migrants.' An attorney for the family of the migrant who was killed has stated that they intend to file a lawsuit.

source: Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 19 February 2022, in Pay Lel village of Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), a group of military soldiers and Pyu Saw Htee members fired about 30 artillery rounds, killing 4 civilians who were hiding in their house. Two others, one from the same house, were also shot and killed. Locals said there were no previous armed clashes or PDFs in the village. They reported that the military fired at those who ran away and many villagers went missing.

On 18 February 2022, a dentist was shot dead by the Taliban forces after he failed to stop at a checkpoint on the Kabul University road in Kabul city. Taliban officials claimed that a group of Taliban wanted to arrest some robbers but as the passengers got scared and refused to stop, they shot in the air that resulted in killing of the doctor.
On 18 February 2022, soldiers shot and wounded a male civilian when he approached the entrance of the military camp in the city of Gaoua (Gaoua, Poni).

On 18 February 2022, in La Argentina (Huila), one farmer was killed in a suspected case of police brutality in the Lozada neighborhood. An officer shot the victim twice after the patrol attended a call for a domestic incident. Police sources claimed the victim tried to attack the officers. 1 fatality.

notes: On 18 February 2022, 13 CCC members were severely assaulted and injured in an alley in Harare (Harare Urban, Harare) for holding 'car rallies' by police officers. The group was arrested and taken to custody after the attack.

notes: On 18 February 2022, in Man Pong village of Momauk township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), the military LIB-437 stopped two men passing by their battalion compound on a motorbike at around 10 pm and shot and killed them.

Around 18 February 2022 (between 16 - 21 February), in Wari Suphalai village (Demoso township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military set fire to houses in the village and abducted some villagers to use as human shields.

On 18 February 2022, 1 civilian, a friend of a kidnapper, was arrested and tortured by the Taliban in Qarabagh district, Kandahar [coded as Kandahar with GP3]. He died as a result of the torture. The kidnapper, the brother of a Taliban commander, and 2 of his friends kidnapped a girl, but the civilian who was killed wasn't part of the kidnapping.

On 18 February 2022, a dissident was kidnapped by a few unidentified men in Dalingxin village in Xixiangtang District (Nanning, Guangxi) and became incommunicado. It was suspected that his forced disappearance was due to his activism calling for an investigation into the case of a human trafficking incident where a woman was filmed chained in a freezing outbuilding in Feng county, Xuzhou. This incident has gone viral online after her video was released and caused public outrage calling for investigation.

The officer was arrested and charged for homicide. Footage showed that the victim did not act violently. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 6 February 2022, a Hemingway police officer attempted to pull over a car that had rolled through a stop sign in Hemingway. The car failed to stop after which the officer pursued the vehicle. A few minutes later, the car crashed into a ditch in Georgetown (South Carolina), which is in a neighboring county. The driver of the car, a Black man, attempted to exit through the passenger side when the officer shot him in the chest, killing him. The officer, who is also Black, testified that she did not see the driver brandishing a weapon nor was a weapon found at the scene. On 9 February 2022, the officer was arrested and charged with voluntary manslaughter in the shooting.

On 6 February 2022, in Habana (La Habana), the leader of activist group Ladies in White and her husband were violently assaulted by a group of pro-government groups, Rapid Response Brigade (BRR) and officers of the Cuban State Security. The couple were prevented from attending church by the perpetrators for the third week in a row. The paramilitaries threw a large stone at the activist's husband, tackled him to the ground, and arrested him. The leader of the Ladies in White was also arrested and released hours later. The activist has been a vocal opponent of the regime, demanding the release of political prisoners imprisoned after the 11 July protests in 2021. actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
source: KARE11; New York Times; Minnesota Daily
notes: On 2 February 2022, SWAT Team police officers shot and killed a young Black man in Minneapolis (Minnesota) while carrying out a no-knock warrant search involving a homicide. The victim was not named as a suspect in the warrant, nor was he a resident of the apartment. Police bodycam video shows that one officer kicked the back of the couch, where the victim was asleep under a blanket, jarring him awake and making a gun visible. Police were shooting at the car while riding in the village of Melissatika until the teenager reached his residence. There were bullet holes in the car and in the walls of the house, but there were no injuries. The Panhellenic Confederation of Greek Roma (Ellan Passe) reported unnecessary use of firearms.

On 3 January 2022, in Zee Taw (South) village of Pauk township (coded as Pauk) (Pakoku district, Magway region), the police forces shot and killed a farmer returning from farm.

Around 3 January 2022 (between 2 - 3 January), in Kyauk Myaung town of Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a man was killed during military interrogation. He was arrested on January 2 with three others and brought to the military's LIB-12 base. Neighbors heard screaming, begging and forced chanting such as 'the revolution will fall.' His family was told to retrieve his dead body the next day.

On 3 January 2022, in Nyaung Pin Gyi Taw village of Wetlet township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military fired indiscriminately at the village from two helicopters and killed two villagers while two other helicopters landing and deploying their troops.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force

On 3 January 2022, one police officer severely beat up and injured a journalist at the police barracks of Sekondi-Takoradi town (Sekondi Takoradi, Western), after he resisted arrest.

On 3 January 2022, in Llana Alta (Norte de Santander), a man was shot and wounded in the leg by a military officer when he was going to his house after armed clashes had taken place in the area (coded separately). The army had detained four people and then shot the man. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

Police shot and killed a man. The victim's family claim he did not resist the intervention. Police officers claim the victim was not shot and suffered a sudden death. However, the forensic report confirms he was killed by a bullet. The victim's family and friends held a protest asking for justice. 1 fatality.
On 3 January 2022, a government soldier (SNA) shot and killed a civilian in Nur Hawad area at the Koshin village in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).
On 3 January 2022, police officer shot and killed a tuk-tuk driver at the Ex-control Afgooye in Mogadishu - Daynile (Banadir).

Around 2 January 2022 (between 1 - 3 January), in Tamwe township (Yangon-East, Yangon region), a man who was arrested on 1 January by military forces who were conducting checks at his home for overnight guests later died during interrogation. His family was informed of his death on 3 January.

On 2 January 2022, in Mindat township (Mindat district, Chin State) the Myanmar military forces stationed at 16 Miles West of Mindat town fired at local civilians traveling around the area. Casualties unknown.

source: Hasht-e Subh; Afghan Peace Watch; Twitter

On 2 January 2022, a soldier beat a man to death in Gumba in the district of Kibaha (Kibaha Urban, Pwani). He was accused of stealing the soldier's chicken.

On 1 January 2022, in Carapegua (Paraguari), a police officer threw tear gas at a bar with civilians. At least ten people were hospitalized due to injuries. Reasons for the attack are unclear, but the bar was located behind a police station. The tear gas was used when members of a music group started singing in the morning to celebrate the New Year. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards

Around 1 January 2022 (between 31 December - 2 January), in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), a local celebrity who was one of the six civilians arrested by the military forces on 31 December 2021 died in custody on 2 January 2022.

On 1 January 2022, a woman was killed by the Taliban when as she failed to stop at a Taliban mobile checkpost as she was riding with her husband and her kids on motorcycle, in Afshar Silo area of Kabul.

On 1 January 2022, an old man and a young boy were injured by the Taliban in Taluqan city of Takhar because they did not attend congregational prayers in the mosque. Local sources claimed that Taliban punished the two by pushing them into a water stream causing injury to them.

On 1 January 2022, a civilian was shot in the head and killed by police officers in Kulu district of Konya. Police forces opened fire targeting a vehicle after it failed to comply the police order to stop at a police checkpoint and escaped by his vehicle. One of the three civilians inside the vehicle was shot in the head and later died at the hospital, succumbing to his injuries. One police officer was arrested following the incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Libya (2021-) Prison Guards

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards

Around 1 January 2022 (beginning of month), 11 Tibetans monks were beaten and arrested by the authorities in Luhuo (also known as Drago) county (Ganzi, Sichuan) for spreading news of the destruction of a 99-foot Buddha statue and 45 traditional prayer wheels. A few of them sustained injuries from beatings and torture. The government demolished the local Buddha statue in December 2021 as an ongoing campaign to eradicate Tibet's distinct national culture and religion.
Around 1 January 2022 (month of), 2 former policemen were arrested by the Taliban in the Hukam Qala village of Giro district [coded as Pana with GP2], Ghazni. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 31 December 2021, in Kone Yoe village of Ye-U township (coded as Ye-U) (Shwebo district Sagaing region), the military forces from Ywar Thar Ywar and In Taw villages shot two farmers near the cemetery while stopping at the Kone Yoe village cemetery. One of the two farmers was hit by a bullet and injured and the other escaped.
On 31 December 2021, near Kone Yoe village, Taze township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region) the Myanmar military forces shot two local civilians and injured one for unknown reason.

On 31 December 2021, near Zee Taw village, Pauk township (Pakokku district, Magway region) the Myanmar police forces and Pyu Saw Htee members shot dead a civilian at around 11:20 am for unknown reason.

On 31 December 2021, personnel of the Mizoram police shot at and injured two farmers, in Aizawl district (Tlangnuam, Mizoram), when they entered Mizoram for jhum cultivation. The personnel suspected them to have entered the state carrying drugs.

On 31 December 2021, in Guiria (Sucre), two police detectives opened fire against a group of civilians on Bolivar street, killing two women and wounding two others. Authorities initially reported the victims were caught in the crossfire during an armed clash with a criminal group; however, later reports indicate the detectives may have been drinking and were placed under investigation for their actions. 2 injured, 2 fatalities.

On 31 December 2021, according to the victim's relatives, police severely beat a man taken in custody for being drunk in a bus stop in Rechytsa. The man later died on the way to the hospital as a result of the beating, which could be seen on the face of the deceased and on the hematomas on his back, although the police denies any violence and claims that the cause of the death is severe alcoholic and narcotic intoxication. According to the victim's parents, the head injuries could be also the result of shots from pneumatic guns, but that could not be established without an independent autopsy.

On 27 January 2022, she sent a message outside revealing a worsening heart problem.

The victim of the attack and arrest is a member of the Union of Honduran Political Prisoners (UPP). There were no fatalities.

On 19 November 2021, a man was shot and killed by a policeman over his refusal to pay a bribe in Jalingo (Jalingo, Taraba). The victim died in the hospital on 23 November, other sources report that the victim was shot following an altercation with the policeman.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
notes: On 19 November 2021, Oromia Liyu police killed a civilian in Gebre Guracha, Kuyu Woreda (North Shewa) after taking him to prison. The victim was a 70 years old elder who was repeatedly arrested by the police and accused of motivating his son to be a member of OLF Shane rebels.
On 19 November 2021, a suspected plain cloth police officer abducted a businessman in Moyale town (Moyale, Marsabit).

Around 19 November 2021 (as reported), in Kyin Lein and Taw Ma villages, Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region) Myanmar military forces randomly shot gunfire and injured an elderly person in a village. The military forces also arrested and tortured villagers.

Around 19 November 2021 (as reported), in Ye-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military searched two regional NLD MPs in Chaung Nar, In Taing and Tha Pyay Kone villages by beating up and interrogating villagers.

On 19 November 2021, police officers arrested a group of women after prayers at the mosque and took them to the police station in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The women was forced to strip naked and was then assaulted with stinging nettles and had to undergo invasive body searches and were later released. One women was found dead after being released.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 19 November 2021, police SNR abducted 2 civilians, at least 1 was a CNL youth leader, and killed another in Mparambo 1 (Rugombo, Cibitoke).
On 19 November 2021, military forces abducted two teachers suspected to be ADF militants in Kampala (Central). They were taken to an unknown location and have not been found since the abduction.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-); Women (United States)
notes: On 19 November 2021, a sergeant attempted to pepper spray a suspect who was already restrained in a police vehicle in Sunrise (Florida). A woman officer pulled the sergeant away from the suspect, at which point the sergeant turned on the officer and grabbed her by the throat and pushed her against a patrol car. An internal affairs investigation is ongoing.

Around 19 November 2021 (as reported), a man claimed that he was beaten and tortured by the district governor of Taliban in Marmul district of Balkh province because of having photos and music in his cellphone.

On 19 November 2021, in Ywar Thar (Ywar Thar Yar) village, Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region) the Myanmar soldiers arrived in the village and shot civilians who were running away out of fear of the military. The shooting killed a 14 years-old boy and injured 2 others, including a 7-year-old boy.

On 18 November 2021, Malian forces opened fire at a civilian in the vicinity of a control post in the area of Bourem (Bourem, Gao), causing his death and claiming that he was driving at a very high speed against the orders.

source: Ministry of Defense - NUG; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 18 November 2021, in Ah Nauk Taw village of Kya Htoe village tract (coded as Pakokku) (Pakokku township, Pakokku district, Magway region), a man was shot dead by a patrol of military and police forces while walking in front of his house.

On 18 November 2021, in Nat Nan village of Wundwin township (coded as Wundwin) (Meiktila district, Mandalay region), about 80 military troops arrived and opened fire on the villagers as they fled in fear. Two men including a university student were killed and twelve other villagers were arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Iran (1989-) Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps
notes: On 18 November 2021, IRGC troops raided a house on a warrant in Saravan city (Sistan and Balochestan) and killed a Baloch civilian in the process.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 18 November 2021 (as reported), a former rebel fighter died under torture in Sidnaya Military Prison. He was arrested more than a year ago.

On 18 November 2021, in Camaguey, Camaguey, police beat and arrested the coordinator of the Patriotic Union of Cuba (UNPACU) in the province of Camaguey. The State Security Agents broke into the man's house and violently arrested him, beating him out.

On 18 November 2021, in Thanbyuzayat township (Mawlamyine district, Mon State) the Myanmar military shot dead a journalist and his wife who were traveling near a security checkpoint in Thanbyuzayat township. The military force shot them because they refused to stop at security check point.

On 18 November 2021, in Chauk Maing (coded as San Pya Chauk Maing) village, Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah State) Myanmar military forces shot dead 2 civilians, a married couple near Christian church building in the evening for unknown reason.

On 18 November 2021, police officers detained and tortured a 36-year-old male resident at the police station in the town of Nura of Qaraghandy region. The victim's family members claimed that it resulted in his suicide following detention. District police denied that torture took place.
On 18 November 2021, in Na Bar village (Indaw township, Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a freelance journalist. She was beaten during the arrest and her belongings were seized.

actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
notes: On 18 November 2021, a man in his 40s who was returning from China to North Korea was arrested by border security soldiers at Kimhyongjik County and beaten by them during his arrest and investigation. The man testified that he had gone to China to receive money, but soldiers took the money and charged him for smuggling in violation of state quarantine policies. Until the Ministry of State Security conducts his preliminary hearing, he would be isolated for coronavirus quarantine for 30 days.

Around 18 November 2021 (as reported), a woman who spoke out about a Taliban commander attempting to rape her the week prior (coded in a separate event), was killed by the Taliban in Afghanistan (coded to Mahmood Raqi Kapisa with GP3 where she was a resident, no further info on the location). She was sister of a former military soldier and she was beaten and tortured by the Taliban commander last week because she refused to accept his sexual demand. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 18 November 2021, in Guantanamo, Guantanamo, police officers beat and arrested an activist and coordinator of the Eastern Democratic Alliance (ADO). This act occurred amidst detentions and acts of repudiation against activists and civilians who supported the anti-government demonstration 'Civic March for Change' scheduled for 15 November.

source: La Prensa (Argentina); Indymedia Argentina; Diario El Dia
notes: On 18 November 2021, in San Clemente del Tuyu (Buenos Aires), police officers beat and choked a man to death inside the police station. The victim had been arrested three days earlier for 'disturbing the peace'. Nine officers were detained. 1 fatality.
On 18 November 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), the military raided a private residence. Three INGO national staff members were injured by military forces during the raid.

On 17 November 2021, the police forces tortured one suspect under their custody in Douala city, Douala 1 subdivision (Wouri, Littoral). The victim was arrested after a private dispute with a police officer. He later died of his wounds. Three police officers were later arrested in connection to that incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: Around 17 November 2021 (week of), regional special forces and militias killed 4 youths in an unknown rural location (coded to Inango) in Lalo Asabi wereda (West Wellega, Oromia) after accusing them of supporting OLF Shane militants.

assoc_actor_2: MDC: Movement for Democratic Change Alliance
notes: On 17 November 2021, police attacked and used tear gas against MDC Alliance members gathered at the Vova shopping center in Nkayi (Nkayi, Matabeleland North). The group was waiting to meet the MDC A leader, Chamisa. There were no casualties.
On 17 November 2021, in Yae Lel Kyun area (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military arrested ten locals and used them as human shields.

On 17 November 2021, in Myin Thar village (Thabeikkyin Township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military arrested a 40-year-old teacher who was participating in the CDM and a villager on suspicion of having connection with the PDF. Both of them were beaten and a teacher was tortured to death in custody and died later on the same day.

On 17 November 2021, police physically assaulted and beat a journalist who was filming a corridor in the Moscow Oblast court in Krasnogorsk, where he had come for a hearing in the case of two colleagues of his. Police suffocated the man in an attempt to make him fall to the ground. The victim was hospitalized with a concussion as a result of the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
notes: On 17 November 2021, Anti-Terrorism military forces shot dead a suspected ADF leader in Nsangi (Busiro, Wakiso), while he was trying to run away from arrest. The man was responsible for recruiting suicide bombers that had detonated themselves on the previous day (coded separately). UPDF claimed there was a clash between soldiers and the suspected ADF militiaman, but witnesses, family members and others refused this claim, declaring this was an extrajudicial killing. There was one fatality.

On 17 November 2021, 2 farmers accused by the military of being NPA militants were killed by the military in Barangay Taquico (Sampaloc, Quezon, Calabarzon). The military also reported retrieving weapons from the fatalities. However, human rights group Karapatan claimed that the fatalities were mere coconut farmers, and cited local witnesses who said that no exchange of gunfire took place. Karapatan also said that the fatalities' bodies bore signs of torture. One of the fatalities was a senior citizen with a disability. Makabayan bloc lawmakers sought a Congressional probe on the incident.

On 17 November 2021, in Aungpan town (Aungpan township, Kalaw district, Shan-South state), a 50-year old man was shot by the military forces as he was driving his motorcycle honking and speeding near the military forces stationed at the school in Hle Yoe ward. His whereabouts are unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: On 17 November 2021, SNR agents attacked and injured a member of the CNL in the SNR prison of Kayanza town (Kayanza, Kayanza). The victim was transferred to the hospital Of Kayanza the following day. He was accused of partnering with rebel groups.

source: Javanehha; Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA)
notes: On 17 November 2021, Iranian police fired upon a fisherman in the wetlands of Hoveizeh county (capital Hoveyzeh as reference, Khuzestan) killing him as a result.
On 17 November 2021, regime forces detained and physically assaulted two civilians during a raid in Mseifra town in Dara countryside, following an attack on a member of the regime forces.

Around 17 November 2021 (as reported), in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the military informed family members of a Christian pastor who had been arrested on 23 September that he died during interrogation.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 17 November 2021, SNR agents abducted a CNL member from Mutimbuzi commune (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

source: Indymedia Argentina; Quilmes Presente; Diario De Cuyo
notes: On 17 November 2021, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), off-duty police officers shot young men in a car, injuring one in the head, who later died in the hospital, and arresting three others. The victims claimed they were trying to run away, believing the officers were robbers. An investigation was being carried out, and it was confirmed that it was a case of police violence and that the officers created a version where a clash took place. The police officers who were involved were put under arrest. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 16 November 2021, FACA forces stormed a football player's house in Paoua (Ouham-Pende), after he had assaulted a FACA officer, who was refereeing a soccer game, a few days earlier. FACA forces attacked and shot him, but the victim was able to escape without injury. The FACA then stole his money and belongings, and destroyed his property. MINUSCA peacekeepers then intervened, without engaging in any clash, to stop the FACA from perpetrating the destruction and theft of the home. There were no fatalities nor injuries

notes: On 16 November 2021, SNR agents abducted a CNL member in Buringa zone (Gihanga, Bubanza).

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 16 November 2021, in Patos de Minas (Minas Gerais), a man was shot and killed by military police forces during an intervention in the Alto da Serra neighborhood. According to the officers, it was a case of disobedience and resisting arrest. Family members of the victim claim the officers forced their way into their residence, used tasers and pepper spray on family members and shot the victim dead. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Around 16 November 2021, Houthi forces tortured a citizen until he lost consciousness in the Security Department of At Tuhayta city (At Tuhayat, Al Hudaydah) after they arrested tens of citizens following their takeover of At Tuhayat district. The reason for the arrests is unknown.

On 16 November 2021, in Kan Peit village (Amarapura township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military troops interrogated and beat up villagers, accusing them of destroying leaflets threatening to lock up houses of villagers those have connection with the PDF.

On 16 November 2021, in Kanpetlet township (Mindat district, Chin state), 70 military soldiers abducted and beat two ethnic Chin men after the military found photos of guns on their mobile phones. One of them escaped with injuries.

On 16 November 2021, in Gyipwayee ward (Thingangyun Township, Yangon-east district, Yangon region), the military stormed a five-storey apartment on Thamin Bayan Road and shot and killed a young man. They also beat up and arrested three others. The military accused them of being PDF members.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 16 November 2021, in Goiania (Goias), two men were beaten up and injured by military police forces during a patrol. One victim was severely injured, taken to hospital, but did not survive. Medical staff confirmed the victim died due to multiple trauma. 1 fatality.

On 16 November 2021, police officers fired warning shots and beat displaced people during a WFP food disbursement in Chiure (Chiure, Cabo Delgado). People were accused of stealing rice. One man was arrested.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
notes: On 16 November 2021, in Hpa Laung Taung village (Hpa-An township, Hpa-An district, Kayin state), the joint forces of the military and the Border Guard Force shot and wounded two female students returning from school.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 16 November 2021, SNR agents abducted a CNL activist from Ngagara (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). He was taken to an unknown location.
On 15 November 2021, counter-narcotics police fired upon Balochi civilians driving a vehicle in Qaleh Ganj city (Kerman) killing one and injuring another.

On 15 November 2021, the gendarmerie forces opened fire on a Bakweri traditional dance group in Bonduma village, Buea subdivision (Fako, Sud-Ouest), killing the group leader and injuring another person.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service

notes: On 15 November 2021, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter and fish trader in Gishenyi (Giteranyi, Muyinga). Imbonerakure likely took part in the abduction, having destroyed a trading stall and goods of the civilian just before the SNR arrived.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 15 November 2021, in Htantabin township (Yangon-north district, Yangon region), family members said the military wrongly shot and arrested four Muslim youths who were returning from Taikkyi. This was in connection with an earlier shooting of Tasone police station. One of four youths in the car was shot dead.

source: Shan Herald Agency for News; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: On 15 November 2021, in Pekon township (Taunggyi district, Shan-south), the military arrested a volunteer who was helping displaced civilians at IDP camps along with other seven people. He was beaten during the arrest. He later died on 17 November during interrogation at 7th Military Operations Command (MOC-7), due to injuries consistent with torture.

On 15 November 2021, in Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), the military seized an ambulance on the highway between Kanpetlet and Saw and shot a young man on a motorcycle. Casualties unknown.

On 15 November 2021, in Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), two civilians had been taken as guides by the military troops on the border between Kanpetlet Township and Saw Township. They had been tortured and sustained multiples wounds. Two days later, both of them fled with two guns seized from the military troops and one of them arrived at the PDF-Saw camp.

On 15 November 2021, in Mogoke township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military shot and arrested three locals in Ho Hmine ward in relation to an explosion near the high school (No.2). One of them was shot and injured in his arms while hiding from soldiers.

On 15 November 2021, in Kun Ohn village (Ye-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces entered the village and villagers were forced to flee. A mentally ill man who did not escape was shot and killed by the military forces.

On 15 November 2021, in Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military and Pyu Saw Htee abducted three villagers from Ah Nauk Taw village and shot them in the head and killed them at Tel Taw junction near the Mingin-Kani road.

On 15 November 2021, in Hlaing township (Yangon-west, Yangon), the military raided an apartment in Hlaing Myint Moe Housing. Eyewitnesses claimed that three of the five youths living in that apartment were killed and other two were arrested during the raid. The military accused them of being PDF members.

source: Abante; GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 15 November 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Santa Elena Baras (Nabua, Camarines Sur, Bicol Region). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 15 November 2021, policeman opened fire against a herd of livestock that had exited a pastoralist area near the village of Bello-Tounga (Karimama, Alibori). Four persons were wounded and one oxen killed, several oxen hit by gunshots were eventually slaughtered.
On 15 November 2021, one police officer and one gendarme gang raped a woman that they held in custordy at the police station of Kinieran town (Mandiana, Kankan).

actor1: Police Forces of Kazakhstan (2019-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Women (Kazakhstan); Police Forces of Kazakhstan (2019-) Prison Guards

On 15 November 2021, in Holguin, Holguin, police officers beat and violently arrested three activists -two women and a man- and an elderly woman, on their way to participate in the anti-government demonstration 'Civic March for Change' scheduled for the day. actor1: Police Forces of Egypt (2014-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 15 November 2021 (month of), Egyptian prison guards tortured two detainees in a police station in Cairo - Al Salam 1 (Al Salam, Cairo).

On 15 November 2021, a male student was assaulted by police officers near the Westminster International University campus near Yashnobod district of Tashkent city following which victim sustained injuries seeking medical help..

Around 15 November 2021 (as reported), a person was killed after he was beaten and tortured by the Taliban forces in Torkham area of Muhmand Dara, Nangarhar. He was arrested from Dekay area of Muhmand Dara district for an unknown reason. The family of the victim ask for justice.

actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service

The victim is presumed to be off-duty at the time of the incident.

On 14 November 2021, in Habana, La Habana, State Security agents shouted, threatened and beat accredited journalists who approached the house of the main promoter of the anti-government demonstration 'Civic March for Change' scheduled for 15 November, in the La Coronela neighbourhood, to interview him. On 14 November 2021, the military forces tortured and injured the private security guards, as they searched a suspected Ambazonian separatist in a hospital in Kumbo (Bui, Nord-Ouest).

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)

notes: On 14 November 2021, the FARDC killed 4 men and injured one woman from Bukombo village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The motive or circumstances of the attack is unknown.

Police sources claimed the victim attempted to attack one of the officers with a knife when the officer arrive at the area following reports of a street fight. 1 fatality.

On 14 November 2021, in Soacha (Cundinamarca), a woman, who is an activist, was attacked by a police officer who responded to a call reporting a street fight in the area. The victim claimed that the officer approached her when the man recognized her, pushed her to the ground and hit her with the baton while referring to her work as an activist. The victim has organized several protests demanding the truth in a case in which several prisoners died during a fire at a local jail in September 2020. There were no fatalities. On 13 November 2021, soldiers arrested and then killed 12 people including children believed to be Bara-dahalo in Maravoay (Marovoay, Boeny). The local district chief claimed that people were following their lost cattle, while the Ministry of Defense affirmed they were dahalo. No clashes reported.

On 13 November 2021, a man was shot and killed by a police officer in Katutura, Windhoek (Windhoek East, Khomas) as the police officer opened fire against bystanders after he was attacked when asking a driver to unblock a road. The police officer was arrested.

There were no fatalities.

notes: Around 13 November 2021 (between 12 - 13 November), in Kyauk Ta Dar village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military council arrested 2 civilians - the father and the uncle of a man under arrest warrant - at around 4 pm after they were not able to arrest the targeted man. His family was told to retrieve the uncle's body after 24 hours in custody. It was claimed that he was tortured and killed during interrogation and his head bore many injuries consistent with torture.

On 13 November 2021, in Taungnyo town, Nattalin township (Thayarwady district, Bago region) Myanmar military forces shot dead a civilian, 13 years-old young boy at around 4pm for unknown reason. The boy was shot while he was passing by Tuangnyo police station with motorbike.

Around 13 November 2021 (between 12 - 13 November), in Payathikyar Village (Labutta Township, Labutta district, Ayeyarwady Region, a man who had been arrested on 12 November on suspicion of plotting a bomb blast were tortured to death and died during military interrogation on 13 November.

On 13 November 2021, in Lel Kaing village of Ywangan township (Danu Self-Administered Zone district, Shan-South state), the military fired random shots at resident houses and killed a local while looking for two unknown people. They also searched houses and beat up one of the owners.
On 13 November 2021, in Ma Yan Inn village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region) the Myanmar military forces shot dead a 65-year-old man while he was cutting grass.

On 13 November 2021, in Htone Bo village, Wetlet township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region) the Myanmar military forces ransacked Htone Bo village and shot dead 2 local civilians for unknown reason. Fatality coded as 2.
Around 13 November 2021, near Monekoe, Muse township (Muse District, Shan State) a male civilian, aged around 30, was shot dead by the Myanmar military forces for unknown reason. Fatality coded 1.

On 13 November 2021, a man with his cousin were shot dead by the Taliban forces in Khost Wa Firing district, Baghlan. He was the third son of a family who have been killed by the Taliban. The reason for the incident is unclear.

Around 10 November 2021 (as reported), a woman claimed that his son who was a former police officer in the previous government, was taken out of house by the Taliban forces and killed in Urozgan [coded to Tirinkot with GP3] province.

Around 10 November 2021 (as reported), according to the victim's account, a Belarusian soldier kicked a Syrian migrant in the face causing him to go unconscious, during a smuggling operation handled by Belarusian military. On 10 November 2021, in Puerto Berrio (Antioquia), a female soldier was sexually assaulted by one of her superiors inside the military base facilities. source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Kachin News Group
notes: Around 9 November 2021 (between 7 - 11 November), in Shan Ka Lone village (Kawlin township, Kawlin district, Sagaing region), the military forces arrested three locals on 7 November and their dead bodies with handcuffs and gunshot wounds were found on 11 November, according to locals.

On 9 November 2021, in Ha Lin village (coded as Wetlet) (Wetlet township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military troops raided the village and arrested about 100 people as human-shields. Many were released early later but 19 people were taken to the interrogation center in Shwebo town.

Around 9 November 2021 (between 8 - 9 November), in Nat Ywar village (Htantabin township, Taungoo district, Bago-east), a 27-year-old man who was arrested on suspicion of bombing on 8 November died at the Htantabin township police station on 9 November. On 9 November 2021, in Leik San Kone village (Amarapura Township, Mandalay district, Mandalay), villagers, including a groom and bride, who were preparing for a wedding were beaten and interrogated by the military troops.

On 9 November 2021, in Aungpan town (Kalaw township, Taunggyi district, Shan-south), the military troops patrolling the town fired shots at trucks and residential areas as drivers refused to stop. Casualties unknown.

On 9 November 2021, a 19 years old boy was shot by the Taliban forces in Zargaran village of Eshkashim district, Badakhshan. The Taliban beat and shot him after finding out that he was listening to music.
On 9 November 2021, a 22 year old Muslim man accused of kidnapping a Hindu girl was killed in police custody, in Kasganj (Kasganj district, UP). 1 dead. 5 policemen suspended.

On 8 November 2021, in Day Da Naw village (Kungyangon township, Yangon-South district, Yangon region), a villager was shot dead by the military forces while running away in fear during a raid in the village by the military forces.

On 8 November 2021, an Azerbaijani serviceman shot 4 Armenian civilians that were fixing the water lines on Stepanakert-Shusha road near Shusha. 1 civilian died while 3 were wounded and transported to a hospital.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma

According to a professor, the students were under the influence of alcohol and had committed 'serious indiscipline' during the party, being the reason why the academic campus needed police support. According to a student, none of the students attacked the police either physically or verbally, although police officers had a violent response, beating the students with disproportionate use of force.

During the two-hour detention, he was held by the throat and thrown to the ground, causing injuries to his shoulders.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 5 November 2021, four armed men, with masks dressed with RSF paramilitary uniform on motorcycles, shot and killed two pastoralists from Fellata/Fulani ethnic group and looted their money in Elfaid Um-Abdalla (Abu Kershola locality, South Kordofan state).

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 5 November 2021, in Taze town (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military troops randomly fired gunshots in the town following a bomb blast near No. 2 Basic Education High School. Two civilians - a man and a woman - were killed.

On 5 November 2021, the wife of a detained rights defender was taken away by three police officers in the Huaihe neighborhood of Xi County (Xinyang, Henan) and held at a local hostel. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 4 November 2021, in Salvador (Bahia), a man was shot and killed during a military police intervention in the Nordeste de Amaralina neighborhood. According to police, fire was exchanged with armed suspects. However, witnesses claim that a shoot-out broke and the victim was injured by stray bullets. The victim then tried to hide inside a market, where he was followed by police, taken out, and shot dead. 1 fatality.

On 4 November 2021, a tricycle driver was killed by a policeman over his refusal to pay a bribe in Ipaja (Alimosho, Lagos). Some sources claim the victim was shot by the policeman while others claim he was stabbed.
On 4 November 2021, soldiers shot and killed an unarmed man described as a 'terrorist' near the military camp in the town of Gorom-Gorom (Gorom-Gorom, Oudalan).
On 4 November 2021, alleged soldiers in civilian attire shot and killed 3 people in Mankon town, Bamenda 2 subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest).

On 4 November 2021, a petitioner was beaten up and had his phone confiscated at Xuzhou Public Security Bureau Quanshan Branch Tai Shan Police station in Yunlong district (Xuzhou, Jiangsu). Earlier in the day, he requested a meeting with the bureau director at Xuzhou Public Security Bureau, but police took him away from the Bureau. Police released him after beating him.

On 4 November 2021, the gendarmerie forces beat a civilian at the Bambalang gendarmerie post, Ndop subdivision (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest). He was beaten up because, upon searching his phone, they saw pictures of the current crisis incidents. He died the next day.

source: Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA); Javanehha; Baloch Campaign
notes: On 4 November 2021, Iranian police fired without warning at a Baloch driver on the road to Raigan from Bam city (Kerman) killing him as a result.

Around 4 November 2021 (as reported), the security guard of former governor for Burka district of Baghlan was captured and beaten by the Taliban forces in Baghlan [coded to Burka with GP3] province. A video was released by the source showing a man being hit, with his head covered. The man's family claimed they still do not know his whereabouts.
Around 4 November 2021 (as reported), 2 local journalists were beaten by the Taliban for an unknown reason in Nangarhar [coded to Jalalabad with GP3] province.

actor1: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
notes: On 3 November 2021, a group of police officers from the Rapid Intervention Unit killed three illegal miners in Malema (Pebane, Zambezia) when the agents tried to stop the extraction of the resources.
On 3 November 2021, Chadian military forces attacked a Catholic priest in Walia neighborhood in NDjamena (NDjamena) for not letting them use the church as a resting area.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 3 November 2021, in Taung Maw village (Kawlin township, Kawlin district, Sagaing region), four men, including a high school teacher, were killed by military soldiers who had been stationed in the village since 2 November.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 3 November 2021, in Nat Myaung village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), military forces raided the village and shot and killed a villager.

On 3 November 2021, in Magway town (Magway township, Magway district, Magway), two people riding a motorcycle were arrested and beaten by the military troops. The military has restricted motorcyclists to one man and two women per motorcycle.

On 3 November 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway district, Magway), two people riding a motorcycle were arrested and beaten by the military troops. The military has restricted motorcyclists to one man and two women.
On 3 November 2021, in Naung Gyi Aing village, Ayadaw township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military arrested local civilians and used them as human shields.

Around 3 November 2021 (between 3 - 4 November), in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military arrested three NLD supporters and killed two of them. Dead bodies of two victims, with torture injuries and knife wounds, were dumped near the NLD office.

On 3 November 2021, in Yebyu township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), after the earlier attack against a military car, military troops took bases in nearby villages - including Thit Ka Tone, Lay Ein Su, Myay Khan Ti villages - and tortured and interrogated villagers. Over 300 villagers fled following the raid. Casualties unknown.

source: Kabul Now; Shafaqna; Etilaat e Roz
notes: On 3 November 2021, the dean and a teacher of Kateb Private University were beaten and then shot and injured by the Taliban forces because of wearing suits (not approved by the Taliban due to its western appearance) in Pul-e Sokhat area of Kabul city.

On 3 November 2021, a person was killed when Taliban forces opened fire on a house in a village of Nangarhar [coded to Jalalabad with GP3] province. Tribal elders in the region claimed that Taliban attacked the house based on a false information of ISIS presence in that house.

On 3 November 2021, Kazakh activist Aset Abishev was assaulted by police officers in the city of Pavlodar upon arrival following police stop after which Abishev was transported to the hospital with non-lethal injury.

On 3 November 2021, a man was severely injured by a police dog in Chivhu (Chikomba, Mashonaland East). The dog was unleashed after the man threw a stone against officers; the man's hand was amputated.

On 3 November 2021, two petitioners on vacation were taken away by the police while their train stopped at Nanchang Railway Station in Xihu district (Jiangxi, Nanchang), and were sent back to Fuzhou. On the next day, they were detained at a hotel in Cangshan District, Fujian, for mandatory coronavirus quarantine for at least seven days. Their coronavirus tracking app status turned yellow despite not visiting an epidemic area, suggesting that the authorities had used the app to restrict people's movements for political purposes ahead to the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.
On 2 November 2021, police beat a prisoner in their custody at the Sanandaj Central Prison in Sanandaj city (Kurdistan) killing him as a result.

Around 2 November 2021 (as reported), a man accused the police of injuring him with a hot iron while in custody in the Chitipa district (Northern) [coded to Chitipa] after he was arrested on allegations of stabbing a sex worker. The police denied the responsibility for the attack, stating that a mob caused such injuries to the man.

Around 2 November 2021 (as reported), a man accused of killing a senior finance official of the Gauteng Department of Health was tortured by police officers while arrested in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng). The man claims he was tortured into confessing the involvement in the killing.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 2 November 2021, a Houthi member shot the owner of a mechanic shop and two of his employees in Rada district (Al Bayda) following an altercation killing and injuring them. Fatality coded as 1 (conservative half of 3). A CCTV from a few days prior showed the perpetrator threatening the mechanic shop owner if he did not fix his vehicle.

actor1: Police Forces of Saudi Arabia (2015-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 2 November 2021 (as reported), prison guards beat and tortured political prisoner Saud Mukhtar al Hashimi in Dhahban Central Prison (Jiddah, Mecca). The guards also deprived him of medicine.

source: Myanmar Now; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: Around 2 November 2021 (between 1 - 2 November), in Ywar Bo village, Sintgaing township (Kyaukse District, Mandalay Region), a 32-year-old man, a high school teacher, was killed during interrogation on 2 November after the Myanmar military arrested him on 1 November for joining the civil disobedience movement. The man died from injuries consistent with torture.

On 2 November 2021, in Madaya town (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay), military troops arrested and beat up three youths, including a CDM teacher, on suspicion of having connection with the PDF.

On 2 November 2021, in Maubin town of Maubin township (Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), the military beat and arrested a driver who played the wrong music at the pro-Coup protest. The driver who was forced to drive to the protest venue played the anti-Coup song by mistake.

On 2 November 2021, near the Veterans' office in Yesagyo Town (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway), military troops beat up and asked for money from passers-by in front of the military base. Others were arrested if they could not pay.

On 2 November 2021, in Mei Ma Thaw village of Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and shot and killed a 14-year-old who was sitting in a shelter outside the village with sniper. A monk was also injured due to shooting in a raid.

assoc_actor_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Prisoners (Myanmar)
notes: Around 2 November 2021 (between 1 - 3 November), in Tanintharyi township (Tanintharyi district, Tanintharyi region), a NLD member from Maw Tone (East) village was tortured to death after being detained on November 1.

On 2 November 2021, three persons including a child were killed after Taliban forces opened fire on a civilian car in Azadi square of Mazar-e-Sharif-Sheberghan highway [coded to Balkh with GP2]. No further information.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 2 November 2021, police SNR abducted an agronomist working at the PROTHEM factory in Mashunzi (Bisoro, Mwaro). The civilian has not been found since the abduction.

On 2 November 2021, a high-ranked female tennis player Peng Shuai, who was a doubles champion at Wimbledon and the French Open, went missing and became incommunicado in Beijing municipality after she accused former vice-premier Zhang Gaoli of pressuring her into a sexual relationship in a social media post. It was the first time that the #MeToo movement had reached the highest echelons of the ruling CCP. The tennis players' disappearance raised international concerns about her personal safety and whereabouts.

source: Javanehha; Hengaw; Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA)
notes: On 2 November 2021, Iranian military forces fired at a shepherd at the border area in Urumiah county (West Azerbaijan, capital Orumiyeh as reference) killing him as a result.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 1 November 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in one of regime prisons coded to Sidnaya Military Prison, after he was arrested around ten years ago.

On 1 November 2021, in Ciudad Evita (Buenos Aires), police officers gathered in the 22 de Octubre neighborhood at night and evicted 300 families from a land they have been occupying for 11 days. Officers used rubber bullets, tear gas, destroyed the houses, and set fire on an improvised dining room. Dozens of people got injured, five were detained and released hours later. Those families claimed the police had no warrant.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Presidential Security Unit
assoc_actor_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: On 1 November 2021, Presidential guards from FACA shot against unarmed Egyptian MINUSCA forces, after the latter had allegedly taken some pictures of the presidential house in Bangui - 4 (Arrondissement 4). UN forces fled from presidential guards in their military vehicle, and hit and killed a young woman in a car accident. Ten peacekeepers were injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Nigeria Customs Service
notes: On 1 November 2021, custom officials attacked Fagbohun (Egbado South, Ogun) and burnt down houses as a reprisal for the killing of two custom operatives by smugglers in the area. Residents claim some locals were arrested by the officials, and many have fled.

source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; New Telegraph; Blueprint
notes: On 1 November 2021, soldiers invaded Mgbowo (Agwu, Enugu), killed an unspecified number of youths, burnt down the house of an IPOB leader, whom they were searching, as well as other houses. The soldiers shot sporadically to the air during the invasion. The army denied claims of indiscriminate shooting and confirmed the arrest of two IPOB leaders. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 1 November 2021, police abducted a civilian in Gatabo (Kiganda, Muramvya).

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 1 November 2021, SNR agents and Imbonerakure abducted a CNL member in Mparambo 1 (Rugombo, Cibitoke). The man had been receiving threats for not switching to the CNDD-FDD party.

On 1 November 2021, in Nam Kut village of Muse township (Muse district, Shan-North state), the military raided a house, beat the owner with guns' butt and looted phones and a handmade rifle along with other accessories.

On 1 November 2021, in Monywa town of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military guarding at the Phayar Ni security checkpoint followed, shot and killed three young men on a motorbike who refused to stop and drove away.
On 1 November 2021, police personnel beat up and killed a person accused of consuming drugs during a drive at Dalalhaat village in Kaunia upazila (Rangpur).

On 1 November 2021, a group of unidentified armed men, presumably officers from Tanzania Intelligence and Security Services, abducted five men in Michee in the district of Lindi (Liwale, Lindi) following various night raids. Police denied knowledge of the raids. The opposition political party Civic United Front (CUF) claimed that those abducted were members of the party.

On 1 November 2021, in Tha Yet Kan village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), two farmers from Tha Yet Kan and one farmer from Myannandar ward were shot dead while fetching water in a field. They were killed by members of the military troops and Pyu Saw Htee members when they were passing by in two cars.
Around 1 November 2021 (as reported), 1 civilian was killed by the Taliban for collaborating with international organizations in Gardez district, Paktia.
On 1 November 2021, police beat up and injured a journalist at Buja FM in Rohero (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). The police entered the radio broadcasting room with an arrest warrant for harassment.

actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards

actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 1 November 2021 (month of), in Artemisa, Artemisa, prison guards beat a young man with sticks causing spills in his eyes and injuries to his ribs and hips. 1 man was injured.
On 31 October 2021, Syrian regime forces arrested several civilian men for conscription in Debsi Afnan village in Deir ez Zor governorate.

On 31 October 2021, in the rural area of Corinto (Cauca), military forces opened fire on two civilians on a motorcycle when they ignored a stop sign made by one of the military soldiers at a checkpoint in the Gualanday sector. Military sources stated that their units mistook the victims for members of an armed group. Two civilians and one military soldier were injured in the incident as, according to authorities, the victims drove their vehicle against the soldiers. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
source: La Jornada; El Proceso; Imagen del Golfo
notes: On 31 October 2021, in Pijijiapan municipality, Chiapas, members of the National Guard shot at three vehicles that were transporting 13 migrants belonging to the Migrant caravan. The shooting started after the vehicles did not stop during a police control around Pijijiapan municipality. One migrant from Cuba was shot and killed. Another four people were injured. One of the drivers was arrested. Several migrants were detained by the authorities. The nationality of the migrants that were injured and arrested was not reported. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
notes: On 31 October 2021, in Chiapas state (coded to Acacoyagua), members of the National Guard shot against a pick-up truck with a group of migrants inside that pretended to arrive to Ciudad de Mexico. According to sources, security forces open-ended fire against the truck because the driver did not stop the vehicle when asked by the officers at a checkpoint. 1 Cuban migrant was shot and killed and 4 others were wounded.

On 31 October 2021, in Guanajuato, Guanajuato, three men were beaten by at least three municipal police officers while they were being arrested. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media. The motivation of the attack was not reported. The Municipal police started an investigation against the officers involved in the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Hadhrami Elite Forces

notes: On 31 October 2021, Hadrami Elite forces shot and killed a young man in Al Mukalla city (Hadramawt) because of his protest activism.

On 31 October 2021, in Chauk township (Magway district, Magway region), the military tortured and killed one of three brothers in military interrogation center within a few hours after arresting them. Three brothers who were private teachers were accused of providing finance to PDFs.

On 31 October 2021, in Hlwe Te village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military forces shot and arrested three youths who were doing charity work at the funeral of the monk at the monastery. A local claimed that they were arrested for being informants of the PDF.

On 31 October 2021, in Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah State), one or two displaced villagers were shot dead by military troops while returning to their village to get food. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 31 October 2021, in Monywa town of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military guarding at the Theinla Kyauk Seik security checkpoint followed and knocked off two men on a motorbike with a police vehicle. Two men were severely injured due to the military shooting.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: On 31 October 2021, in Aparecida de Goiania (Goias), an inmate was beaten up, tortured, and injured by prison guards inside a detainment facility. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Bahrain (1999-) Prison Guards

On 31 October 2021, soldiers shot and wounded a man who refused to comply with their instructions in the town of Markoye (Markoye, Oudalan).
On 30 October 2021, police fired upon a civilian at the Dolhto border checkpoint in Sardasht county (West Azerbaijan) injuring her as a result.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Civil Police
notes: On 30 October 2021, in Ruropolis (Para), an adolescent was beaten up and injured by a civil police officer in a square. The officer was suspended and an investigation of the case was requested. There were no fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
notes: On 30 October 2021, two NSS officers beat an Ethiopian bartender into a coma in Aweil town (Aweil West county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), after she insisted they pay for the drinks they consumed. A nearby police patrol arrested the attackers.

source: Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: Around 30 October 2021 (between 29 - 31 October), in Yauk Thwar Aing village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), about 30 military soldiers on 18 motorcycles stormed the village, destroyed four houses and arrested a 21-year-old youth on suspicion of being a PDF memeber. On 30 October 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), three people returning by motorcycles were shot by the military forces as they did not stop when being told by the military soldiers to stop the motorcycles. Two of them were injured.

Around 30 October 2021 (between 30 - 31 October), in In Ngoke To village of Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and arrested a farmer. Villagers found his dead body next day in fields.

On 30 October 2021, in Ku Lar Lu village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), locals ran away when the military forces entered the village. One was shot and about 25 people were arrested by the military. 17 of them were released.

On 30 October 2021, in Kywe Te village of Taze township (coded as Taze) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces stationed at the Kywe Te village shot and killed a man while on the way when the military called him to come and get his wife, who had been shot and arrested by the military on 29 October, according to a local.

On 30 October 2021, in Kywe Te village of Kyunhla township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), a civilian who was informed by military authorities to come and pick his wounded wife was shot and killed on the way.
Around 30 October 2021 (as reported), 1 member of the former Afghan police was arrested and killed by the Taliban in Yamgan district, Badakhshan.

On 30 October 2021, an environmental activist in Zheleznovodsk was beaten by police at a local police station, where he was taken and arrested for 24 hours on charges of being in a public space under the influence of alcohol and of disrupting public order.

actor1: Police Forces of Kazakhstan (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: On 30 October 2021, a male prisoner was assaulted by prison guards at the penal colony RU-170/3 near Oral district of Uralsk city in West Kazakhstan region resulting in injuries.

On 30 October 2021, a group of Mozambican forces tortured and killed a civilian man in Likobe near Chai (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The man was working in an area declared off limits by the military. The forces warned locals in the area after the killing not to cross into restricted areas.

actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
notes: Around 30 October 2021 (week of), border security soldiers arrested a woman in her 20s in Hoeryong City who attempted to defect to China due to difficulties in living. Officials of the preliminary hearing security guards physically attacked and sexually assaulted the woman. At last, she killed herself on 30 October.

On 30 October 2021, a female activist was taken away by local government officers in Beijing municipality and became incommunicado, as reported on 8 November 2021. Her disappearance came after her online activism urging for the immediate release of jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike to protest her imprisonment for reporting news from Wuhan in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 30 October 2021, about 8 Eritrean nationals, all from the same family, went missing, suspectedly abducted by the Eritrean security forces, upon their arrival to Asmara (Debubawi Mierab, Maekel) after their expulsion from Egypt. There's no information about their whereabouts since their arrival.

On 30 October 2021, 5 petitioner-cum-forced-evictee, including 3 women, from Fuzhou was beat up and abducted by 4-5 interceptors inside Dashilan Police Station in Xicheng district, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) without any intervention from the police. The petitioners were separated into two groups and transferred to a farmhouse in Shipai Village in Fuzhou city and a farmhouse on 115 Xiu Feng Lu road in Fuzhou city, where they were subjected to violence and physically restrained. They were all released on 16 November 2021.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 30 October 2021, police officers tased a man in a police station in Catskill (New York). The man entered the police station and was apparently inebriated. Police officers talked to him and tried to calm him. After 20 minutes, he began to squirt his head and body with hand sanitizer and the officers moved towards him. One of the officers fired a taser at him, causing his head and body to catch fire. Officers then fled the room as the man remained on fire. The man died from his burns in December 2021.

source: Hayrout; Yemen Data Project; Al Mashhad Al Araby
notes: On 29 October 2021, pro-Hadi security forces shot and injured a civilian in a road in Rakhyah district (Hadramawt) as he approached a checkpoint they were manning. The reason for the attack is unclear.

On 29 October 2021, soldiers assaulted and killed a mentally ill male civilian near the village of Sakoani (Kantchari, Tapoa). The assault came in the wake of an IED attack against a logistics convoy.

Around 29 October 2021 (as reported), dead body of a member of Hezb-e Islami-Gulbuddin was found near Surkhrod Pol of Jalalabad city, Nangarhar. The victim was arrested by the Taliban three days before the incident, and his family received a message claiming that the man was executed because of his connection with ISKP.

notes: On 29 October 2021, in Pekon township (coded as Pekon) (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the military abducted 20 locals to use as forced labor and human shields.

There were no casualties.

On 29 October 2021, in Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a fisherman from the Gway Pin Kone village was shot dead by the military forces while fishing in a sewage stream, according to locals.
On 29 October 2021, in Kywe Te village of Taze township (coded as Taze) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces stationed at the Kywe Te village shot and arrested a woman.

Around 29 October 2021 (between 29 - 30 October), in Hlut Taik village of Kyunhla township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village on October 29 and a villager was found dead on next day.

On 29 October 2021, in Pa Leik (Ywar Ma) (Sintgaing township, Kyaukse district, Mandalay region), the military troops arrested a 27-year-old CDM teacher and 40-year-old man in connection with the killing of a local administrator the day before.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
notes: On 29 October 2021, in San Cristobal (Tachira), suspected PNB officers shot and killed a woman during an attempt at extortion. Authorities initially reported the attack occurred during a common robbery; however, family members refuted the narrative of a robbery, stating the perpetrators were PNB officers engaged in systematic extortion of workers in the area. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: La Prunelle; UN (unspecified); Actualite; News24 (South Africa)

On 28 October 2021, Jinyang Residential District police officers raided the home of a congregant of the now-shuttered Early Rain Covenant Church in Chengdu city, Sichuan (coded to Wuhou). Police officers pulled and beat two adults and a child, causing them to be hospitalized for injuries. Police then took three Christians to the Wuhou District police station.

On 28 October 2021, in Na-Let Khoke Pin village (Natmauk township, Magway district, Magway region), military soldiers raided the village and beat and arrested six villagers after they failed to find the targeted young man they were searching for. During the raid, they opened fire and threatened to break into houses. They also took away more than 1 million kyats, a motorcycle, TV and some clothes. Villagers were forced to flee following the raid.

On 28 October 2021, in Pekon town (Pekon township, Taunggyi district, Shan-South), military soldiers beat up and arrested a man who stayed behind in the town after clashes broke out in the town over the past few days. Locals reported that soldiers then stole his car.

On 28 October 2021, police officers, in civilian clothes, abducted three people, including a lawyer, his client who was released after spending 10 years in prison on terror-related charges and for being part of the Al Shabaab and the former prisoner's cousin in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). They are yet to be found.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Myanmar); NLD: National League for Democracy
source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now
notes: Around 28 October 2021 (between 27 - 29 October), in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), three NLD supporters living in London Win Ward were arrested by military soldiers on 27 October. The families of two of the detainees were informed on 29 October to retrieve their bodies. Their bodies were found to bear stab wounds and injuries consistent with torture.

On 28 October 2021, in Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), a former political prisoner was killed in military interrogation center. His body was broken and his head was crashed. He was released on October 19 and re-arrested on October 28.

On 28 October 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), the father of an anti-coup protest leader was shot and wounded by the military troops while he driving his car on Bo Aung Kyaw Road. He was then taken away and his family was informed the next morning that he had died.

Around 28 October 2021 (week of), police forces arrested around 15 Palaro clan members, suspected of attacking civilians on the previous week over a land dispute, and tortured them in the prison, in Pawel (Kilak, Amuru). There were no fatalities, and two victims were then released.
