The guard deceived the victim and trapped her in a bathroom of the facility. He confessed to the crime after a co-worker reported the attack to the prison director.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 9 October 2021, in Sao Bernardo do Campo, Sao Paulo, an off-duty military police officer shot at four individuals of the same family who were working at a supermarket. A woman was shot and killed, and three men were shot and injured. The officer was also shot by an unknown shooter. The victims' families stated that no one knew the perpetrator. The motivation for the shooting is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 October 2021, in Than Taw village, Tei Pin village track (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military entered the village. They arrested and beat three villagers, including a protest leader. Later, the Myanmar military shot a protester leader dead.

On 9 October 2021, in San Pya Chauk Maing village (Demoso township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), two refugees returning home to get food were shot and arrested by the military forces. One was killed and another got injured in his head.

On 9 October 2021, in Ah Lel Taw village of Tigyaing township (Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a teacher participating in the civil disobedience movement (CDM). The Tigyaing PDF reported that he was killed during the arrest but this information cannot be verified.

On 9 October 2021, the Military Forces of Azerbaijan fired from a sniper rifle on a resident of Mataghis village who was conducting agricultural activities near the Artsakh-Azerbaijan border. As a result, the civilian died. The Ministry of Defense of Azerbaijan refuted this report saying that the Azerbaijani side has no involvement in this incident. The Ministry of Defense of Russia confirmed the report of the Armenian side regarding the death of a peaceful civilian. [coded to Martakert with GP3, as the exact location is unknown]

On 9 October 2021, in Caraballeda (Vargas), police shot and killed a man during a shootout in Tanaguarena suburb. The victim had been wanted in connection to sexually assaulting a woman. Family members and neighbors disputed the official report of a clash, stating the victim was last seen already in police custody, and that he had been falsely accused of the crime. 1 fatality.
On 9 October 2021, security forces assaulted three Baloch persons and forcibly detained them at Kotan area in Kharan district (Balochistan). Two of them were later released.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 8 October 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in one of regime prisons coded to Sidnaya Military Prison, after he was arrested around two years ago while he was trying to cross to Lebanon.

actor1: Police Forces of Libya (2021-) Prison Guards
notes: On 8 October 2021, Libyan prison guards shot at migrants, mostly from sub-Saharan Africa, who were detained at the Al Mabani detention facility Tripoli - Tripoli (Tripoli, West), killing 6 migrants and injuring an unknown number of others. An unknown number of migrants also escaped.

Abduction: On 8 October 2021, in Nawng Myi village of Hpakant township (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), the military abducted a man to use as a human shield on their trip from Nawng Myi to Dun Bang. He was released after.

On 8 October 2021, soldiers attacked civilians in retaliation over a soldier that was killed by oil smugglers in Izombe (Oguta, Imo). Three individuals were killed, houses were burnt and the area was deserted.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 8 October 2021, in Itaquaquecetuba, Sao Paulo, a Black man was assaulted and injured by two military police officers after resisting an approach. A video shows that even showing no resistance on the floor. The victim was repeatedly assaulted by officers.

source: Kachinland News; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 8 October 2021, in Nawng Mi village of Tanai township (Myitkyina township, Kachin state), the Myanmar military detained about a 20-year-old boy who was used as a human shield.

Around 8 October 2021 (between 6 - 9 October), in the outskirt of Madaya town (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), a man who was arrested by the military at a checkpoint on 6 October was later found dead on 9 October where the Myanmar military dumped his body near La Maing village.

On 8 October 2021, in the outskirt of Tigyaing town (Tigyaing Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military detained a 25-year-old man. The military claimed that they found a bullet in his motorcycle toolbox. He died in military custody later that night. It was reported that there were bruises on his body, indicating that he had been tortured during interrogation.

On 8 October 2021, a woman was verbally threatened or physically attacked by demolition office personnel in Xincun Residential District of Jiang'an district (Wuhan, Hubei). Officers locked her in a car for a few hours and beat her to the ground before releasing her. She had to be hospitalized for brain concussion.
On 8 October 2021, an Israeli police officer physically assaulted an Israeli Arab journalist while covering events in Majd el Kurum (Karmiel, HaZafon).
On 8 October 2021, in Taung Pyin Nge village (Ye-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces killed two youths on guard duty and set five motorcycles on fire.
On 8 October 2021, in Thar Yar Kone village of Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military forces arrested three villagers and opened fire at a mentally ill man.

Around 8 October 2021 (as reported), a detainee died after being held for less than 72 hours in police custody at the Pekan district police headquarter, Pekan (Pahang). The victim's family was skeptical regarding the cause of death, which a hospital claimed was due to an abnormal blood vessel rupture that led to a stroke. Their demand for an explanation from the police remained unanswered. The victim was arrested for a drug-related offense.

source: ABS-CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star
notes: On 8 October 2021, a woman flagged by a police officer at a coronavirus quarantine checkpoint was raped by the said officer in Mabalacat City (Pampanga, Central Luzon). The woman reportedly failed to show a driver's license at the checkpoint. She was then made to ride the police officer's car, who then reportedly brought her to a motel and raped her. Rape charges were filed against the police officer, who was also dismissed from service.

On 7 October 2021, near Jinotepe, Carazo, police forces entered the house of a transgender woman who is former political prisoner and arrested her on accusations of wanting to cause harm to Sandinistas She was kept in custody for two hours after which she was released. A source reports that in the operation police forces hit her, her sisters and her mother. The mother suffered facial paralysis from the attack and was taken to a regional hospital.
On 7 October 2021, police officers in Mutsamudu (Mutsamudu, Anjouan) physically assaulted a tomato seller with a baton. The man was hospitalized.

source: Radio Free Asia; Kachin News Group
notes: Abduction: On 7 October 2021, in Saing Du village of Gangaw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), the military abducted 50 locals who were working in a construction site and in fields to use as human shields on the trip from Saing Du to the Kale-Hakha junction. They were released at the destination.
On 7 October 2021, in Min Tan village of Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military shot and killed three villagers who came to extinguish a fire.

On 7 October 2021, in Ah Myint area of Chaung-U township (coded as Ah Myint (East)) (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military shot and killed a villager and arrested two others from Thit Seint village.

On 7 October 2021, in Thaung Pyin Nge village of Ye-U township (coded as Ye-U) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and killed two villagers who they caught with handmade rifles.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 7 October 2021, CRPF personnel fired at a vehicle that failed to stop at the check-post at Monghall bridge in Anantnag district (J&K). One person was killed in the incident.

On 7 October 2021, a woman and her teenage son were whipped and severely beaten by the Taliban entering their house to search for her husband in Barkar Velley of Miramor district, Daykundi. Later Taliban captured her husband and beat him accused of involvement in drug dealing, but the woman refused the claim saying that her husband has a shop and these are all false allegations. Taliban officials reject the allegation of beating the woman and her teenage son but a local resident confirmed that the woman and her family were beaten.

actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; ANF News; Mezopotamya Agency
notes: On 7 October 2021, 80 prisoners were physically assaulted by a group of 80 prison guards at Sanliurfa T Type Prison in Hilvan, Sanliurfa, reportedly for objecting to an order that reshuffles their wards. Serious injuries were reported due to the violence prisoners were subjected to, including bone fractures.
On 7 October 2021, the gendarmerie forces tortured one suspect in custody to death in Douala city, Douala 1 subdivision (Wouri, Littoral).
On 7 October 2021, a monarch and his wife were attacked by police officers in Aku (Igbo Etiti, Enugu). The monarch was taken to an undisclosed location by the police.
On 7 October 2021, a man was shot and killed by police officers in Mpaka (Dvokodvweni, Lubombo). The man ran away from his car after the police ordered him to stop, prompting the shooting.
On 7 October 2021, Mozambican military forces fired in an uncontrolled manner close to Mitambo (Meluco district). People fled into the bush. There were no casualties.
On 7 October 2021, policemen shot at a man in his car during a stop and search session in Benin City (Oredo, Edo). There were no casualties.

actor1: Police Forces of Nepal (2015-) Armed Police Force
notes: Around 7 October 2021 (as reported), Deputy Inspector of APF allegedly assaulted and baton charged a rickshaw driver at the Trinagar-Gauriphanta checkpoint in Dhangadhi area (Kailali district, Sudurpashchim), after the latter refused to give Rs.50 asked by the officer. The victim sustained a broken hand as a result of the assault.

On 6 October 2021, in Thantlang township (Hakha district, Chin state), the military stationed in Thantlang police station fired at a man who came back to check on his abandoned house after they fled from the town. The man was wounded but escaped.

On 6 October 2021, the Indonesian police forces raided Kais district (South Sorong Regency, West Papua province). The officers reportedly assaulted four Papuan civilians. A civilian was forced into a river, two others were beaten, and another was threatened with shooting.

On 6 October 2021, a 16-year-old female student was assaulted and injured by a police officer at the principal's office in the building of high school 43 in Shymkent city following which victim was hospitalized with concussion. A student's parent filed a police report. [women targeted: girls]

actor1: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Department of State Services
notes: On 6 October 2021, operatives of the DSS invaded the Ayope area of Owode Ede (Ede North, Osun), shot sporadically, killed a man and arrested 3 others. The operatives were called to intervene in a fight in the area.
On 5 October 2021, regime forces opened fire on a bus on Homs road killing a woman and injuring others, because the bus didn't stop at their checkpoint according to regime forces.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) 4th Armored Division
notes: On 5 October 2021, regime 4th Armored Division members shot and killed a young man in Janobia town in Al Qusayr area in Homs countryside.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 5 October 2021, Houthi sniper fire targeted a civilian southwest of At Tuhayta city center (At Tuhayat, Al Hudaydah) injuring him.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 5 October 2021, Houthi fighters raided an area and opened fire at a house in As Sawadiyah district (Al Bayda) killing 1 man and injuring his wife.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 5 October 2021, a FACA soldier shot and seriously injured a taxi driver, after the latter refused to give his motorbike to the solider, in Niem (Niem-Yelewa, Bouar). There were no fatalities.

On 5 October 2021, police forces attacked a woman in her house for unclear reasons in Ngogwe (Buikwe, Central). Due to the increasing number of attacks perpetrated by police forces against civilians, 14 local councilors resigned. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 5 October 2021, in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested the North Western Command brigadier general before he joined the civil disobedience movement. He was reportedly killed during the interrogation but this information cannot be verified. Location coded as Monywa.

On 5 October 2021, in Yae Lel Thaung village of Ngazun township (coded as Yae Lel Thaung (East)) (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military beat and arrested 7 locals including a monk in relation to the killing of military informants in Sin Hpyu Kone village.
On 5 October 2021, regime forces opened small arms fire at a civilian inter-city transportation bus near Tadmor in Homs, killing a woman and wounding 3 other civilians.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 5 October 2021, villagers and ZANU-PF members were beaten by the police during a party meeting at the Mupandira Business Centre, Musana (Bindura Urban, Mashonaland Central). The officers released two dogs on the group and used tear gas. Several people were injured. 15 police officers were later arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Ministry of People's Security
notes: Around 5 October 2021 (between 1 - 10 October), the Ministry of Social Security took about 30 street vendors in Hyesan City to forced labor brigades for selling goods on the street in 'contradiction to party orders.' North Korean authorities reportedly launched an intensive crackdown on street vendors, also known as grasshopper merchants, and arrested people who put up serious resistance.

On 5 October 2021, four members of the Indonesian military forces took a Papuan civilian away from a small store in Sugapa district (Intan Jaya regency, Papua province) for an unclear reason. His whereabouts are unknown.

On 5 October 2021, in Dwei Loe village of Hpapun township (coded as Hpapun) (Hpapun district, Kayin state), the military's LIB 405 used six villagers including 4 women and 2 men from Waw Wi Lay village to carry food and guide them in the battlefield. Of six villagers, a 60-year-old woman was injured in times of fighting.

Around 5 October 2021 (between 4 - 6 October), in Hlegu township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), a charity worker who was arrested by the military on 4 October later died while in military custody on 6 October.

On 5 October 2021, a 60-year-old resident of Ozgon district in Osh region was assaulted and tortured by police officers at the police station in Uzgen township to extract forced confession in a fatal assault case which the victim denied having involvement in.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 5 October 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in a regime prison in Damascus city, after he was arrested in April 2020.

source: AFP; RFI; Pinal (Mali); FAMAMali; AMAP; HRW; Facebook
notes: On 5 October 2021, Malian soldiers arrested dozens of people from the Fulani community at the weekly market in the town of Sofara (Djenne, Mopti). At least three people were extrajudicially killed. Malian Armed Forces denied the extrajudicial killings but admitted the torture and said that disciplinary sanctions were imposed on those responsible.

On 5 October 2021, in Tha Pyay Thar village of Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military and police beat and arrested three women, family members of their intended target. They also arrested a 60-year-old man. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 5 October 2021, police and others dressed in civilian clothes abducted a farmer, who worked also as a land/estate broker, in Buterere (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). Land conflicts are reportedly behind this abduction, and he has not been found since this time.

actor1: Police Forces of Zimbabwe (2017-) Prison Guards
notes: On 5 October 2021, a man was assaulted/injured with a plastic pick handle, and injured, by two prison guards for trespassing the prison premises in Chikurubi (Harare Urban, Harare).

On 4 October 2021, in Yesagyo township (Pakokku district, Magway region), the Myanmar military forces opened fire to a restaurant near Lel Tae Nyaungpin Pagoda. A man was shot dead in the head. Five others were arrested in relation to the shooting. The reason for the act was unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: On 4 October 2021, police officers detained and allegedly beat a man at a police station in Orenburg and threatened to rape him, in an effort to have him confess to stealing a cell phone, which the victim claimed he did not.

actor1: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Special Forces
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) National Guard
notes: On 4 October 2021, Russian special forces and National Guard officers severely beat two leaders of the Jehova's Witnesses in Irkutsk while detaining them at their homes. One of the victims was allegedly beaten for refusing to unblock his cell phone to show the content of his messages. The Jehovah's Witnesses are legally banned in Russia following a decision by the Russian Supreme Court, which designated the organization as 'extremist' in 2017. However, the religious group continues to operate unofficially.

On 4 October 2021, several police officers allegedly beat a man they had earlier detained, at a police station in Tbilisskaya, Krasnodar Krai. According to the victim, his assailants were trying to have him confess to a case of theft. The victim died of his wounds a few weeks after the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali); Muslim Group (Mali); Prisoners (Mali)
notes: On 4 October 2021, Malian soldiers arrested the imam of Dankoussa village from the Fulani community in the village of Tandiama (Djenne, Mopti). The soldiers filmed and tortured the imam whose fate remains unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: Around 4 October 2021 (as reported), SNR agents, prison guards and Imbonerakure summarily executed an Imbonerakure who was being held as a prisoner in Kanyosha jail (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie). He was arrested the previous week for being found with grenades in his home, one of which killed a child and injured 3 police officers (coded separately).
On 4 October 2021, a member of the ENDF raped a woman in kebele 017 in Tehuledere woreda (Ambasel, South Wello, Amhara).

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 3 October 2021, the police assaulted ZANU-PF members in Bindura (Bindura Urban, Mashonaland Central) during a restructuring exercise. The police used tear gas. No reports on injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
source: G1; Alma Preta Jornalismo; O Tempo
notes: On 3 October 2021, in Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, a Black community leader was beaten up and injured by military police during an intervention in the Alto Vera Cruz neighbourhood. According to the officers it was a case of civil disobedience, but witnesses claim it was a case of police brutality. Witnesses also recorded footage of the event. There were no fatalities.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 3 October 2021, in Shwe Ku Tae Su village of Khin-U township (coded as Khin-U) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), three villagers were shot and killed by military forces in relation to the killing of the military informant in Pyin Htaung village.

On 3 October 2021, in Lel Tha Ma village of Pale township (coded as Pale) (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), a 50-year-old villager was shot dead by the military while feeding the cows. The identity of the villager was unknown.

On 3 October 2021, Taliban forces killed a person alleged to have affiliation with the Islamic State in Barkot area of Bati Kot district, Nangarhar province. He was also a madrasa (religious school) student and according to the locals, he was killed on account of being an IS member. Taliban did not comment on the incident, no further information.

actor1: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) National Guard
notes: On 3 October 2021, a group of members of the Ahmat Kadyrov Regiment (a regiment of ethnic Chechens in the Russian National Guard, formally tasked with ensuring the security of the leader of Chechnya), physically attacked and beat two supporters of a soccer club who had come to Grozny to watch a match between their team, Spartak Moscow, and the local team, Ahmat Grozny. According to Chechen authorities and representatives of the Russian soccer First League, the victims were not beaten, but were simply briefly detained after one of the men insulted Allah and made racist comments, presumably about ethnic Chechens. However eyewitnesses confirmed the beating, also claiming that one of the victims was drunk and was simply behaving loudly. Video footage of the event was also published, showing men in coats bearing the inscription 'A. A. Kadyrov Regiment' beating two people at Grozny stadium.

source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Haber Ercis
notes: On 3 October 2021, around 10-15 riot police officers assaulted and injured a civilian in Adana province. The victim and his friends approached the police officers standing in group at a public location to report the theft of his phone and started to argue with them due to their indifference. The police officers attacked the victim and severely broke his leg.

assoc_actor_2: NDC: National Democratic Congress (Ghana); Government of Ghana (2017-)
notes: On 3 October 2021, the police forces severely beat up one NDC (opposition) party District Assembly Member in Akim Achiase town (Birim South, Eastern) for demanding transparency in the District Chief Executive electoral process.
On 2 October 2021, regime forces arrested several young men on Al-Panorama checkpoint in Deir-ez-Zor for conscription purposes.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 2 October 2021, Houthi forces kidnapped the local imam and 4 other worshippers in the mosque of Sardud Al Ahdhuf village (Al Husha, Ad Dali) after they refused to perform the Houthi slogan -- the sarkhah.

On 2 October 2021, three men were beaten and injured by eight metro police officers at the Madiba street, Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) as they asked for their cars back after it was impounded by the officers.
On 2 October 2021, police abducted a taxi driver in Kiremba (Kiremba, Bururi).
On 2 October 2021, the gendarmerie forces shot and killed the leader of a taxi drivers union in Tinto village, Upper Bayang subdivision (Manyu, Sud-Ouest).

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: On 2 October 2021, SNR agents abducted 3 members of the same family, one was a former soldier and pastor, in Buziracanda (Ndava, Mwaro). The day before, the son of the former soldier, was also abducted (coded separately). A few days prior, another ex-FAB soldier was arrested in the same area, who was also a father of a student at the same high school. Reports suggest that the SNR are looking for a former student who is suspected of being involved with the car ambush in Cogo a few weeks prior.
On 2 October 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), an LGBT activist was hit by a car and arrested. She was brought for military interrogation.

Around 2 October 2021 (between 1 - 3 October), in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), an aid worker who was arrested by military forces on 1 October in in San Gyi Wa ward later died while in custody on October 3. The aid worker had been providing support to young anti-coup protesters who were arrested by the military forces.

Around 2 October 2021 (between 1 - 3 October), in Htei Hlaw village (Gangaw township, Gangaw region, Magway region), the military forces were stationed from 1 to 3 October. When the military left on October 3, villagers found one dead body. Nine houses were set on fire.

On 2 October 2021, in Kyunsu township (Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), a villager was arrested and beaten by the police forces for talking about military informants on Facebook in front of an alleged military informant.

On 2 October 2021, 1 civilian was shot by the Taliban while trying to cross the borders to Tajikistan in Badakhshan province [coded to Faiz Abad with GP3]. Taliban reportedly forced the fleeing civilians to return by deploying forces to the region.

actor1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-2022) Counter Terrorism Department
assoc_actor_2: Baloch Ethnic Group (Pakistan); BSO: Baloch Students' Organization; Students (Pakistan)
notes: On 2 October 2021, CTD fired at civilians during a raid at the house of a Baloch student organization chairman at Buleda city (Kech district, Balochistan). One person was killed while another was left injured in the firing.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Puntland Police Force
notes: On 2 October 2021, Puntland police officers shot and killed two civilians, including an Ethiopian citizen, in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). The motive of the killings is unknown.

Around 1 October 2021 (month of), in Zay Yar Thi Ri township (Oke Ta Ra district, Nay Pyi Taw), a detainee died from severe injuries and wounds while receiving treatment at military hospital. He was arrested on 2 May and had been tortured by the military for five months. He died on 1 October. His mother witnessed bruises, broken ribs and injured body organs on his body.
Around 1 October 2021 (as reported), a civilian belonging to Salafist Muslim group was found dead after being detained, assumed by the Taliban in Chaparhar district, Nangarhar.

source: Libya Herald; AP; AFP; Al Wasat (Libya)
notes: Around 1 October 2021, Libyan military forces attacked civilians while conducting raids on the houses of irregular migrants, mostly from sub-Saharan Africa, in a crackdown on migrants transiting through Libya to Europe in Tripoli - Gergarish (Tripoli, West). One migrant was killed and 15 more were wounded.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 1 October 2021, SNR agents abducted a student from his high school in Mwaro city (Kayokwe, Mwaro). He was the son of a former soldier and pastor. The following day, 3 members of his family, including his father, were also abducted (coded separately). A few days prior, another ex-FAB soldier was arrested in the same area, who was also a father of a student at the same high school. Reports suggest that the SNR are looking for a former student who is suspected of being involved with the car ambush in Cogo a few weeks prior.

On 1 October 2021, in the rural area of San Alfredo (Concepcion), military members of the Internal Defense Operations Command (CODI) shot and killed by mistake a hunter in a forest at San Francisco settlement. The military was in the area due to information that claimed that there was the presence of criminal groups in the zone, considering the 5 September attack on the nearby Jose'i farm. 1 fatality.

On 1 October 2021, in Pyin Htaung village of Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), about 30 military soldiers raided the village on suspicion of harbouring PDFs and fired random shots at villagers. Five villagers died, including about a 5-years-old boy. Some villagers who could not run were also arrested. The military also set a house on fire.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 1 October 2021, in Kawng Hmu Ton ward in Muse town (Muse Township, Muse District, Shan-North), the Myanmar military and People's militia forces raided the house of the alleged thief. As a man refused to open the door, the military and people's militia force shot and killed him.
On 1 October 2021, a person belonging to the Muslim community died in police custody in Mannar city, allegedly after being beaten by police. He was arrested on suspicion of possessing drugs.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Government of Burundi (2005-); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
notes: On 1 October 2021, police SNR abducted a hill chief and CNL member, in Rubirizi (Mugina, Cibitoke). He has yet to be found.

assoc_actor_2: Gurkha Ethnic Group (Myanmar); ABFSU: All Burma Federation of Student Unions; Students (Myanmar)
notes: On 1 October 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military arrested three protest leaders at one of the protest leaders' house in 30 September, including one Gurkha man who was also a member of ABFSU. The Gurka man died from torture during the interrogation on 1 October.

Around 1 October 2021 (month of), in Yekyi Pauk village (Amarapura township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), villagers were beaten by the military for tearing off leaflets threatening CDM teachers to return to work at the local administrative office.

On 1 October 2021, Bahraini police forces tortured a civilian after arresting him in an unclear location (coded to capital Manama) (Capital) for participating in protests. According to the victim's father, the Bahraini authorities forced the victim to confess of crimes he did not commit by violently torturing him and electrocuting him.

Around 1 October 2021 (beginning of month), a group of stability maintenance officers attacked a petitioner outside his residential building in Dadukou district (Dadukou, Chongqing), preventing him from leaving the building. The officers wounded the petitioner's leg with a knife, causing him to require over 40 stitches on his injuries in a hospital.
On 1 October 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military forces beat and arrested three youths, and confiscated their motorcycles.
On 30 September 2021, regime forces detained a number of shepherds in the vicinity of Maadan town in Ar Raqqa countryside for unknown reasons.

source: Midi Madagasikara; News Mada; L'Express de Madagascar
notes: On 30 September 2021, a mentally handicapped boy was fatally shot by a gendarmerie in Mahatsinjo (Anjozorobe, Analamanga). The motive for the shooting remains unclear.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Gendarmerie
assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Central African Republic); Taxi Drivers (Central African Republic)
notes: On 30 September 2021, a military officer from gendarmerie shot and injured two people, a moto taxi driver and a trader, for not stopping at a military checkpoint in Bangui - 3 (Arrondissement 3).

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
source: Caraota Digital; El Carabobeno; Efecto Cocuyo; La Patilla
notes: On 30 September 2021, in Ocumare del Tuy (Miranda), PNB police officers shot and killed a suspected member of Cachete crime group who was in their custody. Police initially reported the incident as an armed clash; however, video footage reveals the man had already surrendered when he was shot without apparent provocation. Reports indicate the police took the suspect from his family and shot him at point blank range, then attempted to simulate a confrontation by shooting up the surrounding area. Eight officers involved in the operation were later arrested for excessive use of force and homicide. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 30 September 2021, in Salvador, Bahia, two men and a child were shot and injured in the Sao Marcos neighborhood by military police forces during an intervention. There were no fatalities.

On 30 September 2021, in Pakokku town (Pakokku township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military and police stationed in the high school No (1) ordered pedestrians to kneel or squat under the hot sun by pointing with the gun. Some were also kicked with boots.

On 25 September 2021, a woman involved in a decades-long land dispute was placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) in Fushan (Yantai, Shandong).

On 24 September 2021, the military forces arrested and tortured 'hundreds' of people including women and children in a market of Bambui town, Tubah subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest). They were accused of not selling their products on Monday to comply with the Monday ghost town order by the Ambazonian separatists.

On 24 September 2021, in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), a 30-year-old man from Sein Pan ward was shot in the head and back and killed by military soldiers between 35th and 36th streets at around 3pm.
On 24 September 2021, policemen shot and killed a civilian at Obinomba (Ukwuani, Delta). The reason for the attack is unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of the Ivory Coast (2011-) Forest Guards
notes: On 24 September 2021, the security forces (assumedly Forest Guards) severely beat up and injured several young men who had gathered for the funeral of a deceased forest guard in Koumassi neighborhood of Abidjan city (Abidjian, Abidjan) for an unspecified reason.

On 24 September 2021, police officers shot and killed a boda boda driver for riding on the wrong side of Kirinyaga road in Nairobi city (Starehe, Nairobi). The police officer stopped the driver and demanded a bribe before shooting the driver.
On 24 September 2021, the military forces shot and killed 2 young men and injured another in Kosala village, Kumba town, Ekondo Titi subdivision (Ndian, Sud-Ouest).

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 24 September 2021, in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), a 50-year-old man from Sein Pan ward was taken away by plain clothed military soldiers and Pyu Saw Htee members from his home between 39th and 40th streets. He was found dead on a street later in the morning. Eyewitnesses stated that the deceased was a staunch NLD supporter and was shot in the head and stabbed in the neck.

Around 24 September 2021 (between 22 - 28 September), in Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military shot and killed two brothers who left Hpe Hlar village on September 22 to buy some food in Loikaw. Their bodies were found at Dawkaleik football stadium on 28 September.

On 24 September 2021, in Chaungkyi village, Thabeikkyin township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), Myanmar military forces set up a temporary base in the village and arrested, beat up and tortured villagers after MyTel telecom tower was blown up on September 20.

On 24 September 2021, in Yin Paung Taing village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), 14 people including 9 men and 5 women were arrested by the Myanmar military forces, and one man was tortured and shot dead. The Myanmar military troops also stormed a house and a shop in the village and took away belongings, as well as about 600,000 kyats worth of cell phones and 500,000 kyats in cash.

On 24 September 2021, police forces allegedly attacked a Dalit man in police custody at the police station in Bhatli town (Bargarh, Odisha), after he was arrested for rioting. He died of injuries the next day.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: On 24 September 2021, in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), a police officer member of INPEC (prison guard) was beaten by a group of three police officers while in police custody and handcuffed. The victim claimed that the agents arrested him while they were conducting a routine search at the store of one of his relatives. In addition, the victim claimed that the officers stole some of his belongings during the incident. The man was off-duty at the time of the attack. There were no fatalities.

On 24 September 2021, Taliban killed several people who were accused of having links with ISIS [over alleged IS links], after IS members attacked Taliban a day before it, in Muhmand Dara district, Nangarhar. No further information. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 24 September 2021, SNR agents abducted 2 prisoners from Mpimba prison in Musaga (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie).

On 24 September 2021, a female petitioner from Wuhan, Hubei, was intercepted by Wuhan stability maintenance officers and Beijing private security in Beijing. On the next day, she was escorted back to Wuhan and forcibly admitted to the psychiatric ward of Wuhan Hanyang Hospital. On 2 October 2021, the police arrested 10 of her supporters, attempting to rescue her from the hospital.

On 24 September 2021, in Santiago - Nunoa (Metropolitana), a police officer used excessive force during the arrest of a woman, who is also a current member of the Constituent Assembly. The incident occurred when police responded to a domestic violence call. A video leaked to the press shows the officer grabbing the victim by the neck and slamming her against a vehicle for her arrest. The woman reported injuries due to the incident. [women targeted: politicians]

Around 23 September 2021 (as reported), in Caracas - Baruta, Distrito Capital, police officers shot and killed a man in Las Minas sector. Authorities report the victim was killed in a confrontation. Family members rejected the official version from the state forces, reporting the crime was an extrajudicial killing. They claimed the police arrived at the house where the victim was with his two-year-old daughter. 1 fatality.

source: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 23 September 2021, in Bago town (Bago township, Bago district, Bago region), a man - who reportedly had been actively participating in anti-coup protest - was shot by military troops when military troops came to arrest him at his home at Zayar Aungmyay Street in Hinthagone 19th ward. His mother was also arrested and remained in custody at the time of reporting on 26 September. The man later died from his injuries on 24 September.

On 23 September 2021, in Tha Hpan Pin village (Bhamo township, Bhamo district, Kachin state), five locals were taken away by military troops as guides after more than 100 military soldiers were deployed in the village.

On 23 September 2021, in Kin village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military soldiers raided the village and blocked the entrance and exit of the village. They then arrested, handcuffed and beat up some young people in the village. Houses in the village were also ransacked.

On 23 September 2021, in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military opened fire on a workers' ferry crossing from Nyaung Pin Gyi to Monywa. A passenger on the boat said that two workers were hit and wounded by the bullets.

actor1: Police Forces of Kosovo (2020-) Regional Operations Support Units
notes: On 23 September 2021, a group of ROSU members beat three ethnic Serbs in Kopiloviq, Kosovo, The victims claimed the policemen insulted them and threatened to kill them. This happened near the border crossing Brnjak, where demonstrations have been going on for days. Two of the victims required hospitalization. Kosovo Police has not yet confirmed this incident.

On 23 September 2021, in Htone Bo Gyi village (Thaton township, Thaton district, Mon state), the Myanmar military's LIB 406 destroyed the U Shwe Twin petrol station and beat two villagers with their rifles.

Around 23 September 2021, a male suspect in a multiple homicide case was assaulted while in custody by police officers at the detention facility near Almaly district in Almaty city following which the Kazakh authorities launched an investigation into the incident.
On 23 September 2021, Taliban members captured two brothers who worked at the US base in Kandahar (not as soldiers). No further information. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
On 23 September 2021, NRF sources claimed that several civilians from Tajik ethnicity were killed by the Taliban in Khair Khana area of Kabul city. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 23 September 2021, police beat up a journalist attempting to report on the grenade attack on a colonel's house that evening in Kamenge (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). He was then arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency

PDEA said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the suspects.

On 23 September 2021, seven armed men on camels who dressed in the forces of unspecified 'regular' soldiers (and provisionally coded as SAF) shepherded a large number of camels and cattle into farms in the Tengara area of Tawila locality (North Darfur state) [coded to Tawila]. The attackers severely assaulted female farmers in the area.

On 22 September 2021, regime forces opened machine gun fire on a civilian's car while on his way to Artawaziya town in Ar Raqqa countryside, causing severe damage to his car. There were no casualties.

actor1: Police Forces of Palestine (2007-) Gaza Strip
notes: On 22 September 2021, the Gaza Strip police forces beat Palestinian students affiliated with Fatah Movement with sticks at Al Azhar University in Gaza (Gaza City, Gaza Strip). As a result, 2 students were bruised and taken to hospital for treatment, and 11 others were arrested. The police prevented students affiliated with Fatah Movement from organizing student festivals inside the university and prohibited them from wearing the Palestinian Keffiyeh. The police issued a statement a day prior explaining that their intervention was based on the university administration's decision to prevent student festivals due to coronavirus preventive measures.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: Around 22 September 2021 (as reported), Amhara regional special forces shot at civilian Oromo herders and killed several animals in Hartuma Furse town. Location not found, coded to ADM center town of Kombolcha (South Wello, Amhara). There were no fatalities.

On 22 September 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), a military officer opened fire on a civilian in an alleged case of police brutality. The officer shot at the man as he was walking near the military base. The victim was hospitalized due to his injuries. There is no further information as to why the officer opened fire.

On 22 September 2021, in Ma Gyi Kan village of Ayadaw township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested at least 20 villagers from Ma Gyi Kan and Kyar Pin Hla and beat them during questioning.

On 22 September 2021, in Nwe Inn village of Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), about 50 soldiers abducted 14 Nwe Inn villagers including under aged and old people to use as human shields on their journey to Min Tine Pin village.

actor1: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
notes: On 22 September 2021, RR personnel fired at a person who attempted to snatch their weapon at Baramulla city (J&K). He was shot in the legs.

Around 22 September 2021 (as reported), Taliban forces beat up a young boy and then shot him for unknown reason in Shaar-e-Now (close to Qalah-ye Fathullah) area of Kabul city. Unclear if the civilian has died.

Around 22 September 2021 (as reported), in Pan Yan village, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces raided the village and shot a villager. His body was later found near the bridge 2 miles from the village on 26 September 2021.

actor1: Police Forces of Uzbekistan (2016-) National Security Service

The six men include an army colonel, a senior police commissioner, a chief warrant officer, a former presidential adviser, and a businessman accused of 'conspiracy and plotting to destabilize the government'.

On 22 September 2021, police detained an electrician in Sochi, severely beating him at a local police station and on the road to it, demanding the victim confess to stealing 60 thousand rubles (approximately 800 USD) from an elderly couple who hired him for works at their home. The victim claimed he had not stolen the money and that a local police officer was trying to frame him for the crime due to a personal conflict. Several days later, the victim committed suicide, with his relatives claiming he had in fact been murdered by police.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Military Intelligence

The university administration denounced the incident that occurred inside the university campus and called on decision-makers to stop all forms of intervention inside the university. The police leadership expressed disapproval of the university administration's statement, stating that the police are coordinating with the administration to reveal the truth. The police force also explained that there was a prior agreement with the university to prevent holding student festivals based on coronavirus preventive measures.

On 21 September 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police officers opened fire at a group of young rappers who were using alleged fake weapons while filming a clip in Nord Alexis street (Ravine-Pintade). According to a resident, 11 young rappers were shot and killed at the scene. According to the Police, the neighbours alerted a patrol to the presence of armed men in the area. When the police arrived and heard detonations, they called for reinforcements and were 'forced to shoot' at the group that allegedly had weapons in their possession. The judge who visited the scene reportedly saw the bodies of two people with fake weapons. 11 fatalities.

On 21 September 2021, a man was allegedly assaulted by about 6 police officers at the Manzini Police Station (Kwaluseni, Manzini) for having disrespected a court judge. The man was shot in the leg by the judge in 2019 and was at the police station for a meeting regarding the case.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

On 21 September 2021, the Indonesian military forces opened fire from an army vehicle at a Papuan man who was standing in the middle of the road at Ipito Creek in Ugapuga village (East Kamu district, Dogiyai regency, Papua province). The shot was fired without warning. The motive was unclear. Casualties were unknown.

Around 21 September 2021 (as reported), in Kyaukpyu Township (Kyaukpyu District, Rakhine State), a man who was detained in Kyaukpyu Prison on charges under the Counter-Terrorism Law was admitted to the hospital on 21 September for internal injuries sustained after being beaten while in custody. On 21 September 2021, in Myo Gyi Kone village of Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), military soldiers shot and killed a villager who ran when he saw them.

On 21 September 2021, a petitioner was beaten up by Xinxu township CCP and government authorities at his residence in Jian city, Jiangxi (coded to Jizhou) for buying a train ticket to Beijing for submitting a petition. He was left having blood on his face.

On 21 September 2021, police forces assaulted several civilians in Tamale town (Tamale, Northern) during a control for illegal electricity connections.
On 21 September 2021, soldiers abducted and tortured 2 women and a man near Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza). The civilians were returned afterwards to Buringa with serious injuries.
On 21 September 2021, the Taliban tortured and shot a civilian in Kabul province. No further information if the civilians was killed.

On 21 September 2021, an army general and five of his bodyguards (assumed to be SSPDF) abducted a son-in-law of the general (who is also a youth leader in Lakes state) likely in the Sherikat neighborhood on the outskirts of Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The abductee was then taken to the Langbar area near Bor town, and was later released. Unconfirmed reports suggest the victim was beaten. The reason for the abduction is unclear, though one source reports that the abduction relates to a family dispute.

Around 21 September 2021 (as reported), Pakistan military forces fired at Baloch civilians in Aapsar area in Turbat city (Kech district, Balochistan). One woman was killed and another person was severely injured in the attack.

On 20 September 2021, Iranian police fired at a Baloch driver for not stopping in Qaleh Ganj city (Kerman) hitting him in the head and killing him as a result. The victim's vehicle did not have a number plate.
On 20 September 2021, URA forces from UPDF shot dead a civilian while enforcing an operation to impound unlicensed motorcycles in Arivu (Vurra, Arua).

On 20 September 2021, in the rural area of Tame (Arauca), residents denounced a suspected case of excessive use of force by the security forces. According to witnesses, military soldiers were conducting warrant searches in the area when multiple gunshots rang out, a few hours later a resident was reportedly shot dead by the military unit. Authorities claimed that the victim opened fire on security forces, while residents claimed that the house belonged to a local farmer who was not violent. Residents also reported that the victim's body was removed from the scene before other authorities arrived in the area. 1 fatality.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Irrawaddy; Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 20 September 2021, in Hlyaw Hpyu (Middle) village of Natogyi township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military raided and fired light and heavy arms at the village. A local PDF claimed there were no armed clashes, and soldiers were drunk and fired shots randomly. Locals claimed soldiers fired at houses of known NLD supporters. Other villagers had been injured, although the number had not been confirmed. Locals stated that soldiers had been occupying the village's school. Fatalites coded as 5 following the AAPP report.

On 20 September 2021, in Pakokku town (Pakokku township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military beat and arrested three locals from Sin Pauk Hla Ward in relation to the killing of a military informant.

On 20 September 2021, in Chaung Taung village of Ye township (Mawlamyine district, Mon state), military soldiers shot and killed an unknown civilian around 9 pm on suspicion of an attack on them. The Ye PDF reported that the victim was not one of their members.
On 20 September 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), the military fired at and arrested three young people including two university students at their houses.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force

Around 20 September 2021 (as reported), a student of journalism was arrested and tortured by the Taliban in Mazar-e-Sharif, Balkh. He was released about a month later, as reported on 21 October. The father of the person claimed that Taliban accused his son for being a spy of Fatemiyoun Division (Afghan Shia Militia fighting in Syria) but he was not affiliated with any group. On 20 September 2021, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), police shot and killed a presumably unarmed man in front of his family in their home in Las Minas de Baruta parish. Relatives of the victim deny that he had any ties to criminal groups. A local human rights organization reported the event as an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

On 20 September 2021, between Ah Htet Kha Mat and Pauk Pan Hpyu Su villages (coded as Pauk Pan Hpyu Su) (Kayan township, Yangon-South district, Yangon region), about 50 military troops arrested and beat fifteen people including a young woman and a child.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 19 September 2021, in Salvador, Bahia, two Black men were arrested by military police under charges of robbery. The police department later stated there were no arrest warrants for the victims nor were they in a circumstance that would justify being arrested for robbery. They were taken to a police station and later released. Both went missing and their bodies were found the following day in the Valeria neighborhood with gunshot wounds. The victims' family members believe they were executed in an extrajudicial killing by military police and the initial approach was motivated by racism. 2 fatalities.

On 19 September 2021, in Gawt Inn village, Auk Yae Hpyu village-tract, Launglon township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), Myanmar military forces fired shots at two civilians on a motorbike. One was seriously injured while the other was arrested.

On 19 September 2021, in Kyar Tet village, Salingyi township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces raided the village in search of a police who was on the run. One of the vehicles was stopped during the search and the driver was beaten by military forces.
On 19 September 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the military arrested seven young activists. A Students' Union member was also beaten during the arrest.

On 19 September 2021, police physically assaulted a disabled candidate to parliament from Yabloko: Russian United Democratic Party while detaining him, allegedly following an attempt by the candidate to report ballot stuffing at a voting precinct in St. Petersburg - Nevsky.
On 19 September 2021, a lieutenant in the police assaulted and confiscated items from a journalists at the Democrat newspaper in Khartoum (Khartoum state).

On 19 September 2021, a female independent journalist and an activist were taken away by police at a residence in Haizhu district, Guangzhou, ahead of the journalist's planned departure to study in the UK via Hong Kong. The pair was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location for 'incitement to subvert state power', mainly due to the regular gatherings of friends at the activist's home. On 5 November 2021, their family members received an arrest notice, stating that they had been officially arrested on 27 October 2021 and detained at Guangzhou No. 1 Detention Centre. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 18 September 2021, regime forces discharged small arms fire from across the Euphrates river in Deir-ez-Zor, wounding a civilian in Hajin. There were no fatalities.

Middle-aged men were beaten and arrested although the exact number of people arrested was not known.

On 17 September 2021, in Letpadan township (Thayarwady district, Bago-West region), a man was tortured and killed in military custody after he was accused of killing the military-appointed Village Administrator' personnel. He was one of 30 arrestees arrested on 16 September. The family found brusies and wounds on his dead body.

On 17 September 2021, in Myo Lu Lin village, Myothit township (Magway district, Magway region), Myanmar military forces shot a non-CDM teacher and beat a child who was with the teacher. The teacher later died at the hospital on 18 September 2021.

On 17 September 2021, in Ohn Taw ward 1, Taungdwingyi town (Magway district, Magway region), Myanmar military took away and beat up a man through the night. The man was later found dead in the next morning.
Around 17 September 2021 (as reported), Taliban entered a house where a wedding party was ongoing and beat a group of women who were listening to music in Takhar province (coded to Taluqan with GP3).

On 17 September 2021, two NGO aid workers were attacked and injured by the Chadian Army in Bekourou, situated 40km from Moissala (Barh Sara, Mandoul) for not showing up to their post before starting their activities.

On 17 September 2021, a video emerged showing two policemen holding a man on the ground for arresting him in Noisy-le-Grand. A third police officer arrived, punching and kicking the arrested man in the head.

On 17 September 2021, security forces in civilian clothes arrested an Al Karama Coalition MP using violence against him and his lawyers while presenting himself to the Military Tribunal in Tunis (El Omrane, Tunis). His whereabouts are unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Military Intelligence
notes: On 16 September 2021, the regime's military intelligence detained a number of young men in Sabka town in Ar Raqqa countryside for conscription.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 16 September 2021, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone, Rio de Janeiro, military police carried out an operation to curb criminal activities in the Vila Kennedy and Praca Seca neighbourhoods. Many civilians reported military police officers breaking into their private residence and going through their personal belongings.

actor1: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) DIRAN: Anti-Narcotics Directorate
source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On 16 September 2021, in a rural area of Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), anti-narcotics police forces used tear gas and flash bombs against indigenous people requesting they not spray the farmland with herbicides in the areas of the Sat Tama indigenous reserve area. The police was conducting an operation to eradicate illegal crops. Two indigenous women were injured.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 16 September 2021, in Ywar Ma, 115 mile in Muse Township, Muse District, Shan State, a car carrying military soldiers and PMF troops hit two women who were walking on the street. One died and one injuried. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 16 September 2021, a group of police officers tortured one suspected thief with a machete at a police station in Ngusso neighborhood of Yaounde city, Yaounde 1 subdivision (Mfoundi, Centre). They filmed themselves and shared the video on social media. 5 police officers were later arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 16 September 2021, in Barretos, Sao Paulo, military police officers approached three men and took a Black man to an abandoned house, where they tortured and assaulted him to force a drug trafficking confession. Another civilian attempted to record the assault, but was also assaulted and detained by the police. According to the officers, the victim and his friend were drug trafficking suspects. However, the victim and his family deny such claims and state that the attack was motivated by racism.

Around 16 September 2021 (between 14 - 17 September), in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay), a young man who was arrested by military soldiers on 14 September with five other youths on allegations of making weapons later died while in custody on 17 September.

Around 16 September 2021 (between 14 - 16 September), in Kale Township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), an arrestee was tortured and killed during interrogation. He was arrested and brought to Kale Regional Operation Command on suspicion of making handmade rifles on September 14.
On 16 September 2021, the military forces carried out a search operation in Babanki village, Tubah subdivision (Meme, Nord-Ouest), killing two civilians.

On 16 September 2021, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a journalist was attacked by police forces whilst being arrested by the latter. According to sources, the journalist reported to the police the wrongdoing of another driver on his way to cover an event. Minutes later, officials arrested the journalist and started beating him up and casting slurs on him. The journalist was released nine hours later and called for authorities to investigate the case.
On 16 September 2021, principle of a school was shot dead by the Taliban forces for an unknown reason in Now-Bahar village of Andarab district, Baghlan.

On 15 September 2021, in Dartmouth, Pomeroon-Supenaam, Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) officers shot and killed a man at his home during an anti-crime operation. According to relatives, the police shot at man while he was sleeping. Police said that the officers and the man engaged in a clash in which the man was shot in the shoulder. Nothing illegal was found in the house. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 15 September 2021, Houthi forces targeted farmers in their farms in Al Jah (Bayt Al Faqiah, Al Hudaydah) as well as citizens travelling on nearby roads with medium ranged automatic weapons and sniper rifles. Casualties unknown.

On 15 September 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced-evictee was taken away by Fengdu county police and government officers near her residence at Liangjiang New Area in Yubei District, Chongqing, and remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 17 September 2021. She had been a target of the state for many years for her petitioning.

On 15 September 2021, in San Pya village in Myaing township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), about 50 military soldiers based at a school in the village fired gunshots at three civilians passing through the school. A bullet hit one civilian and he died.

On 15 September 2021, in Se Taw village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers entered the village and fired gunshots indiscriminately. A bullet injured an elderly woman.

On 15 September 2021, in Kamaryut township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the Myanmar military raided two wards from 10 p.m. until the pre-dawn hours and arrested 11 civilians, including women. The military beat the detainees. They also beat detained women.

Around 15 September 2021 (as reported), in Pein Hne Taw village (Thaton Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military soldiers fired a gunshot at two civilians riding a motorcycle. One villager died and another was injured. The injured person was able to run away and escape. Location coded as Pein Hne Taw (Auk)

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 15 September 2021, in Sorocaba, Sao Paulo, an off-duty military police officer shot and killed a Black teenager in the Jardim das Flores neighborhood. The officer was in his car and approached the victim and his friend and physically assaulted them. They tried to run from the officer, who them fired shots to their backs. One victim was injured and the other killed. The officer was arrested two days later. The victim's family claim the attack was motivated by racism. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2021, at no. 44 (6th floor) on 22nd Street lower block in Latha township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), about 50 soldiers and police officers raided an apartment on 22nd street in the afternoon. A young man was killed after security forces opened fire during the raid. Three people were arrested, including the one who was shot dead. Residents stated that one of the young men was forced to kneel down in the middle of the street and beaten up by soldiers.

actor1: Police Forces of Gabon (2009-) Prison Guards
notes: On 15 September 2021, prison guards tortured a prisoner in a prison in Libreville city (Libreville, Estuaire). The victim later died from his wounds.
Around 15 September 2021 (month of), a soldier from the 12th Corps dispatched to Kapsan County (Ryanggang) sexually assaulted a woman.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 15 September 2021 (month of), in Caldas Novas (Goias), prison inmates were beaten up, tortured, and injured by prison guards inside a detainment facility. According to several prisoners, torture sessions perpetrated by state forces have become common inside the facility, especially after the appointment of a new prison director. There were no fatalities.

Around 15 September 2021, detained suspects were assaulted, tortured and denied access to medical care while in custody at the police detention facility in the town of Kaindy in Panfilov district of Chui region. The information was reported by their family members.

On 15 September 2021, in Aungpan Town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan South), the Myanmar military arrested a daughter of a veteran. The reason for the arrest was unknown. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 15 September 2021, in Pan village (Pale Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers raided the village and arrested about 40 villagers, including one health officer who joined the civil disobedience movement. The military beat all detainees. Detainees were released again on the following day. The military also searched houses and destroyed properties. Villagers fled to other safe areas.

On 15 September 2021, in Pan village (Pale Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers shouted 'GZ' and fired gunshots at 7 youths while youth were returning home after herding cattle. A bullet injured one youth, and the military also arrested all of them.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Afar Special Forces
notes: Around 15 September 2021 (week of), Afar Regional Special Forces reportedly beat ethnic Tigrayan prisoners in Semera (Awsi-Zone 1, Afar) accusing them of being linked to the TPLF. Injuries to the legs and heads of several prisoners were documented. Several of the prisoners had been recently deported from Saudi Arabia.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 15 September 2021 (week of), prison guards reportedly beat ethnic Tigrayan prisoners in Shone (Hadiya, SNNP) accusing them of being linked to the TPLF. Injuries were documented, no fatalities. Several of the prisoners had been recently deported from Saudi Arabia.

On 15 September 2021, in San Pya village of Myaung township (coded as Myaung) (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military forces opened fire and a young man was killed. They also burned down a charity car and 100 motorcycles.
On 15 September 2021, police fired upon a Kurdish man in Maku city (West Azerbaijan) on suspicion of him smuggling goods. He was reportedly injured, resulting in a traffic accident that killed him.
Around 14 September 2021 (as reported), a man was beaten and severely injured by members of the police and defense forces in block 7, Gaborone (Gaborone, South East) for breaking the curfew.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Municipal Guards
notes: On 14 September 2021, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone, Sao Paulo, municipal guards threw flash bombs and shot rubber bullets at civilians in the Luz neighborhood. A street cleaner, homeless individuals, and drug users were hit and injured.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Now
notes: On 14 September 2021, in Taung Bet village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the pro-military group Pyu Saw Htee and military soldiers detained and killed a woman. She worked as an accountant for Pauk People's Defense Force. The military also took 180 lakhs Myanmar kyats when they detained him.

On 14 September 2021, in Khin Ba Lu village (Salin Township, Minbu District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military raided a house of Salin Township NLD Executive Committee member's house and fired a gunshot at a Township EC member. The bullet hit him and he died.

On 14 September 2021, in Bi Kho village (Twantay Township, Yangon-South District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military and police detained and killed two villagers, including aid workers. The military accused them of being a member of the People's Defense Force. Fatalities coded as 2.

On 14 September 2021, in Aye Chan Thar San Pya village in Myaing township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military raided the village. They detained three youths, beat and killed them. Although the reason for the raiding of the village was unknown, there was fighting between the military and local resistance fighters about 3 miles from the village on 9 September.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
notes: On 14 September 2021, in Myit Kyoe village (Bilin Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military troops and BGF troops from battalion-2 of BGF-1013 abducted 6 village elders and 5 truck drivers. They forced them to transport military and BGF food supplies to their camp. They used five villagers' trucks with five drivers to transport supplies while 6 village elders were used as human shields.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 14 September 2021, elements of the FARDC (who were on patrol) killed 1 man and injured another one in the village of Kamulima (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu).

On 14 September 2021, policemen allegedly used excessive violence arresting a man in Annemasse. A video shows a police officer slapping the arrested man, already handcuffed, while another holds him by the neck.
On 14 September 2021, 1 member of the former Afghan security personnel was killed by the Taliban in Herat province.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service

actor1: Police Forces of Syria (2000-) State Security
notes: On 14 September 2021, the regime's State Security opened fire on a group of young men while they were cutting trees in Hersh Sad Al Jbeliah west of Nawa town in Dara countryside, injuring one of them, while four were arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 13 September 2021, the military forces killed several civilians in a raid in Kumbo town (Bui, Nord-Ouest). This was allegedly a retaliation after a military car hit an IED earlier in the area. The army denies having killed civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 13 September 2021, suspected police officers abducted a man who was a sergeant police officer (assumed off-duty) near Delmonte area in Thika town (Thika Town, Kiambu). The victim was based at Laisamis police station in Marsabit county.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
notes: On 13 September 2021, Oromia regional special police shot and killed a young man in Meta woreda, West Shewa (Ejere-Addis Alem, Oromia), after accusing him of being associated with OLF-Shane.

source: Yemen Data Project; Al Mahrah Post
notes: On 13 September 2021, Saudi security forces tortured and killed a Yemeni businessman in Jizan province. According to the source, the businessman was arrested a week ago and was tortured to death by Saudi forces that suspected that he was supplying the Houthis with information.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
notes: On 13 September 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), PNB officers shot and killed a man in his home in Barrio Nuevo neighborhood of Catia sector. Authorities report the victim was killed in a confrontation, but family witnesses refute the official narrative of a clash, stating the officers entered their house, forced the victim up to the second floor and shot him repeatedly while the rest of the family waited downstairs. 1 fatality.
On 13 September 2021, in Let Pan Thone Pin village (Waw Township, Bago District, Bago-East), the Myanmar military arrested and beat a Township NLD member to death. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 13 September 2021, in Shwe Sar Yay village of Budalin township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military tied up, beat and arrested two young men who attempted to flee after military forces entered the village. One of them was a disabled person and locals claimed they were arrested for forced labour.

On 13 September 2021, in Kyaw Se village, Kyauk Pyoke village track (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military killed four villages. They accused them of giving information to the PDF. They also arrested 11 old people from the village. The arrested people were released again on 14 September. The attack on civilians came after the Kalemyo Guerrilla Force ambushed the military troops near the village on Metta River bridge on the same day.

On 13 September 2021, a male resident of Andizhan city was assaulted by police officers of police station 4 following a car accident after which prosecutor's office launched a criminal investigation charging policemen with assault.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 13 September 2021 (as reported), at least 10 complaints for beatings were filed by inmates at a prison in Angarsk. The beatings occurred after prisoners started a hunger strike following the death of two fellow prisoners, which they considered suspicious.

actor1: Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Bangladesh Ansar
source: Daily Star (Bangladesh); New Age (Bangladesh); Prothom Alo
notes: On 13 September 2021, a student of Jahangirnagar University (JU) was assaulted by a group of 7-8 Ansar members at National Martyrs' Memorial in Savar, after he raised his voice against alleged irregularities by Ansar members in charge of the memorial. He was hospitalized. The accussed Ansar members were laid off.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Afghanistan (2021-) Special Forces
notes: On 13 September 2021, 1 member of the former Afghan special forces was shot by the Taliban in Kabul city. He was receiving threats from Taliban and tried to contact British embassy about the incident days before, as he has previously worked and trained by British forces.

On 13 September 2021, in Ingalone village, Kungyangon township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), Myanmar military forces raided the village and questioned locals about the recent killing of a military informant in the village. Troops publicly tortured 82 villagers who were forced to lie face down on the road while soldiers beat them up with bamboo sticks, plastic pipes and ropes. One villager later died of torture wounds a few days later on 17 September.

On 13 September 2021, in Lanus (Buenos Aires), an off-duty police officer shot and killed a teenager in the Villa Diamante neighborhood. The officer claimed that the victim and another person tried to rob him, but no pieces of evidence or witnesses confirmed his version. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces

The killing was reported by local sources and a human rights organization as an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.
Around 13 September 2021 (as reported), a women was shot and killed by the Taliban forces in Kabul province. She as stated to be pregnant, no information on the motive.

source: Irrawaddy; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: Around 13 September 2021 (as reported), near Maw Lel village (Gangaw Township, Gangaw District, Magway Region), locals discovered two Lel Shae villagers' dead bodies. The military tortured them to death. Locals buried their bodies on the scene because their bodies were so mutilated.
On 12 September 2021, Iranian police fired at a vehicle carrying Afghan refugees at Marsad checkpoint near Kerman city (Kerman) injuring three of them as a result.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Military Intelligence
notes: On 12 September 2021, members of the regime's military intelligence kidnapped a man in As-Sweida for unknown reasons.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Military Intelligence
