actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: On 12 September 2021, in Sao Paulo - North Zone, Sao Paulo, a Black off-duty prison guard was approached by four military police officers near the Santana neighborhood. The officers stepped out of their vehicle pointing a gun at him, as he announced he was also part of the police forces. They used chokehold to keep the victim still, threw him to the ground, and handcuffing him. According to the victim, officers used excessive force, injuring his elbows, while calling him by pejorative slurs. According to the officers, the man resisted their stop order and injured one of them during the approach.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Myanmar (2016-); NLD: National League for Democracy
notes: On 12 September 2021, in Baik Kar village (Kyaikto Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar miliary raided the house of a member of the Kyaikto Township NLD Executive Committee. As they didn't find an executive committee member they were looking for, they arrested her husband and one villager. Her spouse also previously served as Village Clerk at Township General Administration Office. She managed to flee and evade arrest. Another arrested villager was released on the following day. On 16 September, the military informed the relatives that the arrested spouse of a member of the NLD Executive Committee had died of COVID-19, although the family noticed injuries consistent with torture.
On 12 September 2021, in Kyauk Yit village (coded as Kyauk Yit (East)) of Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military set some houses on fire and shot and killed 7 villagers.

On 12 September 2021, in Patheingyi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military fired gunshots at three youths passing in front of the military base in a motorcycle. One youth died and another one was injured.

On 12 September 2021, in Taung Hlyaung Ywar Ma village (coded as Taung Hlyaung (East)) of Taungdwingyi township (Magway district, Magway region), about 60 military soldiers raided the village and fired at villagers who ran. Two locals were killed and four others were arrested.

On 12 September 2021, in Shwebo town (Shwebo township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military arrested and beat a wife and two sons of a police officer who joined the civil disobedience movement.

On 12 September 2021, in Kyauk Pyoke village of Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village. Locals reported that the military set some houses on fire and killed three villagers from Kyaukse village.
On 12 September 2021, Malian soldiers killed a male person in the town of Goumbou (Nara, Koulikoro).

On 12 September 2021, a woman was tortured and killed by police officers during interrogation in Chivhu (Chikomba, Mashonaland East). The victim was being accused of concealing money stolen by her sister.

On 12 September 2021, in Frontera Comalapa, Chiapas, a man and a woman from Haiti were detained by agents of the National Institute of Migration and were beaten up after they resist being arrested. The woman who was pregnant had a miscarriage after the attack. The event was recorded in video.

On 12 September 2021, an underage girl was allegedly beaten by a police officer at a police station in Berdsk, where she had been taken following a complaint filed by her mother and grandmother, who claimed to have asked for police intervention after the girl refused to return home. [women targeted: girls]
On 12 September 2021, soldiers from the Muzinda camp abducted an ex-FAB soldier in Mutakura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

On 12 September 2021, SSPDF loyal to Maj. Gen. James Nando abducted a health worker at or near to Tambura town (Tambura county, Western Equatoria state), detaining the man and forcing him to remain nude whilst in captivity. A guard from the Joint Defence Board intervened, and the man was released the following day.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Irrawaddy
notes: Around 12 September 2021 (between 10 - 14 September), near Maw Lel village (Gangaw Township, Gangaw District, Magway Region), locals discovered two Mwe Lel villagers' dead bodies on 13 September and one more on 14 September after the military detained some Mwe Lel villagers following the clash between the resistance fighters and military soldiers on 10 September. The military tortured them and cut their genitals. There were also cuts on their hands and legs. Locals buried their bodies on the scene because their bodies were so mutilated.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: On 12 September 2021, military forces (National Intelligence Agency) abducted a security guard in Musaga (Muha, Bujumbura Mairie). The victim was employed at the Russian embassy of Burundi.

On 11 September 2021, regime forces physically assaulted teachers and students at two schools in Zanoud neighborhood of Quamishli city in al-Hasakeh. The assault came as regime forces forcibly evacuated the two schools to take them over and turn them into command centers. There were no casualities.

source: Swaziland Media Commentary; Times of Swaziland
notes: On 11 September 2021, three young individuals were beaten by security forces with a stick, forced to do push-ups and eat raw meat in Mbangweni neighborhood, Mbabane (Mbabane East, Hhohho) for breaking the curfew.
Around 11 September 2021, a police officer beat up a woman during an altercation at a police checkpoint in Obeagu (Agwu, Enugu).

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police

The victim's friend was shot and killed. Police claim there was a confrontation taking place. However, the victim's family and witnesses deny those claims. The police officers involved are under investigation. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 11 September 2021, in Itu, Sao Paulo, three military police officers assaulted and injured a teenager in the Sao Judas neighborhood. According to camera footage, one of the officers started to beat the victim with a nightstick while he was on the street. According to officers, the victim had expressed threats against them while they were dispersing a crowd. According to a victim's family member, he was mistaken for a homeless person and offenders tried to hide their identities as police officers. Police claim that the officers involved in the case were removed from their posts.

Around 11 September 2021 (as reported), near San Pya Chauk Maing village, Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), four people - including two young men - were detained and sent to an interrogation camp by military forces. In a photo widely circulated on Facebook, reportedly posted by military soldiers, two of the four detainees were badly beaten and seen kneeling down while tied up in ropes.

On 11 September 2021, in Pyigyitagon township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military in plain clothes arrested three young men in Kan Gyi Kone ward for unknown reasons. Witnesses said arrestees were beaten until they bled.

On 11 September 2021, in Kan Thit village of Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military detained and interrogated a motorcycle repair mechanic while he was working at a workshop in relation to the destruction of a military telecom tower. He was shot and killed while being interrogated at the workshop.

On 11 September 2021, in Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military shot and killed two men who happened to be passing by on a motorbike while the military were inspecting areas where the explosion and destruction of Mytel telecom towers occurred.

Around 11 September 2021 (between 10 - 11 September), in Tamu town (Tamu township, Tamu district, Sagaing region), a Gurkha man who was arrested by the military while he was returning from his friend's house on the night of 10 September was found dead on the next morning on 11 September. His body was found with bruises and bullet wounds.

source: Khaama Press; TOLO News; Pajhwok Afghan News

Some women in the house were beaten. The Taliban claimed that they were conducting a check on the house and were met with armed fire.

On 11 September 2021, in in Kingston, Kingston, police officers allegedly opened fire at a number of houses where residents were not adhering to the curfew restrictions in Delacree Pen neighbourhood. The police has emphatically rejected this story. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Iran (1989-) Islamic Republic of Iran Border Guard Command

source: Rukhshana Media; Hasht-e Subh; Etilaat e Roz
notes: On 11 September 2021, Taliban shot and killed a woman belonging to Hazara ethnic group in Mahtab Qala area of Kabul city. The Taliban denied involvement and blamed thieves for her killing. Witnesses said it was Taliban.

On 11 September 2021, in Tedim town (Tedim township, Falam district, Chin state), while people were passing by on a motorcycle in front of the Tedim Myo Ma police station, police opened fire on them. A Gawngmual villager was killed and two others were injured.

On 10 September 2021, in Aungmyaythazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military soldiers stationed at a checkpoint fired shots at two motorcyclists for reasons unknown. A female employee working at the nearby Denko petrol station and hit and wounded by stray bullets.

On 10 September 2021, 3 detainees who were kept in the police headquarter building in Seyhan town, Mersin were tortured by police officers. The detainees were reportedly beaten up and subject to high-pressure water as they were stripped naked. Faces of the victims got swollen due to the violence.

On 10 September 2021, in Arroyo Naranjo, La Habana, two alleged state security agents beat the vice-president of the Cuban Libertarian Party Jose Marti with a baseball bat, near his home in Los Pinos neighbourhood. According to the victim, perpetrators continued to beat him when he was on the floor, telling him that they attacked him for posting news on social media against the Cuban regime and threatening to kill him if he continued to report. Two residents prevented the attack from continuing by throwing stones and the alleged State Security agents fled in a vehicle where two other men were waiting for them. There were no fatalities.
On 10 September 2021, soldiers beat a taxi driver and killed him over violation of the curfew in Farin Gada (Jos North, Plateau) coded to Jos.
On 10 September 2021, a policeman killed a civilian woman at her mother's shop during a raid in Surulere (Mushin, Lagos).

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 10 September 2021, in Guaruja, Sao Paulo, military police shot and killed two construction workers during an operation against drug trafficking in the Morro dos Macacos community. According to witnesses, officers entered the area shooting at the victims several times, and both men were unarmed and had no involvement in drug trafficking activities. According to a declaration by the public security secretary, officers saw three suspects that were apparently armed, and one of them managed to escape from the scene. 2 fatalities.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 10 September 2021, in Kyay Mon village of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military raided houses and arrested 11 villagers. The arrestees were also beaten. Two of them were released later.

Around 25 August 2021 (between 24 - 25 August), in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a young man who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in Yadarnarbon ward on 24 August later died on 25 August while in custody. While security forces claimed that he had died of coronavirus, his family stated that his body was found with injuries consistent with torture.

Around 400 neighbors and witnesses signed a petition refuting the official narrative of a clash, stating that the victim was unaffiliated with criminal activity and that he was shot while he and his friends attempted to flee from the gunshots. 1 fatality.
On 17 August 2021, the commander of a military unit attacked the prefect of Wour (Tibesti Ouest, Tibesti) at his home over a dispute regarding the seizure of 37 vehicles from Libya.
Around 17 August 2021 (as reported), soldiers killed a man while shooting in the air sporadically in Aba (Aba South, Abia). The reason for the shooting is unknown.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 17 August 2021, in Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), two drunk military soldiers shot a civilian in the head at close range for not wearing a mask while he was waiting at the speed boat jetty for his friend. DVB reported two deaths, although AAPP claimed that the second person died of a heart attack after hearing the sound of gunshots and witnessing the dead body of the man. RFA reported three deaths from Kyun Taw, Pyi Kan, and Min Sar villages. Fatality coded as 2.

On 17 August 2021, in Taungdwingyi town, Taungdwingyi township (Taungdwingyi District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military arrested a man along with his wife, his 13-year-old daughter and 11-year-old son. He was also beaten. He was an NLD supporter.

On 17 August 2021, in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military forces in civilian clothes arrived at the gathering point of a protest and fired shots to crack down on anti-coup protesters who had gathered before an anti-coup protest was held. More military forces in private cars then arrived and searched the neighborhood. No casualties reported. A motorbike was taken.
On 17 August 2021, in Kamaryut township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the military and police forces arrested a young man who was passing by the Shwe Htanpin Condo for unknown reasons.
On 17 August 2021, police baton charged and assaulted several journalists during an ongoing Muharram procession in Srinagar city (J&K). Their equipment was left damaged in the act.

On 17 August 2021, Assam Police opened fire on three Mizo civilians on the Assam-Mizoram border at Bilaipur (Hailakandi district, Assam) when they had crossed the border for some work amid the Assam-Mizoram border conflict. One civilian was injured in the firing. Assam police claimed that there was also firing on behalf of the group from Mizoram.

Around 17 August 2021 (as reported), a former Afghan commander who was seeking refuge at his Taliban commander relative in the Deh Adam Khan area of Nahr-i-Saraj district, Helmand, was taken into custody by Taliban members. His whereabouts are unknown.

On 17 August 2021, police fired indiscriminately at a civilian in a vehicle in the village of Mehrabad in Khaf county (Razavi Khorasan) who was alleged to have been carrying smuggled goods. As a result of the shooting he was severely injured.

notes: On 16 August 2021, at least 10 people were killed as the people rushed into the Kabul airport following the Taliban capture of Kabul city a day earlier. The people were killed both by the gun fires and a stampede but the exact numbers caused by the gunfire and the actor firing on civilians remained unknown. No fatalities coded for this incident.

An anonymous court official stated that more than 50 people arrested in the area during the weekend would soon be tried before a military court, but it is unclear whether these trials are related to the apparently extrajudicial arrests reported by locals and family members, who furthermore deny the victims' involvement in criminal or armed groups.

Police pushed a Tibetan, who objected to being searched, into the Yangtse River, resulting in him being believed dead. Police then shot and wounded another Tibetan who attempted to intervene.

On 15 August 2021, in Kyauk Khe Tet village (Mingin township, Kale district, Sagaing region), a group of about 20 military soldiers and Pyu Saw Htee beat and arrested six villagers. Three of them were women and they were released later in the evening.

The victim claimed that her sexual identity triggered the attack as officers forced her to show her breast to them. There were no fatalities.

Around 9 August 2021 (as reported), police allegedly beat an underage boy at an undetermined location in the Republic of Buryatia (capital: Ulan-Ude) after detaining him for being outside during curfew hours.
Around 9 August 2021, beatings of men were reported at the so-called 'Okrestina' prison in Minsk - Maskouski.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
source: Orange County Register; Los Angeles Times
notes: On 9 August 2021, Tustin Police officers shot and killed an unarmed man, Luis Manuel Garcia-Arias, in Tustin (California). Officers responded to a call made by a resident that day, where she claimed that her neighbor saw Garcia armed with a large knife the day before. The caller claimed she had just seen Garcia in the area but was unsure if he was armed. After locating Garcia and asking him to exist the bushes where he had been sleeping, an officer deployed a stun gun on Garcia. The officer claimed to have seen a plastic bag and 'long, skinny stick-like object' in one of Garcia's hands. As Garcia exited the bushes, an officer fired two shots. Garcia dropped the stick and attempted to run before being handcuffed by police. Officers rendered first aid on the scene before Garcia was hospitalized, where he died from the gunshot wounds. Police released body camera footage of the incident in October 2021. According to his family, Garcia was suffering from mental illness and was experiencing homelessness.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Federal Security Service
notes: Around 9 August 2021 (as reported), a Russian activist who had earlier been sentenced to prison in the 'Network' ('Set') case, which leading international human rights groups claim is politically motivated, reported that he had been tortured by Federal Security Service officers while under arrest at the FSB regional headquarters in St. Petersburg - Tsentralny. The former prisoner claimed that officers tied his hands to his legs, pressed their knees against his body and applied electricity to his fingers.

actor1: Police Forces of Israel (2021-) Prison Guards
source: Palestine News and Information Agency; Dunia Al Watan; Ma'an News Agency
notes: On 8 August 2021, Israeli prison guards physically beat up Palestinian prisoners and searched their Belongings after they had stormed the Palestinian prisoners' units at Eshel Prison in Beer Sheva (Beer Sheva). No injuries reported.

source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Haber Ercis
notes: On 8 August 2021, Turkish soldiers physically assaulted 2 civilians that crossed the border illegally from Syria to Nusaybin district of Mardin. At least 10 soldiers reportedly tortured the victims for hours, beating them with sticks, plastic hoses and steel bars. Victims lost their consciousness due to the violence they were subject to, and got injuries in various parts of their bodies.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Venezuela (1999-); PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
notes: On 8 August 2021, in El Baul (Cojedes), four police officers on two motorcycles reportedly shot at the mayor of Giradot municipality in a drive-by shooting. The mayor, who survived the attack unharmed, stated he and his campaign staff were followed and shot at while on their way to a polling place for the PSUV primary elections. Two of the perpetrators were later identified as officers of the Tinaquillo municipal police force, and investigators seized a Glock pistol and two motorcycles following the incident. No injuries nor fatalities occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: On 8 August 2021, a man from Hama died as a result of torture or ill treatment, likely at Patrol Palestine Branch in Damascus, after nearly two years in prison.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 8 August 2021, LDUs and police officers shot and injured a boda boda rider for allegedly violating the curfew rules in Bweyogerere (Kira, Wakiso). No fatalities were reported.

Around 8 August 2021, a teenage boy was beaten, cut with a panga and injured by a police officer in a police station in Chiponde (Likoma, Northern). The teenager was arrested under suspicions of having robbed a mobile phone.
On 8 August 2021, soldiers killed a male civilian (alleged to be a militant informant) in the village of Bouni (Bourasso, Kossi).

On 8 August 2021, in Ho Pong village (Namhkan township, Muse district, Shan-North state), the military entered the village after a clash with the TNLA and shot a 70-year-old man who was looking out a window. Locals sent the old man to hospital for medical treatment as he sustained injuries in the mouth.

On 8 August 2021, near Me Oe and Let Yet Kone villages (coded as Let Yet Kone) (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), about 100 military soldiers came and shot indiscriminately at the surrounding villages. A farmer from Let Yet Kone village was injured from the rounds.

On 8 August 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago-West region), the military arrested the NLD party secretary of Zigon town and his friend. The NLD secretary had been charged with penal code 505(a) and article 66(d) and was in hiding. They were brought to Pyay town interrogation center and a witness said he was beaten during the arrest.
On 8 August 2021, in Myin Tan Kyay village (Tabayin Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military detained 7 villagers and used them as guides and human shields.
On 8 August 2021, a policeman and his brother attacked and killed a journalist in Nandyal town (Kurnool, AP) for writing about illegal activities of policemen in the district.
On 8 August 2021, the military forces shot and killed one woman during a raid in Ndop town (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest).

On 8 August 2021, a disabled vendor was hit in his head by urban management officers with a small chair at a market in Xinluo district (Longyan, Fujian) while he was selling goods. He suffered headaches and dizziness, causing him to stay at a hospital for 52 days. The vendor had been petitioning for oppression for over 20 years.

Around 8 August 2021 (as reported), 4 civilians were killed and a number injured when the Afghan security personnel opened fire on their vehicle in Maidan Shahr city, Wardak. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 4)
Around 8 August 2021 (as reported), 5 civilians were killed and 5 wounded during attacks by the Afghan security personnel in Ghazi Abad district, Kunar. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 5).

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 8 August 2021, police slammed a 23-year-old Black man against a fence and punched him multiple times in Washington DC - Southeast (District of Columbia) during an arrest for allegedly possessing an unregistered handgun and assaulting a police officer. Police officers allegedly inflicted a broken nose, multiple fractures in the face, and possible neurological damage to the man. All charges against the man were reportedly dropped, and DC's Chief of Police Robert J. Contee denounced the handling of the arrest. Police Chief Contee reportedly suspended the three officers involved and referred them to the prosecutors' officer for possible criminal prosecution.

source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 7 August 2021, in Sao Paulo - North Zone, Sao Paulo, a military police officer shot and killed a Black man at a bar in the Vila Medeiros neighborhood, after thinking that he had stolen his mobile phone. The officer was arrested, accused of homicide and, after killing the victim, he found his mobile phone inside his car. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 7 August 2021 (as reported), a man from Safsafa died as a result of torture or ill treatment in an unidentified regime prison following 5 years of detention. Unknown location coded to Sidnaya military prison.

notes: Around 7 August 2021 (as reported), FARDC soldiers raped 3 women in Njango village, located in the Walendu Pitsi sector (Djugu, Ituri) [coded as Lokpa]. The FARDC subsequently denied the allegations. A man was also injured.

On 7 August 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Mambaling, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they identified to be on the Top 10 list of high value targets in the region.

On 7 August 2021, in Tha Pyay Kone village of Myanaung township (Hinthada district, Ayeyarwady region), a villager who was arrested and detained by the Tha Pyay Kone police died later on the same day at a hospital from severe injuries. His whole body was found full of bruises and wounds from torture. Two other villagers who were arrested together with him on the same day have been released.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; ABS-CBN
notes: On 7 August 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Santa Rosa II (Marilao, Bulacan, Central Luzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they identified to be a supplier of shabu in Metropolitan Manila.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Tanod
source: Philippine News Agency; Manila Bulletin; Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS-CBN
notes: On 7 August 2021, a civilian who was allegedly violating coronavirus quarantine protocol and curfew hours was shot dead by a village watchman in Tondo, Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The slain civilian was reportedly suffering from a mental illness. The village watchman was arrested by the police. The incident provoked outcry and the government reiterated that village watchmen are not allowed to be armed by law. The Commission on Human Rights started an investigation.

On 6 August 2021, Police officers allegedly opened fire targeting a civilian vehicle carrying 3 adults and 3 children following an argument with the driver at a roadside checkpoint in Kiziltepe district of Mardin. 6 bullets reportedly hit the car, no casualties occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 6 August 2021, Houthi forces fired automatic weapons in Hays district (Al Hudaydah) injuring a boy with a gunshot through his hand.

On 6 August 2021, in Medellin, Antioquia, police officers killed a man in Aranjuez neighborhood, and moved his body to the police vehicle, disobeying the standard procedures in that case. Investigations to clarify the circumstances of the attack are underway. 1 fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 6 August 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in one of regime prisons in Damascus city, after his arrest on May 2017.

On 6 August 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), about 20 members of the armed forces in civilian clothes raided a house in Ward 7 and arrested a younger brother instead of the person who was targeted after being charged with article 505(a). The younger brother was beaten in interrogation. Both his legs were broken. The military informed the family about his status but did not allow medical treatment.
Around 6 August 2021, members of a Belarusian organized crime police unit reportedly beat an anarchist detainee in a prison in Minsk - Kastrychnitski, threatening him and cutting his dreads.

On 6 August 2021, a young man died during transportation to a hospital in Lubin, after forcible detention by law enforcers for alleged aggressive behavior. The police and doctors claimed that his death was caused by a drug overdose. The incident caused a nation-wide outrage regarding possible police brutality and incited demonstrations, including violent ones.

Around 6 August 2021 (as reported), 2 civilians were killed by Afghan forces fire in Pul-e Khumri city, Baghlan. 6 civilians were arrested during other attacks. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2 fatalities).
Around 6 August 2021 (as reported), 3 civilians were killed and 1 was wounded by Afghan forces fire in Musahi district, Kabul. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 3 fatalities).

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 5 August 2021 (as reported), prison guards tortured and withheld care from a prisoner being held in Makamba's prosecutor's prison (Makamba, Makamba). He is accused of a grenade attack and was arrested on 11 June 2021.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 5 August 2021, police SNR attacked and killed a prisoner in the police SNR prison of Cibitoke city (Rugombo, Cibitoke). Police accused the man of being a rebel, and threw the body into the Rusizi river.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: Around 5 August 2021, LDUs and regular military forces beat and seriously injured a man for allegedly violating the curfew rules in Nakawa (Kampala, Central). No fatalities were reported.

On 5 August 2021, the military forces killed around 7 people during a raid in Meluf village, Kumbo subdivision (Bui, Nord-Ouest). This was a retaliation after an IED attack on them earlier.

On 5 August 2021, a female UN staff member (who is South Sudanese) was assaulted by SSPDF and SSNPS at an unspecified location along the road to Paloich (assumed to be a reference to Paloc, which is also known as Paloich) in Rumbek East county (Lakes state) [coded to Paloc]. actor1: Police Forces of Kyrgyzstan (2017-2020) Prison Guards
notes: On 5 August 2021, a male prisoner was assaulted and tortured by 5-6 guards at the 16th penal colony in the village of Belovodskoe in Moskva district of Chui region for being late to morning count.

On 5 August 2021, government police officers, manning a security post, opened fire on a tuk tuk driver passing through the Bakaaro junction in Mogadishu - Hawl Wadaag (Banadir). The driver and a female passenger were killed. The motive was reported that the tuk tuk driver ignored the SNPF signal to stop.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) 22nd Armored Brigade
notes: On 4 August 2021, pro-Hadi forces of the Islah-affiliated 22nd Armored Brigade, which were led by Ezzedin Al Mikhlafi, abducted 8 civilians in Salh district (Taizz). The reasons for the abductions were unknown.

On 4 August 2021, a group of soldiers who survived an IED attack opened fire on civilians on their way from the point of the attack to Yungkui village, near Tadu village, Kumbo subdivision (Bui, Nord-Ouest). 5 people were killed including a carpenter and his 3 apprentices, and a woman.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 4 August 2021, Amhara regional special forces shot and killed a civilian man in Lalibela town (North Wello, Amhara) who was asking them to stay and protect the town from incoming TPLF forces.

On 4 August 2021, near Ma Kawng Taung village, La War village track (Hpakant Township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military abducted two villagers and used them as human shields. Both of them were injured during a clash between the KIA and the military at Nawng Hkam Bum. Later, the military released the injured two abductees were released.

Around 4 August 2021 (month of), in Ye town (Ye township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the authorities informed relatives that a prisoner died due to diabetes. The relatives were allowed to see his face only. His teeth and eyes were wounded. It is believed that the authorities (believed to be the military and police) beat him to death.
Around 4 August 2021 (as reported), 1 civilian was shot and killed by Afghan forces in Puli Alam city, Logar. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).
Around 4 August 2021 (as reported), 2 civilians were wounded by Afghan forces fire in Shibirghan city, Jowzjan.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 4 August 2021, the chief of the SNR and a police officer abducted a prisoner in Musaga (Muha, Bujumbura).

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 4 August 2021, Houthi forces abducted, tortured, and killed a civilian from the Al Sawad tribe in As Sawadiyah district (Al Bayda) before dumping his body in At Tahiriyah area. The source claimed that Houthi forces were attempting to create discord between the Al Sawad and Al Tahir tribes in the district.

On 3 August 2021, in the rural area of Ensenada (Buenos Aires), the police invaded a house while chasing a thief, mistook its owner with the thief, beat him, and pointed him a gun. His relatives were also beaten after trying to help him. The police tried to prevent them from reporting the case as means to cover up for their co-workers. The Commission for Memory (CPM), in its capacity as Local Mechanism for Torture Prevention in Buenos Aires, reported the case to the D. A. Office.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 3 August 2021, members of the armed forces killed 6 civilians in Bang (Ngaoundaye, Ouham-Pende). The event was reported by the 3R group.
Around 3 August 2021 (as reported), the police forces severely beat up a woman in Monrovia city (Greater Monrovia, Montserrado) for not wearing a facemask in public. She lost a eye in the process.
Around 3 August 2021 (as reported), three police officers beat up a truck driver to death in Monrovia city (Greater Monrovia, Montserrado), during a routine truck inspection.
On 3 August 2021, military forces attacked and killed a man accused of illegally owning weapons in Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza). Imbonerakure later buried the body.
On 3 August 2021, police abducted the communal CNL president in Gitobe commune (Kirundo). He was taken to an unknown location.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
notes: On 3 August 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military, administrators and staff from Fire Department interrogated city commuters and demanded money from commuters in the name of violating coronavirus restriction. Some commuters were also beaten.

On 3 August 2021, in Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), one of the PDF - Mingin members died at the Kale military investigation camp. He was one of the 53 PDF members who were arrested on July 28 in Taung Phyu village in Mingin township.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 3 August 2021, in the Monekoe area in Muse township (Muse District, Shan-North), the Myanmar military-backed Pansay militia shot and killed a civilian.

On 3 August 2021, stability maintenance officials hired by a village secretary beat up a disabled woman near a secondary school in Dafeng district (Yancheng, Jiangsu) to stop her from taking a coronavirus test. The officials threw her to the ground from her electric wheelchair, slapped her face, and caused her injuries. It was reported that the woman was harassed by the officials many times.

actor1: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) National Guard
notes: On 3 August 2021, two servicemen of the Russian National Guard detained an off-duty firefighter in Ulan-Ude and demanded he pay them 5000 rubles (approximately 65 USD), which the man refused to do. The National Guard officers then detained him, hit him 80 times with a rubber bat, imitated an attempt to suffocate him by placing a plastic bag over his head, and threatened to rape him. Most of these actions took place in a service car belonging to the Russian National Guard. According to local human rights activists, the officers' demands could have been linked to the victim insulting them, himself being suspected of robbery or fraud, or possessing illegal drugs. The victim claimed the violence took place on ethnic grounds, as he was not an ethnic Russian, but (presumably) an ethnic Buryat.

On 3 August 2021, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), police officers shot and killed a man in his home in Julian Blanco neighborhood of Petare parish. The victim was wanted for violating his parole agreement for a crime committed when he was a child. However, family members state the officers arrived and immediately shot him in an extrajudicial killing, which was reported by a local human rights organization. 1 fatality.

On 3 August 2021, in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), police officers shot and killed a man in La Linea neighborhood of Petare parish. Authorities reported the event as an armed confrontation; however, family members refuted reports of a battle, insisting the attack was an extrajudicial killing, which was reported by a local human right organization. 1 fatality.

On 2 August 2021, two people were shot with rubber bullets, beaten and injured by police officers in Imbali Unit 13, Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) as the officers forced their way into their house in search for looted goods. The police also shot their dog.

source: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 2 August 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay San Jose (Bombon, Camarines Sur, Bicol Region). Police said that the slain suspect was on the local drug watchlist and had previously surrendered to authorities for illegal drug activity. Police also said that the suspect had been misrepresenting himself as an agent of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency.

On 2 August 2021, a female lawyer was arrested by the police from her home in Beijing municipality and placed residential surveillance in a designated location after she circulated a courtroom video posted online of a prosecutor admitting errors. She was transferred to a criminal detention facility on 29 August 2021.

On 2 August 2021, in Kyu Wun village (Patheingyi township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military raided the village at midnight for no reason and opened fire. They arrested 15 villagers. Some of them were shot and some of them were beaten. Locals said there were no PDFs or protesters in the village.

On 2 August 2021, in Kin Ma village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military beat aid workers. The military beat them on their way back from Kin Ma village after transporting IDPs supports to the village.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 2 August 2021, in Man Awng village (Namhkan Township, Muse District, Shan-North), the Pansay People's Militia handcuffed a villager and beat him. He was accused of looting and stealing charcoal.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 2 August 2021, a FARDC soldier killed a man in Kange, near Lwaramba (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu).

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin; Philippine Star; Philippine News Agency

On 1 August 2021, a police officer shot and killed an unarmed man outside a private home near Haapsalu city. According to the police, the man drove into a roadside ditch under influence while leaving a party at the home. In response to police officers' attempts to detain him, the man allegedly attempted to physically assault them, despite them having fired warning shots in the air.

On 1 August 2021, 2 civilians were killed, 1 was beaten and 4 were taken as prisoners by the Afghan security personnel in Daman district, Kandahar. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2).

The victim was pepper sprayed and then shot three times. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 31 July 2021, SNR agents abducted a civilian from the Cotebu parking lot in Ngagara (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

On 31 July 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), a 23-year-old man who was arrested on 20 July in relation to the explosion of Shwe Nan Taw jewel shop owned by one of the SAC members died at the Shwepyithar interrogation center. He was allegedly beaten during interrogation.

actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Civil Police
notes: Around 30 July 2021 (as reported), in Sao Goncalo, Rio de Janeiro, civil police officers shot at two men on a motorcycle who disobeyed a stop order. According to the victims' family, one of them works as a delivery worker and they were scared by the police approach. They were injured.

On 30 July 2021, a farmer alleged of illegal logging was shot dead in a police anti-logging operation in Buenavista town (Marinduque, Mimaropa Region). The police officer involved alleged that the farmer made threatening gestures against him with a knife, though this was disputed by the farmer's family, citing witnesses. The police officer involved was later placed under police custody.

On 30 July 2021, an Indonesian military soldier beat two teenagers at their house in Supun village (South Biboki district, North Central Timor Regency, East Nusa Tenggara province). The victims allegedly violated the social restriction during the coronavirus pandemic. The victims sustained serious injuries and received intensive treatment at a health clinic.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 30 July 2021, in Muse town (Muse township, Muse district, Shan-North state), a member of a people's militia guarding the entrance of the checkpoint beat a man with the butt of a gun for no reason. The man had come to pick up his sister up form the checkpoint.

actor1: Police Forces of Haiti (2017-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Colombia); Former Military Forces of Colombia (2018-)
notes: Around 30 July 2021 (month of), near Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police officers and prison guards tortured 18 former Colombian soldiers arrested for the assassination of President Jovenel Moise during their detention. The inmates described multiple torture experiences, including being burned, stabbed, hit in the head, thrown against walls, kicked in the mouth, and released to a crowd that attacked them with machetes. The victims reported these tortures in a letter that they sent to the President of Colombia asking for his intervention. In the letter, the inmates said that at least three of them have been seriously injured and require special treatments.

On 30 July 2021, in Kani township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), locals discovered the bodies of 12, including a 14-year-old child. The military soldiers detained several civilians from villages around Taung Pauk a few days before 30 July. It is believed that the 12 bodies discovered were those detained civilians and killed by the military troops. Location coded as Taung Pauk (East).

actor1: Police Forces of Iran (1989-) Islamic Republic of Iran Border Guard Command
source: Human Rights Activists in Iran (HRA); Baloch Campaign
notes: On 30 July 2021, Iranian Coast Guard forces accosted several Baloch civilians in the area around Jod village (Sistan and Baluchestan) on suspicion of transporting alcohol. Coast Guard forces opened fire on the civilians during the struggle, killing 1, as well as arresting 2 others.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Actualite; La Libre Afrique; La Prunelle; 7 Sur 7; Actu30; Radio Okapi; Mediacongo.net
notes: On 30 July 2021, a teenage girl student was killed by an APCLS militiaman in Loashi (Osso, Masisi, Nord-Kivu) after the military opened fire against a bus for not stopping at a barricade. According to a military spokesperson, the group opened fire to prevent a robbery from the APCLS. Six soldiers were initially arrested for having killed the girl. [women targeted: girls]
On 29 July 2021, police forces assaulted and wounded a journalist, accused of taking picture of security officers, near a refugee camp in Adjumani district (Northern). No fatalities were reported.
On 29 July 2021, in Zee Pin Twin village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military arrested and beat 3 women and about 10 men.
On 29 July 2021, regime forces snipers shot and injured a civilian in Al-Sad neighborhood in Dar'a - Al-Sad city. He died a day later from his wounds.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Labour Group (Burundi)
notes: On 29 July 2021, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter and barber in Ruramba (Kayokwe, Mwaro). He has not been found since the abduction.

On 29 July 2021, police forces tortured and burned a thief to death after he was caught in the act of stealing in Nyabigina (Kibago, Makamba) by a group who injured him and turned him over to the police.

Around 29 July 2021 (between 19 July - 8 August), in Oo Bo prison in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), a CDM doctor who was arrested on July 19 on suspicion of being connected to CRPH/NUG died from coronavirus and due to lack of access to medical treatment.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Russia); Chechen Ethnic Group (Russia); Muslim Group (Russia)
notes: On 29 July 2021, six guards at prison nr. 4 in Norilsk allegedly beat an ethnic Chechen prisoner arrested on suspicion of supporting, on social media and in private messages, an armed Islamist group active in the Russian Caucasus region, allegedly to pressure him into admitting to the offense.
On 29 July 2021, a traffic police officer assaulted a Dalit man in Birendranagar city (Surkhet district), while the latter was collecting scrap items, such as plastic and iron.

actor1: Police Forces of Chad (2021-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: FACT: Front for Alteration and Harmony in Chad; Prisoners (Chad)
notes: On 28 July 2021, a prisoner of war and FACT leader who was captured by the Chadian army in April 2021 died in NDjamena (NDjamena) due to torture according to his lawyer.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 28 July 2021, SNR agents abducted some civilians in Mugamba commune (Mugamba, Bururi). Many are leaving their homes out of fear of being abducted.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces
notes: On 28 July 2021, in West Shewa zone, Ginde Beret (Oromia) woreda, security forces removed a young man from prison and killed him in public. He had been arrested after being accused of having a relationship with OLF forces.
On 28 July 2021, regime forces started a security campaign and detained a number of young men at the entrance of Maadan town in Ar-Raqqa countryside for conscription.

actor1: Police Forces of Indonesia (2014-) Mobile Brigade Corps
notes: On 28 July 2021, two police officers from the Mobile Brigade Corps assaulted a Papuan civilian in Bumi Wonorejo village (Nabire district, Nabire regency, Papua province). The officers dragged the victim to a truck, and one of the officers struck him at least five times on the temple before arresting him. The victim was previously engaged in an argument with election supervisors.

source: Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 28 July 2021, in Taung Hpyu village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), four of the 57 PDF members were killed after they were captured by the military and Pyu Saw Htee members, according to a PDF member.

On 28 July 2021, near Chaung Ma (East) village, Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces stationed in the beekeeping building located outside the village and fired artillery into the village, accusing that the village hosted PDF forces. Casualites unknown.

On 28 July 2021, near Aung Min Ga Lar village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), three youths attempted to stop an ambulance driven by military soldiers under disguise to tell them that there was a clash happening near the village. Afterwards, soldiers in the ambulance fired at three youth. One was killed and two others were injured.
On 28 July 2021, in Zee Pin Twin village, Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces blocked the village and shot at the villagers. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 28 July 2021, in Ribeirao das Neves, Minas Gerais, two men were shot and killed during a military police intervention in the Veneza neighborhood. According to police, the victims were suspects of taking part in the killing of a military police officer in Espirito Santo state and fire was exchanged. Family members of one of the victims, however, claim the victim was not in Espirito Santo when the episode happened nor that he had a criminal record. 2 fatalities.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 28 July 2021, police SNR abducted a nurse in Nyabihanga (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). A second nurse was abducted the day before (coded separately).

actor1: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-) Border Guards
notes: Around 28 July 2021 (week of), Moroccan border guards tortured two Moroccan migrants expelled by Spanish police from Melilla while in custody at a military checkpoint in Had Beni Chiker (Nador, Oriental).

On 28 July 2021, suspected police officers allegedly abducted a Muslim man at a bus stop in Makhachkala, driving him to an undetermined location where they allegedly beat him and shocked him with electricity, demanding information on a friend of his, who allegedly left to Syria in 2019 to join the Islamic State and later died there. According to the man's testimony, police later inserted a hand grenade and a gun into his backpack, dropped him off in Makhachkala and immediately arrested him for illegal sale of firearms. According to the police, the man was simply detained for illegal sale of firearms.
On 28 July 2021, 2 civilians were killed and 3 were wounded when an Afghan forces vehicle ran them over in Lashkargah city, Helmand. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2 fatalities).

actor1: Police Forces of Afghanistan (2014-2021) National Directorate of Security
notes: On 28 July 2021, 3 civilians were killed and 11 were arrested by Afghan forces unit 01 (NDS) in Shakar Dara district, Kabul. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 3 fatalities).
Around 28 July 2021 (as reported), 3 civilians were killed and 5 were wounded by Afghan forces attacks and airstrikes in Surubi district, Kabul. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 3 fatalities).
Around 28 July 2021 (as reported), a tuk tuk driver was arrested at the Hawl Wadaag police station, he was later tortured and killed at the police cell in Mogadishu - Hawl Wadaag (Banadir).

On 28 July 2021, government security soldiers (SNA) injured a man in Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). One soldier opened fire after stones were thrown at them (group of soldiers) while they headed to their base. It is unclear if the young men deliberately threw the stones.

actor1: Police Forces of Israel (2021-) Prison Guards
source: Dunia Al Watan; Palestine News and Information Agency; Arab 48
notes: On 27 July 2021, Israeli prison guards beat up Palestinian prisoners and smashed their personal belongings when they stormed the Palestinian prisoners' section in Shikma Prison in Ashqelon (Ashqelon). The search operation lasted for seven consecutive hours, during which all prisoners were handcuffed and taken out to Al-Fura Square after being searched.

On 27 July 2021, police shot at a vehicle at a checkpoint in Ahvaz city (Khuzestan) after the occupants failed to heed their order to stop. All 3 occupants were injured with 1 dying of his injuries a day later. The attack occurred in the context of a heavy security atmosphere in the city following over a week of sometimes violent demonstrations over water shortage issues in Khuzestan Province.

actor1: Police Forces of Trinidad and Tobago (2015-)
source: Newsday Trinidad and Tobago; Loop News Trinidad and Tobago
notes: On 27 July 2021, in Penal, Penal-Debe, the police shot and killed a man at Lachoos Road. According to witness and relatives, the police ran inside, told the victim to lie down, and shot him without any dispute. However, the officers claimed that they were visiting the place in order to take the man for questioning when the man attacked with a gun. 1 fatality.

On 27 July 2021, police officers in the district of Barue Manica [coded to Catandica (Barue, Manica)] attacked two journalists from Radio Catandica as they covered some sellers contesting the pressure and modality of those members who were charging them taxes. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 27 July 2021, SNR agents abducted 3 CNL members in Giharo commune (Giharo, Rutana).

On 27 July 2021, Koglweogo militiamen arrested a man carrying a sack with a rifle in the town of Po (Po, Nahouri). The Koglweogo handed the person over to soldiers, who killed him extrajudicially on the outskirts of the town.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: On 27 July 2021, in Nawnghkio township (Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the People's Militia Force hit an aid worker in the chest with the butt of a rifle. The aid worker has been providing support to coronavirus patients. Health workers and aid workers who have been providing support to COVID-19 patients privately have been targeted by the military regime in recent weeks.

actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
notes: Around 27 July 2021 (as reported), around Tarmoenye town (Kutkai Township, Muse District, Shan-North), the pro-military Tarmoenye People's Militia Force beat 4 men for using drugs.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 27 July 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in Sidnaya Military Prison, after he was detained by QSD and handed over to regime forces in Afrin city in 2016.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 27 July 2021, police SNR abducted a nurse in Nyabihanga (Nyabihanga, Mwaro). A second nurse was abducted the next day (coded separately).

source: Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 27 July 2021, in Pyinmana town (Pyinmana township, Det Khi Na district, Nay Pyi Taw), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) beat and arrested a student protest leader. A planned protest by students on the same day was cancelled after the leader was arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 27 July 2021, a woman was reported knocking on a drive thru window at a fast food restaurant in Dolton (Illinois) with an alleged gun. Surveillance video footage indicates it was not a gun and that when police officers arrived they appeared to punch the woman as she was sitting in the car. The woman then attempted to drive away but police opened fire and killed her at the scene.

source: Monitor de Victimas; Caraota Digital; Diario Primicia
notes: On 27 July 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), CICPC police forces killed a presumably unarmed man in his father's house in Boqueron sector of Sucre de Catia parish. Authorities reported the event as an armed confrontation with the El Coqui and Mayeyas organized criminal groups; however, family members refuted any connection to organized crime groups and insisted the event was an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

Around 26 July 2021, in the rural area of Tibu (Norte de Santander), military soldiers killed a civilian and injured another one in a checkpoint located in the rural area of the municipality. According to the report, the victims ran from the checkpoint when security forces attempted to arrest them under false accusations. Subsequently, security forces opened fire on the unarmed men. 1 fatality.

Around 26 July 2021 (as reported), a taxi driver was beaten and forced to drink a liter of liquor by police officers in Kimberley (Frances Baard, Northern Cape). After the incident, the man bought a second bottle, but died moments later.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 26 July 2021, SNR agents tortured a civilian after the man was arrested in Gasenyi (Buganda, Cibitoke). The victim was accused of consorting with rebels from DRC. It is unclear where the man is now.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Afar Special Forces
notes: On 26 July 2021, Afar regional militia assaulted two Somali civilians (from Ciise clan group) who were traveling between Adis and Jigjiga at the Awash town (Gabi-Zone 3).

On 26 July 2021, two Indonesian military soldiers assaulted a deaf-mute Papuan civilian in Mandala sub-district, Merauke district (Merauke regency, Papua province). The victim was reportedly drunk and asked for food in a restaurant where the soldiers were present. A soldier pulled him outside, pushed the victim to the floor, and twisted his arm on the back while the other soldier stepped on the victim's head and left arm.
On 26 July 2021, in Meiktila town (Meiktila Township, Meiktila District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military and police beat and arrested four people, including a protest leader at around 11 PM.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 26 July 2021 (as reported), a Muslim inmate at a prison in Angarsk reported having been beaten and electrocuted by guards for an unspecified reason.

actor1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Central Office for the Repression of Banditry
notes: On 26 July 2021, police forces from the anti-banditry office beat and tortured two civilians for unclear reasons in Damara (Ombella-M'Poko). The victims went to the anti-banditry office to ask for information about their brother, who was in custody. No fatalities were reported.

Around 26 July 2021, a male resident of Nishan district in Kashkadarya region died while in police custody at the police station in the town of Yangi Nishan as a result of torture, victim's relatives argued. Police deny torture took place while district prosecutor's office launched a probe into allegations.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
notes: On 26 July 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), FAES officers shot and killed a shop worker after arresting him at work in Mariperez sector of La Vega parish. Family members and a local human rights organization reported the event as an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

On 26 July 2021, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), police shot and killed a man while he was talking with his aunt outside of her house in Las Minas de Baruta parish. Family members and a local human right organization reported the event as an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 26 July 2021, SNR agents abducted a prisoner, removing the prisoner from Mpimba prison in Musaga (Muha, Bujumbura) to an unidentified location.

assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Philippines); KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
source: Bulatlat; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS-CBN; Karapatan
notes: On 26 July 2021, 2 activists were shot dead by the police who reportedly caught them in the act of spray-painting 'DUTERTE IBAGSAK' ('BRING DOWN DUTERTE') at a bridge in Barangay Binogsacan Lower (Guinobatan, Albay, Bicol Region). The victims were also farmers; 1 was a member of local farmer group Organisasyon ng mga Magsasaka sa Albay, while the other was part of KARAPATAN affiliate Albay People's Organization. Human rights groups condemned the killings. Police initially claimed that the victims engaged them in a shootout, but this was disputed by human rights groups and the victims' families. The Philippine National Police chief later ordered an investigation and the officers involved were relieved of their duties.

Around 26 July 2021 (as reported), Pakistan military conducted an operation during which they allegedly tortured a Baloch woman in Gomazi area in Kech district (Balochistan). She was killed in the incident.

On 25 July 2021, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), police shot and killed a civilian bystander while chasing down criminal suspects in El Rosario de Minas sector. Authorities report the death was an accident and the officer who fired the shots was temporarily detained, while family members of the victim believe the attack was intentional. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: ACJD: Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy
notes: On 25 July 2021, in Managua, Managua, approximately 30 police officers entered the home of a presidential precandidate and member of the ACJD, raided the home and physically attacked people. The electric fence was destroyed and the candidate's car was stolen by police officers. Upon the event, the victim went into exile.

actor1: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Special Forces
assoc_actor_2: Government of Burkina Faso (2015-); Prisoners (Burkina Faso)
notes: On 25 July 2021, Burkinabe special forces arrested and killed by extrajudicial execution a Gongorgouol communal councilor accused of being a militant informant on the road between Solhan (Solhan, Yagha) and Sebba (Sebba, Yagha).

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Military Intelligence
notes: On 25 July 2021, regime's military intelligence arrested several young men queueing in front of an ice shop in Al Mayadin town in Deir-ez-Zor countryside for conscription.

On 25 July 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay district, Bago-West region), Myanmar military forces shot and killed a motorcyclist who did not stop after asking him to stop. The body was not given back to the family. The burial was performed by Myanmar military. A compensation of 10 lakhs Myanmar kyats was given to the family by Myanmar military.
On 25 July 2021, in Kani Township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region, the Myanmar military raided villages. The military beat and arrested villagers.

On 25 July 2021, in a unreported village at the southern part of Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military brigade 44 LIB 72 arrested a villager and used the villager as a forced labourer to carry goods to Ah Lel Gyun village. The villager was beaten with a rifle butt and asked if he had weapons and any connection with armed groups. He was released later.
On 25 July 2021, in Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region, the Myanmar military raided villages. The military beat and arrested villagers.

actor1: Police Forces of Palestine (2007-) Gaza Strip
notes: On 25 July 2021, police forces in Gaza Strip raided a house and physically assaulted a Palestinian man from An Nusayrat refugee camp in An Nusayrat (Deir El Balah), which caused bruises on his body. The man was transferred to a hospital after half an hour of the incident, and he died there. According to the Independent Commission for Human Rights, the autopsy results showed that the death was by a heart attack due to an arterial obstruction.

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Radio Free Asia
notes: Around 25 July 2021 (between 10 July - 9 August), in Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), an arrestee who was arrested on July 10 on the accusation of hiding protesters died in Myingyan prison. The Prisons Department claimed that he died of atherosclerosis and hypertension but his body was covered and his family could not see the dead body except for the face. The RFA reported he may have died at the interrogation center.
On 25 July 2021, overnight Malian soldiers abducted two Fulani men including one severely wounded (receiving treatment after a motorcycle accident) in the town of Timbuktu (Tombouctou, Tombouctou).

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
notes: Around 25 July 2021, in Caracas (Distrito Capital), a man was killed and his body found in La Vega parish. The victim was last seen on 24 July, when FAES police arrested him while he was at work, and family members of the victim blame the FAES for his death. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 25 July 2021, SNR agents abducted a woman in Bururi commune (Bururi, Bururi). Her husband, who was a soldier, was abducted and killed in 2016. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
On 25 July 2021, soldiers fired warning shots and wounded an IDP person in the town of Markoye (Markoye, Oudalan).

actor1: Military Forces of India (2014-) Rashtriya Rifles
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force; Police Forces of India (2014-) Special Operations Group
notes: On 25 July 2021, RR, CRPF and SoG fired at a civilian during a CASO at Munund village in Yaripora block area (Kulgam district, J&K). He was killed in the incident. However other reports claimed that he was a militant targeted in a staged encounter.

actor1: Police Forces of Palestine (2007-) Gaza Strip
source: Ma'an News Agency; Palestine News and Information Agency
notes: On 24 July 2021, security forces [police] affiliated with Hamas Movement shot two live bullets towards a speeding Palestinian car at the eastern border of the Al Tuffah neighborhood in Gaza - At Tuffah (Gaza City), killing a Palestinian passenger. According to the Ministry of Interior in Gaza, a suspicious vehicle passed through one of the checkpoints of the 'Humat Al-Thoghour' forces after the car's driver refused to stop and continued moving quickly.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 24 July 2021, in Bauru, Sao Paulo, military police shot and assaulted a drug user in the Jardim Vitoria neighborhood. The victim's mouth was injured. According to police, the man threw stones and pointed a knife at police officers. According to residents, he is not involved in drug trafficking and police violence incidents are frequent.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 24 July 2021, a Houthi sniper shot and injured an elderly woman in Al Kuwayhah (Maqbanah, Taizz).
On 24 July 2021, police forces shot and killed a young student for allegedly violating the curfew rules and not wearing a face mask in Jinja (Eastern).

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 24 July 2021, SNR agents abducted a young man who had recently been released by presidential pardon in Kayanza commune (Kayanza, Kayanza). He has not been found since the abduction.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi); Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: On 24 July 2021, SNR agents abducted and tortured some retired Tutsi soldiers in Mugamba commune (Mugamba, Bururi).

On 24 July 2021, Indonesian municipal police forces reportedly beat up two youths in Lumajang district (Lumajang regency, East Java province). The victims were arrested and taken to the police station after verbally insulting police officers on Jendral Haryono Road.

On 24 July 2021, at the Shwe Sar Yay narrow part of the Chindwin river in Min Oh village (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), military forces docked at Min Oh village pier and arrested 20 villagers to guide them to the inland part of the village in search of PDFs. Witnesses said the villagers were beaten during the arrests and were used as human shields.

On 24 July 2021, in Sin Hpyu Kyun village (Thaton Township, Thaton District, Mon State), Myanmar military troops stormed the village, forcing a man to flee out of fear. The Myanmar military fired several gunshots and killed him.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-) Prison Guards
notes: On 24 July 2021, police allegedly placed an inmate in a cell with bleach or another dangerous chemical in Pompano Beach (Florida) as retaliation for spitting on a deputy. The inmate was transferred to a hospital after struggling to breathe and an investigation into the conduct of the officers is ongoing.
On 24 July 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Labo town (Camarines Norte, Bicol Region). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.
On 24 July 2021, a soldier shot killed one woman at Kanyamwirima barracks in Bundibugyo District (Western). The soldier was arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 23 July 2021, Houthi forces shot at a civilian in Rub al Mahall neighborhood (Hays, Al Hudaydah) injuring him in the left arm. The civilian was hospitalized.
On 23 July 2021, the military forces raided Pinyin village, Santa subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest), killing two women. This was allegedly a retaliation attack after the July 16 attack on the military.

Around 23 July 2021 (as reported), in Caracas - Sucre (Miranda), police shot and killed a man in 14 de Abril sector of Filas de Mariche neighborhood. Authorities claim the victim was a member of either the El Vampi, El Coqui, or El Garbis gangs, while family members refute this report and insist he was subjected to an extrajudicial execution by police. 1 fatality.

On 23 July 2021, in Taungdwingyi township (Magway district, Magway region), the military forces arrived in a military truck and beat people on the street who were under stay-at-home order for going outside. The military council issued a stay-at-home order from 9 am to 5 pm and from 8 pm to 4 am in Taungdwingyi. According to locals, the order changed frequently, and the period was unclear.

On 23 July 2021, Turkish military forces allegedly opened fire on a shepherd in a mountainous area near Kavakli village (Hakkari Central district), after which the shepherd's relatives claimed they were not able to contact him. No information was available as to fatalities of the incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
notes: On 23 July 2021, in Quibor (Lara), FAES police reportedly killed a youth who had been freed from prison only three days earlier. Family members refute official reports of an armed clash, stating that FAES forces arrived at the victim's house and detained the entire family, after which the victim was killed while reportedly still in FAES custody. 1 fatality.
On 23 July 2021, a government soldier in a military pick-up that was moving behind a bullion van shot and injured a motorcyclist in East Legon town (Ayawaso West, Greater Accra).
On 23 July 2021, police forces allegedly killed a Dalit man in custody at the police station in Daudnagar town (Aurangabad, Bihar), who was arrested on liquor smuggling charges.

On 23 July 2021, a police officer physically assaulted and beat a drunk driver at an undetermined location in Voronezh Oblast, having stopped the car after the driver caused a minor road accident. On a video recording of the event, the driver first spits on the police officer and hits him, to which the policeman responds by beating him.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 23 July 2021, a police officer beat an unarmed biracial man who identifies as Black and choked him during an arrest in Aurora (Colorado). The victim complied with the orders of the officers who were executing a warrant for domestic violence. The officer was placed on unpaid leave and is being charged with a felony assault. Another officer who arrived at a later point also used his taser on the victim.
On 23 July 2021, Malian soldiers beat and killed one person at the market in the town of Youwarou (Youwarou, Mopti).

On 23 July 2021, security operatives from the military and police attacked Akpawfu (Nkanu East, Enugu) coded as Owo, while searching for IPOB/ESN members. Scores of youths were arrested, casualties unknown.

On 23 July 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Sampaloc (Talavera, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they identified to be on the local drug watchlist.

On 23 July 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay San Miguel na Munti (Talavera, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they identified to be on the local drug watchlist.

On 22 July 2021, in Cardenas, Tabasco, a woman was beaten up by two municipal police officers after she was arrested in Colonia Pueblo Nuevo. The event was recorded on video and shared on social media.

On 22 July 2021, a Gumuz armed group killed one Shinasha ethnic group youth in an area known as Mangi Ber in Bulen woreda of Metekel zone, Benshangul/Gumuz (coded separately). Following this incident, members of the Ethiopian command post shot at mourners injuring four people.
On 22 July 2021, soldiers assaulted a mentally disabled male civilian near the village of Mardaga (Namounou, Tapoa).

On 22 July 2021, in Caracas - Chacao (Miranda), police forces shot and killed a suspected drug dealer in his home. Authorities report the victim died in an armed confrontation, but family members state he was handcuffed and unable to defend himself. After the suspect was killed, family members present in the home declare that the police robbed the house. 1 fatality.
On 22 July 2021, the gendarmerie forces beat up and killed one person held in custody for an unknown reason in Pouma town (Sanaga-Maritime, Littoral).
Around 22 July 2021 (week of), the military forces shot and killed a student in Bambili village, Tubah subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest).

On 22 July 2021, in Mindat township (Mindat district, Chin state), the police while patrolling shot a young man who returned home around 10 pm and followed him and burned his house. The young man died and his father, a health worker, was severely injured from the fire.

On 22 July 2021, in General Jose de San Martin (Chaco), two police officers sexually assaulted a minor inside a police vehicle in the Las Palmeras neighborhood and were filmed by passersby, who also offered help to the girl. When the video became public (between 22 - 31 July), the officers were arrested. [women targeted: girls]

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces

actor1: Police Forces of Israel (2021-) Prison Guards

The deceased's family demanded an autopsy of the body in the presence of a Palestinian doctor.

On 21 July 2021, police reportedly physically assaulted and beat 3 Kurdish people while detaining them outside a hospital in Altindag, Ankara, where the victims came to visit their family members, who were themselves attacked and wounded on the previous day for an unspecified reason at a public animal slaughtering place, during the Eid al-Adha holiday. No information was available as to the motives of the police assault.

On 21 July 2021, military officers beat and seriously injured a woman for allegedly selling food in violation of the coronavirus restrictive measures in Namanve (Mukono, Central). No fatalities were reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromo Regional Special Forces

On 21 July 2021, in Villa De Leyva (Boyaca), police forces used excessive force against an arrested civilian when officers tased the handcuffed man.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma

On 21 July 2021, in Kun Seik village (coded as Kun Seik (Ywar Ma)), Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), one villager was hit by a military vehicle, before being shot and killed by Myanmar military forces after he ran away in fear upon seeing the troops.

On 21 July 2021, police forces assaulted, beat and stabbed a boda boda passenger suspected of violating the coronavirus restrictive measures in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). The victim was seriously injured, and no fatalities were reported.

On 21 July 2021, in Thabyu village, Taikkyi township (coded as Taikkyi) (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), about 100 military troops raided the village and arrested three current and former student union members. The father of one of the student union members was also arrested. They were beaten and taken for investigation.

On 21 July 2021, in Shwepyithar township, Yangon-North district, Yangon region), about 7 military soldiers stopped a motorbike and beat a woman and a man on the bike with a stick for not wearing facial masks as part of coronavirus prevention. Separately, the military ordered a man to get off from a light truck and beat him for not wearing a mask.

On 21 July 2021, in Merida, Yucatan, a man died after being allegedly beaten, tortured and raped by police officers who had arrested him. Four police officers were arrested for this killing and later released for lack of evidence. Videos of the attack circulated on social networks. 1 fatality.

On 21 July 2021, police abducted two women, torturing one of them and releasing the other, in Mugamba commune (Mugamba, Bururi). The police tortured one of the women because her husband fled the country. She has been missing since. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

source: El Pitazo; Caraota Digital; Monitor de Victimas

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces

On 20 July 2021, in Managua, Managua, two police officers beat a member of the opposition and TikToker in the neighborhood Jorge Dimitrov. The victim is known for his opposition against the Ortega regime and has been detained twice.

On 20 July 2021, a police officer reportedly physically assaulted, beat and raped an 18-year-old female prisoner at a police station in Saratov. On 20 July 2021, near the flyover on Khayebin junction, in Hlaingthayar township (Hlaingtharya-East township, Yangon-North district, Yangon region), security forces (coded as military and police) beat two volunteers returning from oxygen plants to refill oxygen.

actor1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Prison Guards

On 10 August 2021, one of the victims' mothers alleged before the National Police Commission that police tortured her son during the supposed raid, and that her son was merely hired as a driver by the 2 other fatalities.

On 19 July 2021, police forces beat and wounded three health workers for allegedly violating the coronavirus restrictive measures in Jinja (Eastern).

On 19 July 2021, the police forces assaulted two journalists and damaged their equipment in Paynesville neighborhood of Monrovia city (Greater Monrovia, Montserrado) as they were video recording them arresting a woman during enforcement of a traders relocation order. assoc_actor_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Prisoners (Myanmar)

On 19 July 2021, near Shwebo town (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military fired gunshots at three youth riding motorcycles at night. One youth died and 2 others were injured.

The victim's police report was rejected by the local police department.

On 19 July 2021, Malian soldiers and Donso militiamen abducted a Fulani man and looted shops and seized motorcycles and livestock at the market in the town of Sokolo (Niono, Segou). A person was later found dead but it remains unclear if it is the same person taken away.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
