Six people were killed. The violence is the latest in a series of events in and around the town.

On 19 July 2021, in Diez de Octubre, La Habana, police detained and beat a man while he was sitting in the patrol vehicle that was to take him to a detention centre. The man denounced violent interrogations, although specific actions were not specified. This attack is part of a wave of violent arrests that the police carried out after the anti-government demonstrations. 1 man was injured.

notes: On 18 July 2021, in Pailon, Santa Cruz, police officers together with members of the National Confederation of Native Indigenous Farmers Women of Bolivia - Bartolina Sisa captured two indigenous citizens, including a pregnant woman. Their whereabouts are unknown. The abduction happened following recent land disputes in the area, when community members expelled the Bartolina Sisa group from their community. There have been ongoing land disputes between the Pailoncito indigenous community and the Bartolina Sisa group for the past three years.

On 18 July 2021, in Hlaing township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the military arrested a former political prisoner and a young associate and claimed they found explosive devices. About 10 soldiers and police searched the house of family members in North-Okkalapa township around 5 pm on the same day. Both of them appeared to be beaten at the time of arrest based on photos shared online.

On 18 July 2021, in Pa Laing village, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces opened fire against the villagers and searched for PDF members in the village. Casualties unknown.

It is believed that the commander criticized the special order as an order made 'without knowing the reality' (location unknown, but the event most likely occurred in Pyongyang).

Around 18 July 2021 (between 6 - 31 July), in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), a villager from Son Ywar Gon who was arrested on July 6 and detained at a military investigation centre later died with wounds on 31 July. There were knife scars and cigarette burns on his back and bruises from rifle butts on his chest.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police

Gen. Stephen Buay). The family say the politician has been severely beaten whilst in detention.

On 18 July 2021, police personnel killed a person accused in a cheque dishonor case at Wahndo police station in Wahndo city (Kamoke, Gujranwala). The person was allegedly killed due to police torture in custody.

On 17 July 2021, in Habana, La Habana, a man who shouted anti-government mottos during a pro-government demonstration was beaten and arrested by the police.

On 17 July 2021, police forces shot and killed 2 Baloch civilians driving motorcycles on the road between Khvor and Khusef city (South Khorasan) suspecting them of transporting drugs, though none were reported found.

On 17 July 2021, two men were killed by a police officer during a funeral in the Mashaba cemetery, Lomahasha (Lomahasha, Lubombo), after they criticized the government's response to the recent demonstrations in the country. The officer was arrested.
On 17 July 2021, suspected members of the Mozambican forces in Mucojo (Mucojo, Macomia) attacked civilians who fled Macomia. No fatalities/and or injuries reported.
On 17 July 2021, in Pa Laing village, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces shot and killed four civilians who were carrying out night watch duties.

On 17 July 2021, police allegedly physically assaulted and beat a female journalist in Moscow - Central. According to the victim, the incident occurred after the journalist started filming the detention of a passerby by police.

On 17 July 2021, police in Maykop allegedly beat a local man to death at a police station after arresting him, according to his relatives. Officers themselves denied their responsibility for the man's death.

actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department

On 17 July 2021, an independent journalist and human rights activist was assaulted by police in the Anantnag district, while he was on the way to his home. The police allegedly targeted and beat him up while clearing routine traffic congestion in the district.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
notes: Around 17 July 2021, in Caracas (Distrito Capital), a youth was tortured to death and his body found in Los Nichos sector of Santa Rosalia parish. The victim was last seen on 16 July, when he was arrested and taken from his house by FAES agents. 1 fatality.

source: Monitor de Victimas; Diario Primicia; La Patilla; Caraota Digital; El Carabobeno; La Voz; El Pitazo

On 16 July 2021, soldiers shot and killed a male farmer near the road between Dori (Dori, Seno) and Gorgadji (Gorgadji, Seno).

On 16 July 2021, near Tha Hngar village (Sinbaungwe Township, Thayet District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military fired several gunshots at a farmer who is also the father of an NLD lawmaker who competed and won the 2020 general election. He was shot at his farm field and died.

actor1: Police Forces of Iran (1989-) Ministry of Intelligence

The police officers reportedly butt-stroked the victim with the stocks of their weapons and dragged her along the floor by pulling her hair. The victim was hospitalized due to the violence she was subject to, which put her pregnancy and the life of the fetus at high risk.

On 16 July 2021, in In Pin Hla village (Mingin township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military forces and members of Pyu Saw Htee fired random shots and killed a 19-year-old during a raid into the village.

On 16 July 2021, military forces and the local RDC assaulted and beat four local residents for allegedly violating the curfew rules in Arapai (Soroti, Eastern). The victims were seriously injured, and they were denied access to medical care. No fatalities were reported.

Around 16 July 2021, in Caracas (Distrito Capital), a youth was apparently killed during a police operation and his body found with signs of decomposition in El Valle parish. Authorities state the victim died in an armed clash with police, a version of events refuted by the victim's family, who state he had no criminal record and had come to Caracas with the intention of joining the military forces. 1 fatality.

On 16 July 2021, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing was intercepted by petition interceptors in the Beijing municipality and sent to a 'black jail' in Beijing where she was detained until her release on 2 August 2021. Upon her release, she was repatriated to Chongqing but was forcibly taken to a hotel in Chongqing for COVID-19 quarantine. This followed another incident on 8 June where she was taken away by petition interceptors in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 16 July 2021 (month of), four Tibetans and a Han Chinese involved in the manufacture and transport of a life-sized statue of the late revered Tibetan incarnate monk, Tenzin Delek Rinpoche, were arrested separately in Kangding City (known as Dartsedo) (Ganzi, Sichuan). On 15 July 2021, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a soldier allegedly shot and killed a teenager in Homestead. notes: On 15 July 2021, a police officer, accompanied by the leader of the CNDD-FDD of the area, abducted a CNL party member in Kayokwe (Kayokwe, Mwaro).

According to the police, the man shot at police officers, who shot back. According to relatives, the victim had never been seen carrying a gun. 1 fatality.

Civil police officers are investigating the occurrence and the victims' attorney reported the conduct of the officers to the public prosecutor's office.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), in Soacha (Cundinamarca), two female applicants for police forces were sexually abused and suffered workplace harassment from one of their superiors. According to their testimony, the man frequently harassed the women by extending their work hours. Additionally, he demanded oral sex in return for a work license. The events occurred inside the police station of the municipality.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), two police officers stopped a car in Gelendzhik and allegedly physically assaulted its passengers, two representatives of a construction company. The police officers later took them to a police station and allegedly demanded 1.7 million rubles (approximately 23000 USD), following the payment of which the victims were set free.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), police in Ulan-Ude allegedly conducted 'violent acts of sexual nature' against a 17-year-old boy, who claimed that police demanded he confess to an offence he did not commit. The boy was hospitalized following the incident.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), two individuals were tortured by four police officers in Mdantsane (Buffalo City, Eastern Cape) during a robbery case investigation where the two were pointed out as suspects. One of the individuals died. The four police officers were arrested.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), a Taiwanese prisoner was beaten up by a prison officer at the Wuyishan prison in Shangpu village (Wuyishan, Nanping, Fujian). He was sentenced to eight-year in prison for the crime of fraud.

On 15 July 2021, Nazlymkhan Turumbetova, a female member of the illegal political party Alga, Karakalpakstan was detained and tortured via electrocution by policemen while in custody at the police station of the Takhiatash township in Xojayli district of Republic of Karakalpakstan to extract forced confession on organizing opposition protest two days earlier. On 15 July 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), police shot and killed a man in front of his wife at their home in El Valle parish. Authorities reported the event as an armed confrontation; however, the victim's wife refuted this report. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Papua New Guinea (2019-)

On 15 July 2021, organized crime police unit beat and slapped a man during his arrest and search in his house in Minsk - Tsentralny. The police also cut the pictures on the wall, destroyed an old laptop and a sofa during the house search. The man was suspected of leaking data of law enforcement officials.

On 14 July 2021, police caused a car to overturn and kill the driver in the vicinity of Zeh-e Kalut city (Kerman) by throwing tire spikes onto the road without warning. Police reportedly fled the scene thereafter.

On 14 July 2021, in Placencia, Stann Creek, a police officer shot and killed a 14-year old boy. According to the report, the police were looking for two men who tried to break into a resort. One of the police officers saw two young men running along the beach, pulled his gun, and opened fire against them, injuring one of them. The victim died moments later. The Police Commissioner said it was a case of unjustified use of force. The police officer was arrested. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of the Ivory Coast (2011-)

Three soldiers from the Myanmar military brigade 88 and LIB 616 were found with the dead woman's mobile phone. The Myanmar military paid 2,100,000 kyats to the victim's family in compensation.

Around 14 July 2021 (week of), police officers assaulted a farmer and three workers with logs and open fists in the Chigodora area near Mutare (Mutare Urban, Manicaland). Police accused the group of smuggling.

Around 14 July 2021 (as reported), three police officers in Lichinga (Lichinga, Niassa), assaulted a 13-year-old-girl for alleged violation of coronavirus prevention measures. The girl was immobilized on a public road and the officers beat her with clubs. [women targeted: girls]

On 14 July 2021, in Pyigyitagon town (Pyigyitagon township, Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military fired gunshots at a group of people arguing among themselves. A bullet hit and killed a 16-year-old boy.

Around 14 July 2021 (as reported), a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Lupao town (Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service

One of the men was a former prisoner who already paid compensation to his victims and served his sentence in prison; there are no details about the other three men.
On 13 July 2021, anti-narcotics police shot and killed a Baloch civilian in the vicinity of Birjand city (South Khorasan) after pursuing his car and firing indiscriminately at him.

actor1: Police Forces of Bahrain (1999-) Prison Guards

On 13 July 2021, in Cardenas, Matanzas, police and military officers attacked and arrested a man after participating in the anti-government protests that started on 11 July 2021. The man was beaten, shot and injured. According to a witness, in the scene there were also persons dressed as civilians who used blunt metal objects to beat the man. No fatalities reported.

source: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 13 July 2021, in Myingyan town, Myingyan township (Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), after explosions occurred in several locations in the town, security forces (assumed to be the military and police) chased a group of unknown people with gunshots. A stray bullet injured a woman.

On 13 July 2021, a disqualified human rights lawyer was beaten up by police at Qingyang People's Court in Qingyang district (Chengdu, Sichuan) while filing a litigation case about losing his practicing license to provide legal services. Soon after he had used his phone to record himself, four police forced him to delete the video by pinning him down on the ground. He had his video deleted by the officers before leaving the court with injuries on two arms.
On 13 July 2021, in Than Pauk village, Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces killed a villager.

On 13 July 2021, a Jubo League leader, arrested in connection with a case of assaulting a police sub-inspector, was allegedly tortured by police in custody at Sulla Police Station (Sullah, Sunamganj).

On 13 July 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) beat and arrested a medical doctor along with his cousin. Later, his cousin was released.

On 13 July 2021, a petitioner was dragged onto a car and beaten into his head, chest, and abdomen by stability maintenance officers while having a late night supper with friends in Chongqing municipality.
Around 13 July 2021 (as reported), 2 civilians was killed when the Afghan security personnel opened fire on a vehicle in Khoshi district, Logar. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2)

Around 13 July 2021 (as reported), 1 civilian was killed during attacks conducted by the Afghan security personnel on Sar Rawza (Sarhowza) district, Paktika. Fatalities reported as 0 (VoJ reported 1).

On 12 July 2021, a police officer allegedly beat a man in Mostovka (Republic of Buryatia) while detaining him inside a local supermarket for refusing to wear a face mask. According to the victim's wife, who was present at the scene, they were both about to put their masks on when a policeman approached them and informed them they would be fined for not wearing masks. Her husband allegedly questioned the police officer's right to do so, following which he was dragged outside of the supermarket and beaten.

On 12 July 2021, staff members at the Wuchang District Old Town Reconstruction Project beat a homeless man in Wubei village, Wuchang District (Wuhan, Hubei), during an inspection of his ruined home following a forced demolition on 30 January 2021. Officers snatched his phone away, beat him to the ground, and hit him with a brick as the man intended to take photos of the demolition office team.

actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards

On 12 July 2021, military personnel assaulted civilians in the Njolwe settlement area of Chongwe (Chongwe, Lusaka) before demolishing several houses and a church.

The beating was of such magnitude that his relatives thought he was dead. His girlfriend was also beaten and arrested at the door of her house. 2 people were injured.

On 12 July 2021, local township government officers and police officers kidnapped a businessman-cum-petitioner living at Shuanggou township (Xiangyang, Hubei) and detained him at a psychiatric hospital in Huangji township. The businessman petitioned about the loss of ownership of his factory. He was transferred to Xiangfan Anding Hospital on 31 August 2021, to Shuanggou Township An Yi Tai Hospital on 14 October 2021, and remained detained as reported on 24 December 2021.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police

source: Abante; ABS-CBN; Davao Today; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 12 July 2021, 2 farmers were killed while another was wounded in a military operation in Barangay Cambuayon (Bacuag, Surigao del Norte, Caraga). The farmers were accused by the military of being NPA rebels, but human rights group Karapatan refuted this, citing testimonies from local officials and the farmers' families. The wounded farmer and another farmer also accused of being a rebel were also arrested by the military. The military claimed that it retrieved weapons from the farmers during the operation.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 11 July 2021, in Sao Paulo - South Zone, Sao Paulo, three military police officers chased a man in a car, shot and killed him. According to a camera footage, the victim's car stopped, and when the man opened the door, he was already injured. Two officers stepped out of the police vehicle they were in and put the body in the backseat. Afterwards, another camera footage showed both cars heading to a dead-end street where the officers simulated a shoot-out with the victim. A man on a motorcycle went to the place and spread sand on the pavement to hide blood stains. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2021, in Zin Ka Le village, Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), a villager who went back to the village to take the rice from the refugee camp was killed by Myanmar military forces.

On 11 July 2021, in Dagon Myothit (South) township (Dagon Myothit-South, Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military soldiers fired gunshots at locals queuing to fill oxygen at South Dagon Industrial Zone 1. They also shot at civilians carrying oxygen cylinders on motorcycles. The soldiers also chased people to arrest them. Some people who ran away also left their oxygen cylinders behind. No injuries reported.

On 11 July 2021, in Taunggyi township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the military forces came with military trucks and arrested a couple from Kyaung Gyi Su ward around 3 am. A local said they were probably arrested due to connections with a PDF, the military thought the man attended military training from an EAO and both were beaten at the investigation.

The victim reported that another prisoner was forced to pass between two lines of police officers while they beat him with sticks. No fatalities reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards

Around 10 July 2021 (as reported), police transferred a detained rights defender from the Qidao Police Station in Yuanbao district (Dandong, Liaoning) to a budget hotel nearby for two-day detention on 'security maintenance' grounds. Around 10 July 2021 (month of), in San Pya Chauk Maing village (Demoso township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), locals found 4 decomposing bodies in a grave near the toilet of a house next to the house that the military was stationed in. Locals said the dead could be civilians, possibly a family, due to their civilian clothes, but their heads were cut off and they remained unidentified. Fatalities coded as 4.

He was taken into the police truck, where he was repeatedly punched and kicked by the officers. He vomited blood in the detention and suffered a bruise under the left eye, a bleeding nose and mouth, and a bleeding head injury.

Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects, one of whom had previously been detained on drug charges but had later been released as part of a plea bargaining agreement.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
source: Abante; Philippine News Agency; ABS-CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 8 July 2021, 2 drug suspects were killed during a joint PDEA, police and military raid in Barangay Macasendeg (Pikit, Cotabato, Soccsksargen). Authorities said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects, a father-and-son pair who were both reportedly high-value targets on the provincial drug watchlist. 2 other drug suspects were also arrested.

On 8 July 2021, a Christian worshipper from Hengyang, Hunan, was arrested in Zhejiang province (coded to Jianggan) during a gospel mission and placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) in Xihu Mountain Villa, Hengyang by Hunan police. He was detained for 20 days, during which he was interrogated days and nights.

actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Around 7 July 2021 (week of), elements of the police killed 1-4 miners in the Sasse mining site, located in the territory of Kambove (Haut-Katanga).

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 7 July 2021, Houthi sniper fire targeted and injured 1 civilian in Habil in Al Jabaliyah (At Tuhayat, Al Hudaydah).

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: On 7 July 2021, in Hto Mar village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), junta forces (coded as military and police) stormed the village and shot and killed a carpenter who was working at a rice mill.

source: Kachin News Group; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 7 July 2021, in Waingmaw township (Myitkyina District, Kachin State), a female street vendor who was selling fruits at a roadside market near Balaminhtin Bridge was shot and killed by a stray bullet fired by a group of military soldiers. The soldiers was reportedly firing at a vehicle that failed to stop for inspection.

On 7 July 2021, a policeman assaulted and injured an INC activist in Karkal village (Udupi, KN) during an investigation into allegations against the activist for making social media posts against soldiers and the government.
On 7 July 2021, police officers killed one civilian in Oshimili South LGA (Delta) [coded to Asaba]. The circumstances of the event are unknown/not reported.

On 7 July 2021, police forces allegedly tortured a Dalit man in police custody at Kahalgaon police station (Bhagalpur, Bihar), following his arrest. The man was allegedly tortured for 5 days, after which he died of injuries on 21 July.
Around 7 July 2021 (as reported), 3 civilians were killed by Afghan forces fire in Nijrab district, Laghman. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 3 fatalities).
Around 7 July 2021 (between 6 July - 8 July), 6 civilians were killed and 31 were wounded by Afghan military attacks in Mehtar Lam city, Laghman. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 6 fatalities).

source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; ANF News
notes: On 6 July 2021, Turkish soldiers opened fire and injured a 15-year-old shepherd in the vicinity of Gungoren village of Dogubayazit, Agri, as he was herding livestock in the area.

actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
notes: On 6 July 2021, a prisoner was physically assaulted by a group of prison guards at Patnos L Type Prison in Patnos, Agri. The prisoner was injured in various parts of his body and taken to hospital for treatment.

source: Kachin News Group; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: On 6 July 2021, in Ywar Thit Gyi village (Mohnyin township, Mohnyin district, Kachin state), a civilian who was returning in an ox cart from a farm was shot and killed by military soldiers after he was accused of not stopping his ox cart. It was reported that more than 20 soldiers were deployed in the village to arrest another villager after they found weapons in the village.

Around 6 July 2021 (as reported), in Dagon Myothit (Seikkan) town (Dagon Myothit-Seikkan township, Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military beat and injured a civilian for allegedly hanging an NLD flag at the Yuzana Garden City.
On 6 July 2021, a youth arrested in connection with a theft case died allegedly due to police beating while in custody at Barakar police station (Salanpur).

actor1: Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 6 July 2021, a prisoner, Kyrone Moore, was assaulted by prison officers at the HMP Nottingham prison in Nottingham after complaining about the condition of his cell. Moore was allegedly tackled to the floor, kicked and punched whilst handcuffed leading to his arm being broken in three places. Moore was transported to hospital for treatment.
On 6 July 2021, in Son Ywar Kone village (Myingyan Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military arrested six villagers. The military tortured the arrested villagers.

On 6 July 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), police shot and killed an unarmed man in Capuchinos sector of San Juan parish. Authorities reported the incident as a clash with organized criminals, but family members disputed this report and insisted instead that it was an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Canada (2015-) RCMP: Royal Canadian Mounted Police
notes: On 6 July 2021, the RCMP killed a 44 year old woman at the Sandy Bay RCMP detachment in Sandy Bay (Saskatchewan) after the woman was taken into custody. The RCMP arrested the victim the previous day 'in relation to an ongoing investigation'. Three hours after being arrested, the woman was found unresponsive and died less than an hour later. One fatality.

On 5 July 2021, a group of soldiers allegedly sent by the driver of the Defense Minister severely beat up and arrested one person in Nkolo neighborhood of Yaounde city, Yaounde 1 subdivision (Mfoundi, Centre). The victim was having a private dispute with the Minister's driver.
On 5 July 2021, regime forces started a security campaign and detained a number of young men in Maadan town in Ar Raqqa countryside for conscription.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) 4th Armored Division
notes: On 5 July 2021, regime 4th Armored Division detained eight young men at Safyan checkpoint in Ar Raqqa countryside, right after they came out from QSD areas, and were headed to Hama city, for the purpose of stealing their cell phones and their money.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards

source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Irrawaddy
notes: On 5 July 2021, in Nyaung Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided villages and randomly fired gunshots. A woman in her 40s was shot dead in Nyaung Kone village. She was riding a motorbike on the Shwebo-Myitkyina highway with her child when soldiers in a military truck shot at them.
On 5 July 2021, Kyun Taw Lay village, Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces killed around 2 civilians.
On 5 July 2021, in villages in Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region) around 15 villagers were killed reported by Myanmar military forces.

On 5 July 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military stopped two youth on a motorcycle for inspection. Afterwards, the military beat and arrested two of them.
Around 5 July 2021 (between 4 - 6 July), in Mingin township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military killed at least 7 civilians.
On 5 July 2021, Turkish soldiers allegedly opened fire and later physically assaulted and beat three local residents near Kavakli village (Hakkari Central District) for an unspecified reason.
On 5 July 2021, 1 Civilian was killed and another one wounded when the Afghan security personnel fired at them in Lashkargah district, Helamand. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).

On 5 July 2021, police seized a human rights defender's house and attacked his former wife at the property in Hebei district in Tianjin (Tianjin). The woman suffered bone fractures after being beaten up by the police. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

actor1: Police Forces of Nepal (2015-) Armed Police Force
notes: On 5 July 2021, 5 officers of APF allegedly assaulted a mentally unstable adolescent at customs checkpoint in Nepalgunj city (Banke district), over the pretext of searching for cannabis. The victim sustained injuries on his hands, body, and head as a result of the assault.

On 4 July 2021, the military forces shot and killed one person at Below-Foncha neighborhood of Bamenda town, Bamenda 1 subdivision (Mezam, Nord-Ouest). The army later released a statement saying that they later found out that the victim was an Ambazonian separatist.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); Times (South Africa); News24 (South Africa)
notes: On 4 July 2021, two South African journalists were arrested by members of the military forces, tortured, and later released near the city of Matsapha (Manzini North, Manzini).

On 4 July 2021, members of the Mozambican Defense and Security Forces in Ibo (Ibo, Cabo Delgado) presumably tortured a civilian from Macomia accused of being a spy for an Islamist militia. The man was killed by the soldiers.
On 4 July 2021, police officers attacked and wounded a journalist for allegedly violating the curfew rules in Busiu (Bungokho, Mbale).
On 4 July 2021, five police officers beat and wounded a trader for allegedly violating the curfew rules in Soroti (Eastern). No fatalities were reported, and the five police officers were arrested.
On 4 July 2021, a pro-Hadi sniper injured a child in Taizz - Wadi Jadid (Al Qahirah).

On 4 July 2021, in Thegone village near Hopin town (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), more than 30 military soldiers entered a monastery and beat up monks and villagers, and destroyed properties in the monastery. Military troops reportedly raided the monastery after there were claims of weapons hidden in the monastery.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
assoc_actor_2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic); Pastoralists (Central African Republic)
notes: On 4 July 2021, FACA forces attacked and killed five Fulani herders in Ngaoundaye (Lim, Ouham-Pende). Reasons for the act unclear.
On 4 July 2021, three police officers raped a 17-year-old boy at a police station in Ulan-Ude, by placing an object (allegedly a plastic bottle) into his rectum.
On 3 July 2021, police and military officers attacked and killed a man for allegedly violating the coronavirus curfew rules in Mbaare (Bukanga, Isingiro).
On 3 July 2021, a drug suspect was wounded during a police raid in Barangay Mangilag Sur (Candelaria, Quezon, Calabarzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the suspect.
On 3 July 2021, in a gambling spot in Bhamo town (Bhamo District, Kachin State), one civilian who was gambling was shot and killed by Myanmar police forces.

On 3 July 2021, police officers charged batons at a photo journalist in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district), while the latter was covering a report of a torch rally organized by the students of five-party alliance. The victim sustained injuries on his knee as a result of the assault.

actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
notes: Around 3 July 2021 (between 2 - 4 July), in Barquisimeto (Lara), PNB officers killed a released prisoner and his body was found in a morgue. The victim, who had been released from jail two months prior, was considering fleeing the country for fear of extrajudicial persecution when his family reported he disappeared on the way to a police hearing on 2 August. They then discovered his body in a morgue on 4 August. Police officials state the victim died in an armed clash on 3 August, but family members rejected the official version from state forces, reporting the crime was an extrajudicial killing. 1 fatality.

actor1: Police Forces of Kyrgyzstan (2017-2020) State Committee for National Security
notes: On 3 July 2021, a male officer of the State Committee for National Security sexually assaulted a female passenger in his personal automobile in the village of Besh-Kungey in Alamudun district of Chui region following which a victim filed a police report. Bishkek city police department opened a criminal case on attempted rape charge.

On 3 July 2021, in Moron, Ciego de Avila, Ciego de Avila, reportedly military officers beat a female social activist. The victim reported that the attackers were dressed as civilians but were recognized as military officers. After beating her, they escaped in a vehicle that was waiting for them. No fatalities. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 2 July 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad Valles, San Luis Potosi, the Ciudad Valles police chief entered a home in Colonia Diana without apparently having a search warrant and beat a woman who told him that he could not enter without such a warrant. The attack was recorded and circulated on social networks. The victim was injured.

On 2 July 2021, near Ton Huong village in Dawthponeyan sub-township (Momauk Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), Myanmar military troops indiscriminately fired gunshots after being attacked by the KIA with landmines (landmine attack coded separately). The gunshots injured a 60-year-old man and 3-year-old girl who were living at a farm field. Location coded as Ton Huong Yang.

actor1: Police Forces of Iran (1989-) Islamic Republic of Iran Border Guard Command
notes: On 2 July 2021, Iranian border guards shot and killed a Baloch civilian in the environs of Hong village (Sistan and Baluchestan) after reportedly raiding the resting place of the civilian and several others who were travelling through the area. The border guards reportedly fled after the shooting.

source: Irrawaddy; Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency
notes: On 2 July 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), two former executive members of the NLD party were killed by Myanmar military forces and its affiliate Pyu Saw Htee group. After the murder, one other civilian nearby was arrested by Myanmar military forces.

source: Dhaka Tribune; United News of Bangladesh; Daily Observer (Bangladesh); Daily Star (Bangladesh)
notes: Around 2 July 2021 (as reported), a woman accused of murder was allegedly tortured and sexually assaulted by police while in custody at Ujirpur police station in Barisal city (Barisal Sadar).

On 2 July 2021, a man was severely beaten by the police on two occasions: as he was being escorted to a police station after being caught illegally carrying passengers in a car and while inside a cell in Zomba (Zomba City, Southern). During the attack in the cell, the man claims he was attacked by three officers, two in civilian clothes. He was taken to the hospital.

On 2 July 2021, Punjab police constable killed a man in Sadiqabad district (Rahim Yar Khan, Punjab), who was acquitted of blasphemy charges last year. The arrested constable said that he killed the man as he committed blasphemy last year.
On 1 July 2021, regime forces stationed at a checkpoint near al Omari mosque in Kanaker in Dar'a discharged small arms fire wounding a woman. No fatalities were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
notes: On 1 July 2021, in Guariba, Sao Paulo, three military police officers assaulted a civilian man using a piece of wood. Witnesses recorded the crime in which it shows one officer holding the victim and two others beating him and threatening witnesses of the scene.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Irrawaddy
notes: On 1 July 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), a young man was arrested by military forces in Monywa Industrial Zone in the afternoon. AAPP stated that he was arrested while helping injured people during a bomb blast a factory in the industrial zone. His family was informed to retrieve his body five hours after his arrest. His family found that his head and neck were blood-soaked and his face looked as if it had been dragged along a floor.

source: Kachin News Group; Democratic Voice of Burma; Network Media Group
notes: On 1 July 2021, in Waingmaw town (Waingmaw Township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), security forces (coded as military and police) raided a house that was preparing to hold a house prayer service. Security forces opened fire and killed one person during the raid. At least 30 people were reportedly taken away, including at least five children under the age of 18.

On 1 July 2021, 2 drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Poblacion (Polomolok, South Cotabato, Soccsksargen). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects, who police identified to be part of the town's database of drug pushers.
Around 1 July 2021 (as reported), a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Dela Paz, Antipolo City (Rizal, Calabarzon).
On 1 July 2021, a police officer physically assaulted a journalist in Moscow - Central after he started filming the allegedly brutal arrest of a man by the police officer.

actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
source: ANF News; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey
notes: On 1 July 2021, a prisoner was tortured by a group of prison guards at Elazig No:2 high security prison in Elazig Prison compound, reportedly for objecting to a strip search imposed upon him during his arrival at the prison after being transferred from another facility. No other information on the means or the results of the attack was provided.
On 1 July 2021, teachers, arrested during a demonstration during the day (coded separately), were allegedly tortured by police officers in Uige (Uige, Uige) and later released.

On 1 July 2021, two married rights defenders were escorted from a relief centre (for petitioners) on 200 or 500 Fucun Rd, Putuo district (Shanghai) to a 'black jail' near their home in Jing'an district. Another two were taken away from the same place to be placed under 'soft detention' in Xishan, Suzhou province (not house arrest). The 'disappearances' were enforced by the local government of Jing'an district. The four belonged to a group of nine Shanghai-based rights defenders brought to the relief centre after commemorating the passing of a pioneer in the rights defending movement. The five remaining defenders were picked up by officers from their local government and remained incommunicado as of 3 Jul 2021.

On 1 July 2021, a local resident was detained by police in Krasnodar, a few days after an earlier arrest, during which he sent a video to his sister claiming officers were pressuring him into confessing to a crime. The man was found dead following the second arrest, with doctors concluding he had been beaten. The victim's family claim the man was killed in police custody.
On 1 July 2021, 1 civilian was killed by Afghan forces fire in the Jernamo area of Nawa-i-Barikzayi district, Helmand. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).

On 1 July 2021, regular forces (presumed to be SAF) shot and killed three South Sudanese civilians (who hail from an unspecified area(s) of Upper Nile state) in Omdurman (Omdurman locality, Khartoum state), a day after South Sudanese civilians had prevented drunken soldiers from entering their house. The attackers then went to the nearby market, killing two residents of the area (coded as Sudanese) and wounding 'dozens', and burning shops. Authorities arrested the culprits, who were subsequently released.

source: Radio Publique Africaine; IWACU; SOS Medias
notes: On 30 June 2021, police abducted and killed a young man of Tutsi ethnicity after he was released on presidential pardon in Kivumu (Mugamba, Bururi). The local population vocalized the ongoing mistreatment (beatings and torture) of political opponents and Tutsis in this commune by the police. Another person who witnessed the killing was abducted and has not been found.

actor1: Police Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project
notes: On 30 June 2021, Houthi forces attacked 2 civilians near Al Murur qat Market in Dhamar City, hitting them with the back of their rifles, and arrested them. According to the source, the two civilians were criticizing the corruption of the local authorities, the deterioration of the living conditions, and were discussing the need for a popular armed uprising.

assoc_actor_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Prisoners (Myanmar)
source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: Around 30 June 2021 (between 29 - 30 June), in Pin Ta Le village (Wundwin Township, Meiktila District, Mandalay Region), an NLD village tract chair who was arrested on 29 June was reportedly beaten by military forces stationed at Pin Ta Le hospital. He died the next day on 30 June, although the military claimed that he had died from COVID-19.

On 30 June 2021, in Pyay Kan village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the military and Pyu Saw Htee jointly raided the village at around 11pm, firing 30 shots around the village. A villager was reportedly beaten up and arrested. Houses of NLD supporters were also destroyed.

Around 30 June 2021 (between 29 June - 1 July), in Pyay township (Pyay district, Bago region), a man who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) on 29 June later died while in custody. His family was asked to retrieve his body on 1 July. His family found that his entire body had torture marks and bruises while his chest had been stitched together. Security forces claimed that he died of an epileptic seizure.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 30 June 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in one of regime prisons coded to Sidnaya Military Prison, after seven years of his arrest.

On 30 June 2021, a drug murder suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Sawa (Mabuhay, Zamboanga Sibugay, Zamboanga Peninsula). Police said that they retrieved illegal drug paraphernalia from the slain suspect.
Around 30 June 2021 (as reported), 1 civilian was shot and killed by Afghan forces fire in Alishing district, Laghman. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).
On 30 June 2021, a police officer in Sovetsky town (Mari El) physically assaulted and beat a man at a police station while interrogating him.

assoc_actor_2: Independent Politicians (Bahrain); Former Government of Bahrain (1999-)
source: AhlulBayt News Agency; LuaLua TV; Twitter; ADHRB; Al Jazeera

assoc_actor_2: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Malual Clan Group (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
notes: On 30 June 2021, an SSPDF Sergeant Major shot and killed a woman (presumed to be Malual Dinka) during a land dispute in the Ariath area of Aweil North county (Northern Bahr el Ghazal state). The soldier is in police custody.

On 29 June 2021, police shot without warning at 2 Baloch civilians riding a motorcycle in Bam County (Kerman) killing them both. They were shot on suspicion of carrying drugs though none were reported found.

source: Twitter; Carta de Mocambique; VOA; Club Mozambique
notes: On 29 June 2021, a group of four journalists in Nampula (Nampula, Nampula) were beaten by police officers, as they tried to confirm rumors about an alleged illegal detention of three young people from 'Mentes Resilientes', a civil society organization. One journalist had his camera stolen.

actor1: Military Forces of Chad (2021-) Republican Guard
notes: On 29 June 2021, a DGSSIE officer opened fire on a civilian in the Hong Kong Sabagali hotel in NDjamena (Ndjamena), injuring him.
On 29 June 2021, a commando of military officers in a 'drone' beat and injured civilians, abducting a man in Kawempe (Kampala, Central).

On 29 June 2021, a commando of 9 military officers in a 'drone' abducted and tortured some NUP supporters, who had published on the social network fake news about the death of Museveni, in Mutundwe Campus (Kampala, Central). Victims were injured, but no fatalities were reported. Victims were then released and the military officers were arrested.

source: Diario Primicia; Caraota Digital; El Carabobeno
notes: Around 29 June 2021 (as reported), in Carabobo state (coded to Valencia), police officials abducted an elderly man, demanding a ransom for his release. The hostage was released in good condition, although it was unknown whether the ransom was paid or the perpetrators were arrested. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

source: El Carabobeno; Diario Primicia; Caraota Digital
notes: Around 29 June 2021 (as reported), in Sucre state (coded to Cumana), police officials abducted a man and his son whilst the latter were on their quest to buy a second-hand vehicle. Four of the perpetrators were arrested thereafter. No further information on the circumstances of the event was reported. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

Around 29 June 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad Bolivar (Bolivar state), a civilian was shot and killed by a police official in a wooded area located in La Sabanita sector. It was reported the perpetrator simulated a shoot-out with the victim as a way to cover up the killing. The motivation or further circumstances of the event, however, were unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 29 June 2021 (between 26 June - 1 July), in Shwedaung town (Shwedaung township, Pyay district, Bago region), a 19-year-old boy who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) on 26 June later died on 1 July while in custody. His body was cremated by security forces without the permission of his family. He was first arrested by security forces after he was filmed shouting insults at the military's commander-in chief. Security forces claimed that he died from internal bleeding, while some residents claimed that they saw security forces beating the detainee while they were taking him to the military base.

On 29 June 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Platero (General Mamerto Natividad, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
source: Prothom Alo; New Age (Bangladesh); Dhaka Tribune; United News of Bangladesh; Daily Star (Bangladesh)
notes: On 29 June 2021, a Bangladeshi cattle trader was shot dead by India's Border Security Force (BSF) personnel near the Patgram border, coded as Bagdogra city (Darjeeling, West Bengal), when he went near the border along with a group of cattle traders to bring cattle.

source: Le Nouvelliste; Haiti Press Network; Alterpresse; RNDDH: National Human Rights Defense Network
notes: On 29 June 2021, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men arrived in Christ-Roi and Delmas 32 neighbourhoods and started shooting at the residents, killing 19 people, among them a journalist of the radio Vision 2000 and a political activist. According to police authorities, the killing is linked to the assassination of a police officer perpetrated by armed men a few hours earlier. The authorities claim that police officers affiliated with the Fantom 509 might be responsible for the killings. 19 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: VDP: Volunteer for Defense of Homeland
notes: On 29 June 2021, soldiers and volunteer fighters killed two militant suspects in the area of Gorgadji (Gorgadji, Seno).

On 29 June 2021, a drug suspect was killed while another was arrested during a police raid in Barangay North Baluarte, Iloilo City (Iloilo, Western Visayas). Police said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the drug suspects. However, the fatality's family disputed the police account, and the Commission on Human Rights has said that it plans to investigate the incident as a case of mistaken identity.

On 28 June 2021, a police officer opened fire against 3 trial-waiting inmates at a police station in Rundu (Rundu Rural West, Kavango East). 2 of the inmates were hospitalized, the third one was slightly injured. Reports vary regarding what led to the event.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council

source: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia; Myanmar Labour News; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners

AAPP and Myanmar Now reported that one was killed while one was injured. The military forces took away both the two civilians.

On 28 June 2021, a female petitioner from Xiaogan, Hubei was intercepted by officials from her hometown while transiting at the bus station in Xiao village (Changping, Beijing). She was detained at the Hongbo Grand Hotel after they escorted her back to Xiaogan prefecture.

source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Nigeria Security Tracker; Daily Trust (Nigeria)
notes: On 28 June 2021, the police attacked the community of Ajaawa (Ogo-Oluwa LGA, Oyo). Three people were killed, while at least 10 others were injured. It is suspected that the police have been carrying out attacks ordered by an 'Ade master'.

On 28 June 2021, a man was beaten and injured by soldiers in Kafanchan (Jema'a LGA, Kaduna) as he went to the soldiers' barracks to request the body of his brother, killed earlier during a students demonstration (coded separately).

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 28 June 2021 (as reported), a man died under torture in one of regime prisons coded to Sidnaya Military Prison, after he had been arrested in 2020.

On 28 June 2021, between Moe Bye town and Pekon town (coded as Moe Bye) (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), a man who was riding a motorcycle from Moe Bye town to Pekon town was shot and killed by the Myanmar military LIB 422 in the evening.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: On 28 June 2021, three prison guards beat and tortured four prisoners in a recovery farm for inmates near Anaka (Nwoya, Northern). One prisoner was killed due to the tortures, and the other three were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
source: Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen)
notes: On 28 June 2021, a Houthi sniper stationed in the Central Security Camp injured 1 civilian in Taizz - Kalabah (Inside) (Salh) in the northeast of the city.

On 28 June 2021, Malian soldiers of the G5 Sahel Force shot at a group of pastoralist women in the hamlet of Boulmataka (Douentza, Mopti). Two girls were killed and two others were wounded. [women targeted: girls]

On 28 June 2021, government security forces (SNA) shot and killed a man suspected to be associated with Al Shabaab militants in Gufguduud Burey village (Baydhaba, Bay). The circumstances surrounding on the killing of the AS suspected man is unclear yet.

actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
source: Oregonian; NewsChannel 21; Portland Mercury; KATU; Oregon Public Broadcasting; Portland Police Department; Fox12 Oregon; KOIN6
notes: On 24 June 2021, a police officer shot and killed a man outside a Motel 6 near the Oregon Convention Center in Portland - Northeast (Oregon) after the victim walked towards the officers with a screwdriver. Police were first called to the motel for a welfare check and on reports of a suicidal man. Initially, the officers met and talked with the man outside. He then agreed to go to the hospital with them, but reportedly became agitated when police told him they needed to pat him down before he could get into an ambulance. Video footage shows the man getting up from the stairs he was sitting on and walking towards the officers with one arm in the air, apparently holding something. The officers backed up and after 7 seconds one of the officers shot the victim from about 8-12 feet away. The man was taken by ambulance to Legacy Emanuel Medical Center, where he later died. The shooting sparked almost immediate demonstrations against the actions of police and initial reports identified the man as a person of color. The victim was later identified as an 'adult white male.'

According to the officers' version, security forces arrived at the site after receiving reports of armed men being at the site. The recording of security cameras later revealed that this version was false and officials retained an estimate of 20 workers at the shop. According to footage, officials also stole 1.5 million pesos, a pick-up truck, and more than half a tone of beer. The owner of the said shop informed that the attack was carried out in retaliation after he voted for a PAN candidate running for local elections. Investigations were underway. At least 3 injured.

notes: On 18 June 2021, Houthi forces hanged a civilian in Ibb city (Al Mashannah) after he refused to abide by the 'khums' tax law. According to the source, Houthi authorities demanded that the civilian, who worked as a rock transporter, should pay a fifth of the value of every rock shipment he transported as tax. The 'khums' tax law, which was decreed in April 2020, entitles Houthi authorities, because of Hashemite lineage, to a 20% tax on all profit generated though economic activity that involves natural resources.

Police looted and destroyed equipment inside the temple. The temple belonged to a Black Candomble priest, which is why human right defenders claimed the attack was fueled by intolerance towards minority and vulnerable groups. Victims are asking for compensation from the public authorities due to police abuse. There were no fatalities.

A man who was sleeping on the roof in one of the villages was shot during the raid.

The woman had recently arrived in the United States as an undocumented immigrant and was sitting in the backseat of a car in Nogales when she was shot. According to the victim, a Border Patrol agent shot at the moving vehicle as the driver slowed down to yield to the officers' signal to pull over. The woman survived, but was left disabled by the severe injuries incurred by the attack. She filed a lawsuit against Customs and Border Patrol in December 2021. No public information was released regarding the Border Patrol and FBI investigations into the incident.

Around 15 June 2021 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Magdalena), police detained and beat up two women for not wearing masks during the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. 2 injured, no fatalities.

source: VOA; BBC News; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Democratic Voice of Burma
notes: On 15 June 2021, in Kin Ma village in Pauk town (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), a group of police officers stormed the village and reportedly torched the entire village. Myanmar military fired several gunshots in the village and a man was shot and wounded during the raid. DVB reported that two elderly people were killed in the fire, while some aid groups claimed that at least five villagers were killed. About 225 out of 240 houses in the village were burned down. State-run media however blamed the fire on about 40 members of a local people's defense force group, stating that there was no casualties.

On 15 June 2021, in Kun Saik village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), two villagers who were arrested and detained by military forces on 15 June were tortured and died while in custody on the same day. The military ordered a charitable organization to bury their bodies while making a confession not to disclose details of the burial. It was said that one of them was the son of an NLD member.

On 15 June 2021, officers from the Xinpaifang Police Station harassed and beat up an elderly woman in front of the Tiangongdian Police Station in Yubei district (Chongqing) under the orders of their station chief. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 15 June 2021, at the Ywar Be ward in Pyay town (Pyay Township, Pyay District, Bago-West Region), the Myanmar military and police fired gunshots at a young man. The man was injured and arrested. The military regime previously issued an arrest warrant against him under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.
On 15 June 2021, in Pyigyitagon township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military strengthened the security measures and shot a civilian dead.

Around 15 June 2021 (month of), two soldiers (most likely stormtroopers) dispatched to install barriers and high-voltage wire fences on the border between North Korea and China killed two civilians in Hoeryong City. The soldiers killed them as the civilians caught them stealing food. It is believed that the incident occurred due to food shortages in military units, which led the soldiers to steal. The soldiers ran away and their whereabouts are unknown.

On 15 June 2021, a patient - infected with AIDS due to contamination by a pharmaceutics manufacturer in 2004 - was 'forcibly placed under activity and access restrictions' at the Fifth People's Hospital of Suzhou in Canglang district, Suzhou prefecture (Jiangsu) (coded to Gusu). He was already admitted to a hospital ward at the time, but was suddenly placed under 24-hour monitoring by a dozen state security and police officers for unspecified reasons. They confiscated his phone and ID card, forbade him from leaving, and denied others from entering the ward. The victim had frequently encountered 'restrictions' during major political occasions so to stop him from petitioning about his AIDS infection accident.

On 15 June 2021, military forces in Port Sudan (Port Sudan, Red Sea) attacked citizens after they left a mosque. One person was killed and 12 injured. The forces arrested dozens of citizens, on charges of violating a curfew imposed after recent conflicts in the area.

Around 15 June 2021, police officers of the Pervomaisky district police station beat a female witness near Oktyabr district of Bishkek city which was reported by the country's Ombudsman's office resulting in re-investigation of the case.

On 15 June 2021, in Habana, La Habana, a woman was beaten up by police officers during the arrest of her partner and activist. This event takes place amid increased legislation and measures taken to repress political opposition ahead of the next general elections. [women targeted: political party supporters]

The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 4 June 2021, in Padan town (Ngape Township, Minbu District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces fired shots at three civilians riding on a motorbike and attempted to arrest them. No injuries reported, and the three civilians escaped unharmed.

On 4 June 2021, mear Kyun Ka Lay village along the Yangon-Mandalay Highway in Hlegu Township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), Myanmar military forces inspecting the vehicles fired shots into a car after the car refused to be inspected. One civilian was killed. One other was arrested with a pistol.

On 4 June 2021, in Moe Bye town (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military broke into a church and took away three men and a 17-year-old-boy who were on security duty at the church. They were reportedly beaten up and used as human shields during fighting. The 17-year-old was forced to wear a bag with a bomb.

actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Assam Rifles
notes: On 4 June 2021, troops of 44 Assam Rifles including an army Major allegedly shot dead a villager at Chalwa village (Kangpokpi district, Manipur) when they were carrying out an operation. The victim succumbed to his injuries on the way to the hospital.

On 4 June 2021, police officers threw tear gas and LBD bullets at residents of Saint-Denis during a wake, including at children and a pregnant woman who was rushed to the hospital. No fatalities were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 4 June 2021 (as reported), a regime soldier died under torture in an unidentified regime prison following his arrest in 15th March 2013 in Hama city. Unknown location coded to Sidnaya Military Prison.

Around 4 June 2021 (as reported), two police officers attached to KBC Police Station in Matungulu Sub County in Joska town (Matungulu, Matungulu West, Machakos) tortured and killed a civilian in the police cell. They were later arrested.

assoc_actor_2: Women (Myanmar); Buddhist Group (Myanmar); Palaung/Ta'ang Ethnic Group (Myanmar)
source: Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; Shan Herald Agency for News
notes: Around 4 June 2021 (week of), in Nam Hpat Kar village (Kutkai township, Muse district, Shan-North), a 14-year-old ethnic Ta'ang Buddhist nun was raped twice by a soldier from Bridge-99 who was stationed at the monastery. She was offered 500,000 kyats and asked to leave the monastery out of fear that the news would spread. [women targeted: girls]

On 4 June 2021, Indonesian police and military forces allegedly killed the family of the Nipurlema village head in Ilaga district (Puncak regency, Papua province). Three people died, while three others sustained gunshot wounds. The authority and mainstream media accused TPNPB as the perpetrator. However, a report by the Justice, Peace and Integrity of Creation Desk of the Papuan Tabernacle Church (JPIC Kingmi Papua) quoted by Human Rights Papua identified security forces as the perpetrator. All victims were Papuans.

On 3 June 2021, a 31-year-old man was physically assaulted and tortured by police officers in Shostka, Sumy, to extract a forced confession of theft. The victim filed a report with the State Bureau of Investigation, which is investigating the police brutality incident.

source: Radio Free Asia; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
notes: On 3 June 2021, in Monywa town, Monywa township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) fired 4-5 shots and killed a man when he did not stop his motorcycle for an inspection. RFA and AAPP reported one killed.

On 3 June 2021, in Kyaung Soe village (Kyauktaga township, Bago district, Bago-East), police arrested four family members at around 11pm after they failed to find the two targeted teachers who were on strike in support of the civil disobedience movement against the military coup. Locals stated that security forces fired shots and beat up the family members during the arrest.

On 3 June 2021, near Myauk See village, Kale Township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), three villagers who were returning from fishing were shot and wounded by military forces stationed at the police station. Military soldiers reportedly chased, shot and arrested the villagers.

On 3 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested and beat up two people for being involved in the Sein Pan anti-coup protest group.

On 3 June 2021, in South Okkalapa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), regime forces (coded as military and police) raided a residential area and fired around 20 shots. Four youths were shot and wounded while trying to evade arrest. Two of them managed to escape, while two others were detained. One of the youths reportedly sustained serious injuries. The reason for their arrests was not known.

On 3 June 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-north District, Yangon region), a man was beaten by security forces (coded as military and police) in Ward 10 and forced to take his daughter to school. Schools had been reopened by the military junta during this week despite strong opposition from anti-coup supporters.

On 3 June 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), a photographer living in Market Quarter was beaten and arrested at his home by about 20 members of security forces (coded as military and police) at midnight. During the raid, security forces also beat up his mother, sister and another boy. Six other people were also arrested by security forces in Taunggyi on the same night.

On 3 June 2021, local authorities captured and detained a rights defender at a hotel 'black jail' in Panjin prefecture (Liaoning) (coded to Xinglongtai). The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.
Around 3 June 2021 (as reported), 2 civilians were killed and 2 were wounded by Afghan forces attacks in Kunduz city. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2 fatalities).

On 3 June 2021, a detainee died in police custody in Klang (Selangor). The police claimed the victim died during a scuffle with a policeman, as the victim jumped through the window. However, his family suspected foul play. The victim died with severe facial injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Special Forces
notes: On 3 June 2021, government security forces (Bancroft/Danab) shot and killed a civilian driver of a mini bus in Defow settlement in Mareerey village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 2 June 2021, Iranian armed forces shot and killed a Kurdish businessman near Balkeh village (Kurdistan), suspecting him of transporting smuggled goods, though he was reported as carrying no goods at all at the time.

actor1: Military Forces of Iran (1989-) Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps
notes: On 2 June 2021, Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) forces fired on a vehicle transporting Afghan citizens in the Rutak border area of Khash County (Sistan and Baluchestan) injuring the driver, a Baloch civilian. Any injuries or fatalities among the Afghan citizens were not reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On 2 June 2021, Houthi forces shot and injured two children in Taizz - Al Kamb (Salh, Taizz). No reports of fatalities.
On 2 June 2021, the military forces killed at least 7 people during a raid in Ekuru, Abua and Zoeche villages, in Nkambe town, Ako subdivision (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest).

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 2 June 2021, police and Imbonerakure attacked and injured a woman and abducted a retired police officer around Gasenyi zone (Buganda, Cibitoke). He has yet to be found.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 2 June 2021, SNR agents abducted a civilian in Burambi commune (Rumonge). He has not been found since the abduction.
On 2 June 2021, police officers, in the line of duty, reportedly abused their power and beat up farmers in Kharkiv region.

source: Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma; Shan Herald Agency for News
notes: On 2 June 2021, around Moe Bye town (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military shot two civilians with sniper. AAPP reported that one of them was shot in the forehead and died, while the other was seriously injured.

On 2 June 2021, a citizen was forced to sit in a torture chair at the Yuejincun Police Station in Dadukou district (Chongqing) during a four-hour interrogation. He had been taken in on the same day for filming a petitioner being beaten up by unidentified persons related to the police.

On 2 June 2021, in Pan Lin village (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), a former ward administrator was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police). The administrator was reportedly beaten by security forces. He was charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

On 2 June 2021, in Sone Chaung village, Yinmarbin township (coded as Yinmarbin) (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed the village and arrested five villagers. Security forces also opened fire at a villager who was watching from inside his house as they arrived in the village, hitting the villager in his thigh.

On 2 June 2021, in Myingyan town, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay Region), two civilians riding a motorcycle were shot and wounded in their legs and arms after military forces fired shots at them.

On 2 June 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), the military arrested eight youths after an informant reported that they were allegedly storing weapons. Four of them were tied up and beaten near the Zayar Thiri Monastery.

On 2 June 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), five daily-wage workers who were working at a construction of the Mingalardon Military Hospital were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). One of them later died on 3 June, reportedly due to torture by the security forces.

assoc_actor_2: Tamil Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka); Prisoners (Sri Lanka)
notes: On 2 June 2021, personnel belonging to the police intelligence division allegedly beat up and killed a Tamil youth in custody in Batticaloa city (Manmunai North).

actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
notes: On 2 June 2021, a couple who attempted to defect was beaten by the border guards after being arrested near the Tumen River in Hoeryong City. While the woman was sent to a Ministry of State Security office in Hoeryeong for further investigation, her boyfriend was transported to the one in South Hamgyong province.

On 2 June 2021, a petitioner was rounded up and beaten by three to four stability maintenance officers in the hallway in front of his house in Dadukou district (Chongqing). When his friend (also a petitioner) came by to visit and decided to record the scene, the men snatched his phone. After the two petitioners reported the incident, all parties were taken in to Yuejincun Police Station, and an officer requested for the recorded video to be deleted from the petitioner's phone.

On 2 June 2021, two petitioners, who were a married couple, were forcibly taken away by 5-6 police officers and district committee officers from their house in Hongmiaozi Residential District of Saybag District (Urumqi, Xinjiang), during which the officers beat up the wife. The wife was then taken to a police station and threatened to delete her posts on social media about her suffering. Both of them ended up being detained at a 'black jail' in Cangfanggou for over eight months, as reported on 13 March 2022.

On 2 June 2021, government security forces (Custodial Corps) attacked a convoy carrying former Somalia's president passing at the checkpoint near the Fish Market neighborhood in Mogadishu - Hamar Weyne district (Banadir). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: On 2 June 2021, military forces (National Intelligence Agency) abducted a soldier (assumed off duty) in Buganda commune (Cibitoke). He has not been found since the abduction.

actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 1 June 2021 (month of), in Habana, La Habana, an activist who had been imprisoned for a month reported, having been victim of torture (isolation and deprivation of sleep) by police officers while in prison.

On 1 June 2021, a farmer placed under long-term residential surveillance - since his release from labour camp in 2019 - was beaten up by one of the guards deployed by the Caijiagang Sub-District Government (location coded to Beibei district, Chongqing). The guard pressed against him, and stoned him. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 1 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed a Buddhist monastery and fired either rubber bullets or live rounds at monks who were holding a prayer service for the release of those detained by the military junta. A monk was injured while fleeing. No arrests were made.

On 1 June 2021, in Pakokku town, Pakokku township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), Myanmar military soldiers stationed at a security gate near Innwa Bank fired shots at two youths on a motorcycle after the youths shouted at them. The bullets did not hit the youths. As they run away, they crashed into a car, and both of them were injured.
On 1 June 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military soldiers insulted a monk and shot him dead.
On 1 June 2021, in Hkawng Mong village (coded as Hkawng Mong Thit) (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military detained and beat a 29-year-old man.

Around 1 June 2021 (as reported), a police officer assaulted a woman at a bus park with a cane in Bidur municipality-4 (Nuwakot district), reportedly following a dispute between a husband and a wife. Police are further investigating the incident.

actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
source: ANF News; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey
notes: On 1 June 2021, a female prisoner was tortured by prison guards in Diyarbakir women prison (coded as Diyarbakir Prison Compound) in Kayapinar, Diyarbakir. Source reported that there were bruises, swellings, wounds and cuts all over the prisoner's body, including her face, back, arms and legs due to the physical violence she was subject to.

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 1 June 2021 (as reported), a student died under torture in one of regime prisons coded to Sidnaya Military Prison, after he was arrested in 2015.

On 1 June 2021, 1 child was shot and killed by policemen in front of a police HQ in Helmand province. His mother was shot and killed during a second attack when she came to get her son's body. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2 fatalities).
On 1 June 2021, 2 civilians were killed by policemen in Nawa-i-Barikzayi district center (Nawa-e Barakzayi), Helmand. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2 fatalities).

On 1 June 2021, in Mingalar Taung Nyunt township (Mingalartaungnyunt, Yangon-East district, Yangon region), two explosions, the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrived at the scene, and interrogated taxi driver and young people around the area, and beat them.
On 1 June 2021, a minor girl was sexually assaulted by a military officer on a train near Lonand town (Satara, Maharashtra). [women targeted: girls]
On 1 June 2021, 8 civilians were wounded or killed by Afghan forces attacks in the Logari and Baghlaki areas of Nahreen district, Baghlan.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
notes: On 1 June 2021, a drug suspect was killed during a joint PDEA and police raid in Barangay Bolton (Malalag, Davao del Sur, Davao Region). Authorities said that they retrieved shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they identified to be a high-value target on the joint PDEA-PNP provincial drug watchlist.
On 1 June 2021, police assaulted a journalist at Gwadar city (Balochistan) while he was covering the arrest of a JI leader and forced him to stop reporting.

On 1 June 2021, two police officers assaulted a Senior Health Assistant of Koshi Hospital at Devkota chowk in Biratnagar city (Morang district), while he was heading home after finishing his duty. The victim sustained injuries in his leg and knee as a result of the assault.
